Bug Summary

File:option.c
Location:line 2569, column 9
Description:Value stored to 'nextchar' is never read

Annotated Source Code

1/*
2 * VIM - Vi IMproved by Bram Moolenaar
3 *
4 * Do ":help uganda" in Vim to read copying and usage conditions.
5 * Do ":help credits" in Vim to see a list of people who contributed.
6 * See README.txt for an overview of the Vim source code.
7 */
8
9/*
10 * Code to handle user-settable options. This is all pretty much table-
11 * driven. Checklist for adding a new option:
12 * - Put it in the options array below (copy an existing entry).
13 * - For a global option: Add a variable for it in option_defs.h.
14 * - For a buffer or window local option:
15 * - Add a PV_XX entry to the enum below.
16 * - Add a variable to the window or buffer struct in buffer_defs.h.
17 * - For a window option, add some code to copy_winopt().
18 * - For a buffer option, add some code to buf_copy_options().
19 * - For a buffer string option, add code to check_buf_options().
20 * - If it's a numeric option, add any necessary bounds checks to do_set().
21 * - If it's a list of flags, add some code in do_set(), search for WW_ALL.
22 * - When adding an option with expansion (P_EXPAND), but with a different
23 * default for Vi and Vim (no P_VI_DEF), add some code at VIMEXP.
24 * - Add documentation! One line in doc/help.txt, full description in
25 * options.txt, and any other related places.
26 * - Add an entry in runtime/optwin.vim.
27 * When making changes:
28 * - Adjust the help for the option in doc/option.txt.
29 * - When an entry has the P_VIM flag, or is lacking the P_VI_DEF flag, add a
30 * comment at the help for the 'compatible' option.
31 */
32
33#define IN_OPTION_C
34#include <errno(*__errno_location ()).h>
35#include <inttypes.h>
36#include <stdbool.h>

82
83/*
84 * The options that are local to a window or buffer have "indir" set to one of
85 * these values. Special values:
86 * PV_NONE: global option.
87 * PV_WIN is added: window-local option
88 * PV_BUF is added: buffer-local option
89 * PV_BOTH is added: global option which also has a local value.
90 */
91#define PV_BOTH0x1000 0x1000
92#define PV_WIN0x2000 0x2000
93#define PV_BUF0x4000 0x4000
94#define PV_MASK0x0fff 0x0fff
95#define OPT_WIN(x)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(x)) (idopt_T)(PV_WIN0x2000 + (int)(x))
96#define OPT_BUF(x)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(x)) (idopt_T)(PV_BUF0x4000 + (int)(x))
97#define OPT_BOTH(x)(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)(x)) (idopt_T)(PV_BOTH0x1000 + (int)(x))
98
99/*
100 * Definition of the PV_ values for buffer-local options.
101 * The BV_ values are defined in option_defs.h.
102 */
103#define PV_AI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AI)) OPT_BUF(BV_AI)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AI))
104#define PV_AR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AR)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_AR))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AR))))
105# define PV_BH(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BH)) OPT_BUF(BV_BH)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BH))
106# define PV_BT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BT)) OPT_BUF(BV_BT)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BT))
107# define PV_EFM(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EFM)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_EFM))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EFM))))
108# define PV_GP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_GP)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_GP))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_GP))))
109# define PV_MP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MP)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_MP))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MP))))
110#define PV_BIN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BIN)) OPT_BUF(BV_BIN)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BIN))
111#define PV_BL(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BL)) OPT_BUF(BV_BL)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BL))
112# define PV_BOMB(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BOMB)) OPT_BUF(BV_BOMB)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BOMB))
113#define PV_CI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CI)) OPT_BUF(BV_CI)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CI))
114# define PV_CIN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CIN)) OPT_BUF(BV_CIN)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CIN))
115# define PV_CINK(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINK)) OPT_BUF(BV_CINK)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINK))
116# define PV_CINO(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINO)) OPT_BUF(BV_CINO)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINO))
117# define PV_CINW(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINW)) OPT_BUF(BV_CINW)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINW))
118#define PV_CM(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CM)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_CM))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CM))))
119# define PV_CMS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CMS)) OPT_BUF(BV_CMS)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CMS))
120# define PV_COM(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_COM)) OPT_BUF(BV_COM)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_COM))
121# define PV_CPT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CPT)) OPT_BUF(BV_CPT)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CPT))
122# define PV_DICT(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DICT)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_DICT))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DICT))))
123# define PV_TSR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TSR)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_TSR))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TSR))))
124# define PV_CFU(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CFU)) OPT_BUF(BV_CFU)(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CFU))
125# define PV_DEF(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DEF)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_DEF))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DEF))))

173/*
174 * Definition of the PV_ values for window-local options.
175 * The WV_ values are defined in option_defs.h.
176 */
177#define PV_LIST(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_LIST)) OPT_WIN(WV_LIST)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_LIST))
178# define PV_ARAB(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_ARAB)) OPT_WIN(WV_ARAB)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_ARAB))
179# define PV_BRI(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRI)) OPT_WIN(WV_BRI)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRI))
180# define PV_BRIOPT(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRIOPT)) OPT_WIN(WV_BRIOPT)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRIOPT))
181# define PV_DIFF(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_DIFF)) OPT_WIN(WV_DIFF)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_DIFF))
182# define PV_FDC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDC)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDC)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDC))
183# define PV_FEN(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FEN)) OPT_WIN(WV_FEN)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FEN))
184# define PV_FDI(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDI)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDI)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDI))
185# define PV_FDL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDL)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDL)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDL))
186# define PV_FDM(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDM)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDM)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDM))
187# define PV_FML(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FML)) OPT_WIN(WV_FML)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FML))
188# define PV_FDN(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDN)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDN)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDN))
189# define PV_FDE(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDE)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDE)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDE))
190# define PV_FDT(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDT)) OPT_WIN(WV_FDT)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDT))
191# define PV_FMR(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FMR)) OPT_WIN(WV_FMR)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FMR))

193#define PV_NU(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_NU)) OPT_WIN(WV_NU)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_NU))

196# define PV_PVW(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_PVW)) OPT_WIN(WV_PVW)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_PVW))

202# define PV_CUC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUC)) OPT_WIN(WV_CUC)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUC))
203# define PV_CUL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUL)) OPT_WIN(WV_CUL)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUL))
204# define PV_CC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CC)) OPT_WIN(WV_CC)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CC))
205# define PV_STL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_WIN(WV_STL))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL))))
206#define PV_UL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UL)))) OPT_BOTH(OPT_BUF(BV_UL))(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UL))))
207# define PV_WFH(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFH)) OPT_WIN(WV_WFH)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFH))
208# define PV_WFW(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFW)) OPT_WIN(WV_WFW)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFW))
209#define PV_WRAP(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WRAP)) OPT_WIN(WV_WRAP)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WRAP))
210# define PV_CRBIND(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CRBIND)) OPT_WIN(WV_CRBIND)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CRBIND))
211# define PV_COCU(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COCU)) OPT_WIN(WV_COCU)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COCU))
212# define PV_COLE(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COLE)) OPT_WIN(WV_COLE)(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COLE))
213
214/* WV_ and BV_ values get typecasted to this for the "indir" field */
215typedef enum {
216 PV_NONE = 0,
217 PV_MAXVAL = 0xffff /* to avoid warnings for value out of range */
218} idopt_T;
219
220/*
221 * Options local to a window have a value local to a buffer and global to all
222 * buffers. Indicate this by setting "var" to VAR_WIN.
223 */
224#define VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1) ((char_u *)-1)
225
226/*
227 * These are the global values for options which are also local to a buffer.
228 * Only to be used in option.c!
229 */
230static int p_ai;
231static int p_bin;
232static int p_bomb;
233static char_u *p_bh;
234static char_u *p_bt;
235static int p_bl;
236static int p_ci;
237static int p_cin;
238static char_u *p_cink;
239static char_u *p_cino;
240static char_u *p_cinw;
241static char_u *p_com;
242static char_u *p_cms;
243static char_u *p_cpt;
244static char_u *p_cfu;
245static char_u *p_ofu;
246static int p_eol;
247static int p_et;
248static char_u *p_fenc;
249static char_u *p_ff;
250static char_u *p_fo;
251static char_u *p_flp;
252static char_u *p_ft;
253static long p_iminsert;
254static long p_imsearch;
255static char_u *p_inex;
256static char_u *p_inde;
257static char_u *p_indk;
258static char_u *p_fex;
259static int p_inf;
260static char_u *p_isk;
261static int p_lisp;
262static int p_ml;
263static int p_ma;
264static int p_mod;
265static char_u *p_mps;
266static char_u *p_nf;
267static int p_pi;
268static char_u *p_qe;
269static int p_ro;
270static int p_si;
271static long p_sts;
272static char_u *p_sua;
273static long p_sw;
274static int p_swf;
275static long p_smc;
276static char_u *p_syn;
277static char_u *p_spc;
278static char_u *p_spf;
279static char_u *p_spl;
280static long p_ts;
281static long p_tw;
282static int p_udf;
283static long p_wm;
284static char_u *p_keymap;
285
286/* Saved values for when 'bin' is set. */
287static int p_et_nobin;
288static int p_ml_nobin;
289static long p_tw_nobin;
290static long p_wm_nobin;
291
292/* Saved values for when 'paste' is set */
293static long p_tw_nopaste;
294static long p_wm_nopaste;
295static long p_sts_nopaste;
296static int p_ai_nopaste;
297
298struct vimoption {
299 char *fullname; /* full option name */
300 char *shortname; /* permissible abbreviation */
301 long_u flags; /* see below */
302 char_u *var; /* global option: pointer to variable;
303 * window-local option: VAR_WIN;
304 * buffer-local option: global value */
305 idopt_T indir; /* global option: PV_NONE;
306 * local option: indirect option index */
307 char_u *def_val[2]; /* default values for variable (vi and vim) */
308 scid_T scriptID; /* script in which the option was last set */
309# define SCRIPTID_INIT, 0 , 0
310};
311
312#define VI_DEFAULT0 0 /* def_val[VI_DEFAULT] is Vi default value */
313#define VIM_DEFAULT1 1 /* def_val[VIM_DEFAULT] is Vim default value */
314
315/*
316 * Flags
317 */
318#define P_BOOL0x01 0x01 /* the option is boolean */
319#define P_NUM0x02 0x02 /* the option is numeric */
320#define P_STRING0x04 0x04 /* the option is a string */
321#define P_ALLOCED0x08 0x08 /* the string option is in allocated memory,
322 must use free_string_option() when
323 assigning new value. Not set if default is
324 the same. */
325#define P_EXPAND0x10 0x10 /* environment expansion. NOTE: P_EXPAND can
326 never be used for local or hidden options! */
327#define P_NODEFAULT0x40 0x40 /* don't set to default value */
328#define P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80 0x80 /* default value is in allocated memory, must
329 use free() when assigning new value */
330#define P_WAS_SET0x100 0x100 /* option has been set/reset */
331#define P_NO_MKRC0x200 0x200 /* don't include in :mkvimrc output */
332#define P_VI_DEF0x400 0x400 /* Use Vi default for Vim */
333#define P_VIM0x800 0x800 /* Vim option, reset when 'cp' set */
334
335/* when option changed, what to display: */
336#define P_RSTAT0x1000 0x1000 /* redraw status lines */
337#define P_RWIN0x2000 0x2000 /* redraw current window */
338#define P_RBUF0x4000 0x4000 /* redraw current buffer */
339#define P_RALL0x6000 0x6000 /* redraw all windows */
340#define P_RCLR0x7000 0x7000 /* clear and redraw all */
341
342#define P_COMMA0x8000 0x8000 /* comma separated list */
343#define P_NODUP0x10000L 0x10000L /* don't allow duplicate strings */
344#define P_FLAGLIST0x20000L 0x20000L /* list of single-char flags */
345
346#define P_SECURE0x40000L 0x40000L /* cannot change in modeline or secure mode */
347#define P_GETTEXT0x80000L 0x80000L /* expand default value with _() */
348#define P_NOGLOB0x100000L 0x100000L /* do not use local value for global vimrc */
349#define P_NFNAME0x200000L 0x200000L /* only normal file name chars allowed */
350#define P_INSECURE0x400000L 0x400000L /* option was set from a modeline */
351#define P_PRI_MKRC0x800000L 0x800000L /* priority for :mkvimrc (setting option has
352 side effects) */
353#define P_NO_ML0x1000000L 0x1000000L /* not allowed in modeline */
354#define P_CURSWANT0x2000000L 0x2000000L /* update curswant required; not needed when
355 * there is a redraw flag */
356
357#define ISK_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,48-57,_,192-255" (char_u *)"@,48-57,_,192-255"
358
359/* 'isprint' for latin1 is also used for MS-Windows cp1252, where 0x80 is used
360 * for the currency sign. */
361# define ISP_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,161-255" (char_u *)"@,161-255"
362
363#define HIGHLIGHT_INIT"8:SpecialKey,@:NonText,d:Directory,e:ErrorMsg,i:IncSearch,l:Search,"
"m:MoreMsg,M:ModeMsg,n:LineNr,N:CursorLineNr,r:Question,s:StatusLine,"
"S:StatusLineNC,c:VertSplit,t:Title,v:Visual,V:VisualNOS,w:WarningMsg,"
"W:WildMenu,f:Folded,F:FoldColumn,A:DiffAdd,C:DiffChange,D:DiffDelete,"
"T:DiffText,>:SignColumn,-:Conceal,B:SpellBad,P:SpellCap,R:SpellRare,"
"L:SpellLocal,+:Pmenu,=:PmenuSel,x:PmenuSbar,X:PmenuThumb,*:TabLine,"
"#:TabLineSel,_:TabLineFill,!:CursorColumn,.:CursorLine,o:ColorColumn" \
364 "8:SpecialKey,@:NonText,d:Directory,e:ErrorMsg,i:IncSearch,l:Search," \
365 "m:MoreMsg,M:ModeMsg,n:LineNr,N:CursorLineNr,r:Question,s:StatusLine," \
366 "S:StatusLineNC,c:VertSplit,t:Title,v:Visual,V:VisualNOS,w:WarningMsg," \
367 "W:WildMenu,f:Folded,F:FoldColumn,A:DiffAdd,C:DiffChange,D:DiffDelete," \
368 "T:DiffText,>:SignColumn,-:Conceal,B:SpellBad,P:SpellCap,R:SpellRare," \
369 "L:SpellLocal,+:Pmenu,=:PmenuSel,x:PmenuSbar,X:PmenuThumb,*:TabLine," \
370 "#:TabLineSel,_:TabLineFill,!:CursorColumn,.:CursorLine,o:ColorColumn"
371
372/*
373 * options[] is initialized here.
374 * The order of the options MUST be alphabetic for ":set all" and findoption().
375 * All option names MUST start with a lowercase letter (for findoption()).
376 * Exception: "t_" options are at the end.
377 * The options with a NULL variable are 'hidden': a set command for them is
378 * ignored and they are not printed.
379 */
380static struct vimoption
381 options[] =
382{

1764 /* terminal output codes */
1765#define p_term(sss, vvv){sss, ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
vvv, PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u *)0L} , 0}, {sss, NULL((void*)0), P_STRING0x04|P_VI_DEF0x400|P_RALL0x6000|P_SECURE0x40000L, \
1766 (char_u *)&vvv, PV_NONE, \
1767 {(char_u *)"", (char_u *)0L} SCRIPTID_INIT, 0},
1768

(term_strings[(int)(KS_CAB)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},

(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1796 p_term("t_mr", T_MR){"t_mr", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_MR)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1797 p_term("t_ms", T_MS){"t_ms", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_MS)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1798 p_term("t_nd", T_ND){"t_nd", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_ND)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1799 p_term("t_op", T_OP){"t_op", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_OP)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1800 p_term("t_RI", T_CRI){"t_RI", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CRI)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1801 p_term("t_RV", T_CRV){"t_RV", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CRV)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1802 p_term("t_u7", T_U7){"t_u7", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_U7)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1803 p_term("t_Sb", T_CSB){"t_Sb", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSB)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1804 p_term("t_Sf", T_CSF){"t_Sf", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSF)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1805 p_term("t_se", T_SE){"t_se", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_SE)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1806 p_term("t_so", T_SO){"t_so", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_SO)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1807 p_term("t_sr", T_SR){"t_sr", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_SR)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1808 p_term("t_ts", T_TS){"t_ts", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_TS)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1809 p_term("t_te", T_TE){"t_te", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_TE)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1810 p_term("t_ti", T_TI){"t_ti", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_TI)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1811 p_term("t_ue", T_UE){"t_ue", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_UE)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1812 p_term("t_us", T_US){"t_us", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_US)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1813 p_term("t_vb", T_VB){"t_vb", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_VB)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1814 p_term("t_ve", T_VE){"t_ve", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_VE)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1815 p_term("t_vi", T_VI){"t_vi", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_VI)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1816 p_term("t_vs", T_VS){"t_vs", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_VS)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1817 p_term("t_WP", T_CWP){"t_WP", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CWP)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1818 p_term("t_WS", T_CWS){"t_WS", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CWS)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1819 p_term("t_SI", T_CSI){"t_SI", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSI)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1820 p_term("t_EI", T_CEI){"t_EI", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CEI)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1821 p_term("t_xs", T_XS){"t_xs", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_XS)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1822 p_term("t_ZH", T_CZH){"t_ZH", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CZH)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1823 p_term("t_ZR", T_CZR){"t_ZR", ((void*)0), 0x04|0x400|0x6000|0x40000L, (char_u *)&
(term_strings[(int)(KS_CZR)]), PV_NONE, {(char_u *)"", (char_u
*)0L} , 0},
1824
1825 /* terminal key codes are not in here */
1826
1827 /* end marker */
1828 {
1829 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0, NULL((void*)0), PV_NONE, {NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0)} SCRIPTID_INIT, 0
1830 }
1831};
1832
1833#define PARAM_COUNT(sizeof(options) / sizeof(struct vimoption)) (sizeof(options) / sizeof(struct vimoption))
1834
1835static char *(p_ambw_values[]) = {"single", "double", NULL((void*)0)};
1836static char *(p_bg_values[]) = {"light", "dark", NULL((void*)0)};
1837static char *(p_nf_values[]) = {"octal", "hex", "alpha", NULL((void*)0)};
1838static char *(p_ff_values[]) = {FF_UNIX"unix", FF_DOS"dos", FF_MAC"mac", NULL((void*)0)};
1839static char *(p_wop_values[]) = {"tagfile", NULL((void*)0)};
1840static char *(p_wak_values[]) = {"yes", "menu", "no", NULL((void*)0)};
1841static char *(p_mousem_values[]) =
1842{"extend", "popup", "popup_setpos", "mac", NULL((void*)0)};
1843static char *(p_sel_values[]) = {"inclusive", "exclusive", "old", NULL((void*)0)};
1844static char *(p_slm_values[]) = {"mouse", "key", "cmd", NULL((void*)0)};
1845static char *(p_km_values[]) = {"startsel", "stopsel", NULL((void*)0)};
1846static char *(p_scbopt_values[]) = {"ver", "hor", "jump", NULL((void*)0)};
1847static char *(p_debug_values[]) = {"msg", "throw", "beep", NULL((void*)0)};
1848static char *(p_ead_values[]) = {"both", "ver", "hor", NULL((void*)0)};
1849static char *(p_buftype_values[]) =
1850{"nofile", "nowrite", "quickfix", "help", "acwrite", NULL((void*)0)};
1851static char *(p_bufhidden_values[]) = {"hide", "unload", "delete", "wipe", NULL((void*)0)};
1852static char *(p_bs_values[]) = {"indent", "eol", "start", NULL((void*)0)};
1853static char *(p_fdm_values[]) = {"manual", "expr", "marker", "indent", "syntax",
1854 "diff",
1855 NULL((void*)0)};
1856static char *(p_fcl_values[]) = {"all", NULL((void*)0)};
1857static char *(p_cot_values[]) = {"menu", "menuone", "longest", "preview", NULL((void*)0)};
1858
1859#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
1860# include "option.c.generated.h"
1861#endif
1862
1863/*
1864 * Initialize the options, first part.
1865 *
1866 * Called only once from main(), just after creating the first buffer.
1867 */
1868void set_init_1(void)
1869{
1870 char_u *p;
1871 int opt_idx;
1872 long_u n;
1873
1874 langmap_init();
1875
1876 /* Be Vi compatible by default */
1877 p_cp = TRUE1;
1878
1879 /* Use POSIX compatibility when $VIM_POSIX is set. */
1880 if (os_getenv("VIM_POSIX") != NULL((void*)0)) {
1881 set_string_default("cpo", (char_u *)CPO_ALL"aAbBcCdDeEfFgHiIjJkKlLmMnoOpPqrRsStuvwWxXyZ$!%*-+<>#{|&/\\.;");
1882 set_string_default("shm", (char_u *)"A");
1883 }
1884
1885 /*
1886 * Find default value for 'shell' option.
1887 * Don't use it if it is empty.
1888 */
1889 if (((p = (char_u *)os_getenv("SHELL")) != NULL((void*)0) && *p != NUL'\000')
1890 )
1891 set_string_default("sh", p);
1892
1893 /*
1894 * Set the default for 'backupskip' to include environment variables for
1895 * temp files.
1896 */
1897 {
1898# ifdef UNIX
1899 static char *(names[4]) = {"", "TMPDIR", "TEMP", "TMP"};
1900# else
1901 static char *(names[3]) = {"TMPDIR", "TEMP", "TMP"};
1902# endif
1903 int len;
1904 garray_T ga;
1905 int mustfree;
1906
1907 ga_init(&ga, 1, 100);
1908 for (n = 0; n < (long)(sizeof(names) / sizeof(char *)); ++n) {
1909 mustfree = FALSE0;
1910# ifdef UNIX
1911 if (*names[n] == NUL'\000')
1912 p = (char_u *)"/tmp";
1913 else
1914# endif
1915 p = vim_getenv((char_u *)names[n], &mustfree);
1916 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && *p != NUL'\000') {
1917 /* First time count the NUL, otherwise count the ','. */
1918 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + 3;
1919 ga_grow(&ga, len);
1920 if (!GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0))
1921 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, ",")strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)(","));
1922 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, p)strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)(p));
1923 add_pathsep(ga.ga_data);
1924 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, "*")strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)("*"));
1925 ga.ga_len += len;
1926 }
1927 if (mustfree)
1928 free(p);
1929 }
1930 if (ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
1931 set_string_default("bsk", ga.ga_data);
1932 free(ga.ga_data);
1933 }
1934 }
1935
1936 /*
1937 * 'maxmemtot' and 'maxmem' may have to be adjusted for available memory
1938 */
1939 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"maxmemtot");
1940 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
1941 {
1942 /* Use half of amount of memory available to Vim. */
1943 /* If too much to fit in long_u, get long_u max */
1944 uint64_t available_kib = os_get_total_mem_kib();
1945 n = available_kib / 2 > ULONG_MAX(9223372036854775807L *2UL+1UL) ? ULONG_MAX(9223372036854775807L *2UL+1UL)
1946 : (long_u)(available_kib /2);
1947 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *)n;
1948 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"maxmem");
1949 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
1950 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *)n;
1951 }
1952 }
1953 }
1954
1955
1956 {
1957 char_u *cdpath;
1958 char_u *buf;
1959 int i;
1960 int j;
1961 int mustfree = FALSE0;
1962
1963 /* Initialize the 'cdpath' option's default value. */
1964 cdpath = vim_getenv((char_u *)"CDPATH", &mustfree);
1965 if (cdpath != NULL((void*)0)) {
1966 buf = xmalloc(2 * STRLEN(cdpath)strlen((char *)(cdpath)) + 2);
1967 {
1968 buf[0] = ','; /* start with ",", current dir first */
1969 j = 1;
1970 for (i = 0; cdpath[i] != NUL'\000'; ++i) {
1971 if (vim_ispathlistsep(cdpath[i]))
1972 buf[j++] = ',';
1973 else {
1974 if (cdpath[i] == ' ' || cdpath[i] == ',')
1975 buf[j++] = '\\';
1976 buf[j++] = cdpath[i];
1977 }
1978 }
1979 buf[j] = NUL'\000';
1980 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"cdpath");
1981 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
1982 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = buf;
1983 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
1984 } else
1985 free(buf); /* cannot happen */
1986 }
1987 if (mustfree)
1988 free(cdpath);
1989 }
1990 }
1991
1992#if defined(MSWIN) || defined(MAC)
1993 /* Set print encoding on platforms that don't default to latin1 */
1994 set_string_default("penc",
1995 (char_u *)"hp-roman8"
1996 );
1997#endif
1998
1999 /* 'printexpr' must be allocated to be able to evaluate it. */
2000 set_string_default(
2001 "pexpr",
2002 (char_u *)
2003 "system('lpr' . (&printdevice == '' ? '' : ' -P' . &printdevice) . ' ' . v:fname_in) . delete(v:fname_in) + v:shell_error"
2004 );
2005
2006 /*
2007 * Set all the options (except the terminal options) to their default
2008 * value. Also set the global value for local options.
2009 */
2010 set_options_default(0);
2011
2012
2013 curbuf->b_p_initialized = TRUE1;
2014 curbuf->b_p_ar = -1; /* no local 'autoread' value */
2015 curbuf->b_p_ul = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL-123456;
2016 check_buf_options(curbuf);
2017 check_win_options(curwin);
2018 check_options();
2019
2020 /* Must be before option_expand(), because that one needs vim_isIDc() */
2021 didset_options();
2022
2023 /* Use the current chartab for the generic chartab. */
2024 init_spell_chartab();
2025
2026 /*
2027 * initialize the table for 'breakat'.
2028 */
2029 fill_breakat_flags();
2030
2031 /*
2032 * Expand environment variables and things like "~" for the defaults.
2033 * If option_expand() returns non-NULL the variable is expanded. This can
2034 * only happen for non-indirect options.
2035 * Also set the default to the expanded value, so ":set" does not list
2036 * them.
2037 * Don't set the P_ALLOCED flag, because we don't want to free the
2038 * default.
2039 */
2040 for (opt_idx = 0; !istermoption(&options[opt_idx]); opt_idx++) {
2041 if ((options[opt_idx].flags & P_GETTEXT0x80000L)
2042 && options[opt_idx].var != NULL((void*)0))
2043 p = (char_u *)_(*(char **)options[opt_idx].var)gettext((char *)(*(char **)options[opt_idx].var));
2044 else
2045 p = option_expand(opt_idx, NULL((void*)0));
2046 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
2047 p = vim_strsave(p);
2048 *(char_u **)options[opt_idx].var = p;
2049 /* VIMEXP
2050 * Defaults for all expanded options are currently the same for Vi
2051 * and Vim. When this changes, add some code here! Also need to
2052 * split P_DEF_ALLOCED in two.
2053 */
2054 if (options[opt_idx].flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80)
2055 free(options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0]);
2056 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p;
2057 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
2058 }
2059 }
2060
2061 /* Initialize the highlight_attr[] table. */
2062 highlight_changed();
2063
2064 save_file_ff(curbuf); /* Buffer is unchanged */
2065
2066 /* Parse default for 'wildmode' */
2067 check_opt_wim();
2068
2069 /* Detect use of mlterm.
2070 * Mlterm is a terminal emulator akin to xterm that has some special
2071 * abilities (bidi namely).
2072 * NOTE: mlterm's author is being asked to 'set' a variable
2073 * instead of an environment variable due to inheritance.
2074 */
2075 if (os_getenv("MLTERM") != NULL((void*)0))
2076 set_option_value((char_u *)"tbidi", 1L, NULL((void*)0), 0);
2077
2078 /* Parse default for 'fillchars'. */
2079 (void)set_chars_option(&p_fcs);
2080
2081
2082# ifdef MACOS_CONVERT
2083 /* Moved to os_mac_conv.c to avoid dependency problems. */
2084 mac_lang_init();
2085# endif
2086
2087 /* enc_locale() will try to find the encoding of the current locale. */
2088 p = enc_locale();
2089 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
2090 char_u *save_enc;
2091
2092 /* Try setting 'encoding' and check if the value is valid.
2093 * If not, go back to the default "latin1". */
2094 save_enc = p_enc;
2095 p_enc = p;
2096 if (STRCMP(p_enc, "gb18030")strcmp((char *)(p_enc), (char *)("gb18030")) == 0) {
2097 /* We don't support "gb18030", but "cp936" is a good substitute
2098 * for practical purposes, thus use that. It's not an alias to
2099 * still support conversion between gb18030 and utf-8. */
2100 p_enc = vim_strsave((char_u *)"cp936");
2101 free(p);
2102 }
2103 if (mb_init() == NULL((void*)0)) {
2104 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"encoding");
2105 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
2106 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p_enc;
2107 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
2108 }
2109
2110#if defined(MSWIN) || defined(MACOS)
2111 if (STRCMP(p_enc, "latin1")strcmp((char *)(p_enc), (char *)("latin1")) == 0
2112 || enc_utf8
2113 ) {
2114 /* Adjust the default for 'isprint' and 'iskeyword' to match
2115 * latin1. Also set the defaults for when 'nocompatible' is
2116 * set. */
2117 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"isp", -1,
2118 ISP_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,161-255", OPT_FREE1, SID_NONE-6);
2119 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"isk", -1,
2120 ISK_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,48-57,_,192-255", OPT_FREE1, SID_NONE-6);
2121 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"isp");
2122 if (opt_idx >= 0)
2123 options[opt_idx].def_val[VIM_DEFAULT1] = ISP_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,161-255";
2124 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"isk");
2125 if (opt_idx >= 0)
2126 options[opt_idx].def_val[VIM_DEFAULT1] = ISK_LATIN1(char_u *)"@,48-57,_,192-255";
2127 (void)init_chartab();
2128 }
2129#endif
2130
2131 } else {
2132 free(p_enc);
2133 p_enc = save_enc;
2134 }
2135 }
2136
2137 /* Set the default for 'helplang'. */
2138 set_helplang_default(get_mess_lang());
2139}
2140
2141/*
2142 * Set an option to its default value.
2143 * This does not take care of side effects!
2144 */
2145static void
2146set_option_default (
2147 int opt_idx,
2148 int opt_flags, /* OPT_FREE, OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
2149 int compatible /* use Vi default value */
2150)
2151{
2152 char_u *varp; /* pointer to variable for current option */
2153 int dvi; /* index in def_val[] */
2154 long_u flags;
2155 long_u *flagsp;
2156 int both = (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0;
2157
2158 varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), both ? OPT_LOCAL4 : opt_flags);
2159 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
2160 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) { /* skip hidden option, nothing to do for it */
2161 dvi = ((flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) || compatible) ? VI_DEFAULT0 : VIM_DEFAULT1;
2162 if (flags & P_STRING0x04) {
2163 /* Use set_string_option_direct() for local options to handle
2164 * freeing and allocating the value. */
2165 if (options[opt_idx].indir != PV_NONE)
2166 set_string_option_direct(NULL((void*)0), opt_idx,
2167 options[opt_idx].def_val[dvi], opt_flags, 0);
2168 else {
2169 if ((opt_flags & OPT_FREE1) && (flags & P_ALLOCED0x08))
2170 free_string_option(*(char_u **)(varp));
2171 *(char_u **)varp = options[opt_idx].def_val[dvi];
2172 options[opt_idx].flags &= ~P_ALLOCED0x08;
2173 }
2174 } else if (flags & P_NUM0x02) {
2175 if (options[opt_idx].indir == PV_SCROLL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_SCROLL)))
2176 win_comp_scroll(curwin);
2177 else {
2178 *(long *)varp = (long)options[opt_idx].def_val[dvi];
2179 /* May also set global value for local option. */
2180 if (both)
2181 *(long *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2) =
2182 *(long *)varp;
2183 }
2184 } else { /* P_BOOL */
2185 *(int *)varp = (int)(intptr_t)options[opt_idx].def_val[dvi];
2186#ifdef UNIX
2187 /* 'modeline' defaults to off for root */
2188 if (options[opt_idx].indir == PV_ML(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_ML)) && getuid() == ROOT_UID0)
2189 *(int *)varp = FALSE0;
2190#endif
2191 /* May also set global value for local option. */
2192 if (both)
2193 *(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2) =
2194 *(int *)varp;
2195 }
2196
2197 /* The default value is not insecure. */
2198 flagsp = insecure_flag(opt_idx, opt_flags);
2199 *flagsp = *flagsp & ~P_INSECURE0x400000L;
2200 }
2201
2202 set_option_scriptID_idx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_SID);
2203}
2204
2205/*
2206 * Set all options (except terminal options) to their default value.
2207 */
2208static void
2209set_options_default (
2210 int opt_flags /* OPT_FREE, OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
2211)
2212{
2213 for (int i = 0; !istermoption(&options[i]); i++) {
2214 if (!(options[i].flags & P_NODEFAULT0x40)) {
2215 set_option_default(i, opt_flags, p_cp);
2216 }
2217 }
2218
2219 /* The 'scroll' option must be computed for all windows. */
2220 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
2221 win_comp_scroll(wp);
2222 }
2223}
2224
2225/// Set the Vi-default value of a string option.
2226/// Used for 'sh', 'backupskip' and 'term'.
2227///
2228/// @param name The name of the option
2229/// @param val The value of the option
2230void set_string_default(const char *name, const char_u *val)
2231{
2232 int opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)name);
2233 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
2234 if (options[opt_idx].flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80) {
2235 free(options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0]);
2236 }
2237
2238 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *) xstrdup((char *) val);
2239 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
2240 }
2241}
2242
2243/*
2244 * Set the Vi-default value of a number option.
2245 * Used for 'lines' and 'columns'.
2246 */
2247void set_number_default(char *name, long val)
2248{
2249 int opt_idx;
2250
2251 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)name);
2252 if (opt_idx >= 0)
2253 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *)val;
2254}
2255
2256#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
2257/*
2258 * Free all options.
2259 */
2260void free_all_options(void)
2261{
2262 int i;
2263
2264 for (i = 0; !istermoption(&options[i]); i++) {
2265 if (options[i].indir == PV_NONE) {
2266 /* global option: free value and default value. */
2267 if (options[i].flags & P_ALLOCED0x08 && options[i].var != NULL((void*)0))
2268 free_string_option(*(char_u **)options[i].var);
2269 if (options[i].flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80)
2270 free_string_option(options[i].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0]);
2271 } else if (options[i].var != VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1)
2272 && (options[i].flags & P_STRING0x04))
2273 /* buffer-local option: free global value */
2274 free_string_option(*(char_u **)options[i].var);
2275 }
2276}
2277
2278#endif
2279
2280
2281/*
2282 * Initialize the options, part two: After getting Rows and Columns and
2283 * setting 'term'.
2284 */
2285void set_init_2(void)
2286{
2287 int idx;
2288
2289 /*
2290 * 'scroll' defaults to half the window height. Note that this default is
2291 * wrong when the window height changes.
2292 */
2293 set_number_default("scroll", Rows / 2);
2294 idx = findoption((char_u *)"scroll");
2295 if (idx >= 0 && !(options[idx].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100))
2296 set_option_default(idx, OPT_LOCAL4, p_cp);
2297 comp_col();
2298
2299 /*
2300 * 'window' is only for backwards compatibility with Vi.
2301 * Default is Rows - 1.
2302 */
2303 if (!option_was_set((char_u *)"window"))
2304 p_window = Rows - 1;
2305 set_number_default("window", Rows - 1);
2306
2307 /* For DOS console the default is always black. */
2308 /*
2309 * If 'background' wasn't set by the user, try guessing the value,
2310 * depending on the terminal name. Only need to check for terminals
2311 * with a dark background, that can handle color.
2312 */
2313 idx = findoption((char_u *)"bg");
2314 if (idx >= 0 && !(options[idx].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100)
2315 && *term_bg_default() == 'd') {
2316 set_string_option_direct(NULL((void*)0), idx, (char_u *)"dark", OPT_FREE1, 0);
2317 /* don't mark it as set, when starting the GUI it may be
2318 * changed again */
2319 options[idx].flags &= ~P_WAS_SET0x100;
2320 }
2321
2322 parse_shape_opt(SHAPE_CURSOR2); /* set cursor shapes from 'guicursor' */
2323 (void)parse_printoptions(); /* parse 'printoptions' default value */
2324}
2325
2326/*
2327 * Return "dark" or "light" depending on the kind of terminal.
2328 * This is just guessing! Recognized are:
2329 * "linux" Linux console
2330 * "screen.linux" Linux console with screen
2331 * "cygwin" Cygwin shell
2332 * "putty" Putty program
2333 * We also check the COLORFGBG environment variable, which is set by
2334 * rxvt and derivatives. This variable contains either two or three
2335 * values separated by semicolons; we want the last value in either
2336 * case. If this value is 0-6 or 8, our background is dark.
2337 */
2338static char_u *term_bg_default(void)
2339{
2340 char_u *p;
2341
2342 if (STRCMP(T_NAME, "linux")strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])), (char *)("linux"
)) == 0
2343 || STRCMP(T_NAME, "screen.linux")strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])), (char *)("screen.linux"
)) == 0
2344 || STRCMP(T_NAME, "cygwin")strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])), (char *)("cygwin"
)) == 0
2345 || STRCMP(T_NAME, "putty")strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])), (char *)("putty"
)) == 0
2346 || ((p = (char_u *)os_getenv("COLORFGBG")) != NULL((void*)0)
2347 && (p = vim_strrchr(p, ';')) != NULL((void*)0)
2348 && ((p[1] >= '0' && p[1] <= '6') || p[1] == '8')
2349 && p[2] == NUL'\000'))
2350 return (char_u *)"dark";
2351 return (char_u *)"light";
2352}
2353
2354/*
2355 * Initialize the options, part three: After reading the .vimrc
2356 */
2357void set_init_3(void)
2358{
2359#if defined(UNIX) || defined(WIN3264)
2360 /*
2361 * Set 'shellpipe' and 'shellredir', depending on the 'shell' option.
2362 * This is done after other initializations, where 'shell' might have been
2363 * set, but only if they have not been set before.
2364 */
2365 int idx_srr;
2366 int do_srr;
2367 int idx_sp;
2368 int do_sp;
2369
2370 idx_srr = findoption((char_u *)"srr");
2371 if (idx_srr < 0)
2372 do_srr = FALSE0;
2373 else
2374 do_srr = !(options[idx_srr].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100);
2375 idx_sp = findoption((char_u *)"sp");
2376 if (idx_sp < 0)
2377 do_sp = FALSE0;
2378 else
2379 do_sp = !(options[idx_sp].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100);
2380
2381 size_t len = 0;
2382 char_u *p = (char_u *)invocation_path_tail(p_sh, &len);
2383 p = vim_strnsave(p, len);
2384
2385 {
2386 /*
2387 * Default for p_sp is "| tee", for p_srr is ">".
2388 * For known shells it is changed here to include stderr.
2389 */
2390 if ( fnamecmp(p, "csh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("csh")) == 0
2391 || fnamecmp(p, "tcsh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("tcsh")) == 0
2392 ) {
2393 if (do_sp) {
2394 p_sp = (char_u *)"|& tee";
2395 options[idx_sp].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p_sp;
2396 }
2397 if (do_srr) {
2398 p_srr = (char_u *)">&";
2399 options[idx_srr].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p_srr;
2400 }
2401 } else if ( fnamecmp(p, "sh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("sh")) == 0
2402 || fnamecmp(p, "ksh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("ksh")) == 0
2403 || fnamecmp(p, "mksh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("mksh")) == 0
2404 || fnamecmp(p, "pdksh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("pdksh")) == 0
2405 || fnamecmp(p, "zsh")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("zsh")) == 0
2406 || fnamecmp(p, "zsh-beta")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("zsh-beta")) == 0
2407 || fnamecmp(p, "bash")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("bash")) == 0
2408 || fnamecmp(p, "fish")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)("fish")) == 0
2409 ) {
2410 if (do_sp) {
2411 p_sp = (char_u *)"2>&1| tee";
2412 options[idx_sp].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p_sp;
2413 }
2414 if (do_srr) {
2415 p_srr = (char_u *)">%s 2>&1";
2416 options[idx_srr].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = p_srr;
2417 }
2418 }
2419 free(p);
2420 }
2421#endif
2422
2423
2424 set_title_defaults();
2425}
2426
2427/*
2428 * When 'helplang' is still at its default value, set it to "lang".
2429 * Only the first two characters of "lang" are used.
2430 */
2431void set_helplang_default(char_u *lang)
2432{
2433 int idx;
2434
2435 if (lang == NULL((void*)0) || STRLEN(lang)strlen((char *)(lang)) < 2) /* safety check */
2436 return;
2437 idx = findoption((char_u *)"hlg");
2438 if (idx >= 0 && !(options[idx].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100)) {
2439 if (options[idx].flags & P_ALLOCED0x08)
2440 free_string_option(p_hlg);
2441 p_hlg = vim_strsave(lang);
2442 /* zh_CN becomes "cn", zh_TW becomes "tw". */
2443 if (STRNICMP(p_hlg, "zh_", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(p_hlg), (char *)("zh_"), (size_t)(3)) == 0 && STRLEN(p_hlg)strlen((char *)(p_hlg)) >= 5) {
2444 p_hlg[0] = TOLOWER_ASC(p_hlg[3])(((p_hlg[3]) < 'A' || (p_hlg[3]) > 'Z') ? (p_hlg[3]) : (
p_hlg[3]) + ('a' - 'A'));
2445 p_hlg[1] = TOLOWER_ASC(p_hlg[4])(((p_hlg[4]) < 'A' || (p_hlg[4]) > 'Z') ? (p_hlg[4]) : (
p_hlg[4]) + ('a' - 'A'));
2446 }
2447 p_hlg[2] = NUL'\000';
2448 options[idx].flags |= P_ALLOCED0x08;
2449 }
2450}
2451
2452
2453/*
2454 * 'title' and 'icon' only default to true if they have not been set or reset
2455 * in .vimrc and we can read the old value.
2456 * When 'title' and 'icon' have been reset in .vimrc, we won't even check if
2457 * they can be reset. This reduces startup time when using X on a remote
2458 * machine.
2459 */
2460void set_title_defaults(void)
2461{
2462 int idx1;
2463 long val;
2464
2465 /*
2466 * If GUI is (going to be) used, we can always set the window title and
2467 * icon name. Saves a bit of time, because the X11 display server does
2468 * not need to be contacted.
2469 */
2470 idx1 = findoption((char_u *)"title");
2471 if (idx1 >= 0 && !(options[idx1].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100)) {
2472 val = mch_can_restore_title();
2473 options[idx1].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *)val;
2474 p_title = val;
2475 }
2476 idx1 = findoption((char_u *)"icon");
2477 if (idx1 >= 0 && !(options[idx1].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100)) {
2478 val = mch_can_restore_icon();
2479 options[idx1].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = (char_u *)val;
2480 p_icon = val;
2481 }
2482}
2483
2484/*
2485 * Parse 'arg' for option settings.
2486 *
2487 * 'arg' may be IObuff, but only when no errors can be present and option
2488 * does not need to be expanded with option_expand().
2489 * "opt_flags":
2490 * 0 for ":set"
2491 * OPT_GLOBAL for ":setglobal"
2492 * OPT_LOCAL for ":setlocal" and a modeline
2493 * OPT_MODELINE for a modeline
2494 * OPT_WINONLY to only set window-local options
2495 * OPT_NOWIN to skip setting window-local options
2496 *
2497 * returns FAIL if an error is detected, OK otherwise
2498 */
2499int
2500do_set (
2501 char_u *arg, /* option string (may be written to!) */
2502 int opt_flags
2503)
2504{
2505 int opt_idx;
2506 char_u *errmsg;
2507 char_u errbuf[80];
2508 char_u *startarg;
2509 int prefix; /* 1: nothing, 0: "no", 2: "inv" in front of name */
2510 int nextchar; /* next non-white char after option name */
2511 int afterchar; /* character just after option name */
2512 int len;
2513 int i;
2514 long value;
2515 int key;
2516 long_u flags; /* flags for current option */
2517 char_u *varp = NULL((void*)0); /* pointer to variable for current option */
2518 int did_show = FALSE0; /* already showed one value */
2519 int adding; /* "opt+=arg" */
2520 int prepending; /* "opt^=arg" */
2521 int removing; /* "opt-=arg" */
2522 int cp_val = 0;
2523 char_u key_name[2];
2524
2525 if (*arg == NUL'\000') {
2526 showoptions(0, opt_flags);
2527 did_show = TRUE1;
2528 goto theend;
2529 }
2530
2531 while (*arg != NUL'\000') { /* loop to process all options */
2532 errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
2533 startarg = arg; /* remember for error message */
2534
2535 if (STRNCMP(arg, "all", 3)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("all"), (size_t)(3)) == 0 && !isalpha(arg[3])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((arg[3]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISalpha)
2536 && !(opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE8)) {
2537 /*
2538 * ":set all" show all options.
2539 * ":set all&" set all options to their default value.
2540 */
2541 arg += 3;
2542 if (*arg == '&') {
2543 ++arg;
2544 /* Only for :set command set global value of local options. */
2545 set_options_default(OPT_FREE1 | opt_flags);
2546 } else {
2547 showoptions(1, opt_flags);
2548 did_show = TRUE1;
2549 }
2550 } else if (STRNCMP(arg, "termcap",strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("termcap"), (size_t)(7))
2551 7)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("termcap"), (size_t)(7)) == 0 && !(opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE8)) {
2552 showoptions(2, opt_flags);
2553 show_termcodes();
2554 did_show = TRUE1;
2555 arg += 7;
2556 } else {
2557 prefix = 1;
2558 if (STRNCMP(arg, "no", 2)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("no"), (size_t)(2)) == 0 && STRNCMP(arg, "novice", 6)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("novice"), (size_t)(6)) != 0) {
2559 prefix = 0;
2560 arg += 2;
2561 } else if (STRNCMP(arg, "inv", 3)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("inv"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
2562 prefix = 2;
2563 arg += 3;
2564 }
2565
2566 /* find end of name */
2567 key = 0;
2568 if (*arg == '<') {
2569 nextchar = 0;
Value stored to 'nextchar' is never read
2570 opt_idx = -1;
2571 /* look out for <t_>;> */
2572 if (arg[1] == 't' && arg[2] == '_' && arg[3] && arg[4])
2573 len = 5;
2574 else {
2575 len = 1;
2576 while (arg[len] != NUL'\000' && arg[len] != '>')
2577 ++len;
2578 }
2579 if (arg[len] != '>') {
2580 errmsg = e_invarg;
2581 goto skip;
2582 }
2583 arg[len] = NUL'\000'; /* put NUL after name */
2584 if (arg[1] == 't' && arg[2] == '_') /* could be term code */
2585 opt_idx = findoption(arg + 1);
2586 arg[len++] = '>'; /* restore '>' */
2587 if (opt_idx == -1)
2588 key = find_key_option(arg + 1);
2589 } else {
2590 len = 0;
2591 /*
2592 * The two characters after "t_" may not be alphanumeric.
2593 */
2594 if (arg[0] == 't' && arg[1] == '_' && arg[2] && arg[3])
2595 len = 4;
2596 else
2597 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(arg[len])((((unsigned)(arg[len]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(arg[len
]) - 'a' < 26)) || ((unsigned)(arg[len]) - '0' < 10)) || arg[len] == '_')
2598 ++len;
2599 nextchar = arg[len];
2600 arg[len] = NUL'\000'; /* put NUL after name */
2601 opt_idx = findoption(arg);
2602 arg[len] = nextchar; /* restore nextchar */
2603 if (opt_idx == -1)
2604 key = find_key_option(arg);
2605 }
2606
2607 /* remember character after option name */
2608 afterchar = arg[len];
2609
2610 /* skip white space, allow ":set ai ?" */
2611 while (vim_iswhite(arg[len])((arg[len]) == ' ' || (arg[len]) == '\t'))
2612 ++len;
2613
2614 adding = FALSE0;
2615 prepending = FALSE0;
2616 removing = FALSE0;
2617 if (arg[len] != NUL'\000' && arg[len + 1] == '=') {
2618 if (arg[len] == '+') {
2619 adding = TRUE1; /* "+=" */
2620 ++len;
2621 } else if (arg[len] == '^') {
2622 prepending = TRUE1; /* "^=" */
2623 ++len;
2624 } else if (arg[len] == '-') {
2625 removing = TRUE1; /* "-=" */
2626 ++len;
2627 }
2628 }
2629 nextchar = arg[len];
2630
2631 if (opt_idx == -1 && key == 0) { /* found a mismatch: skip */
2632 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E518: Unknown option")"E518: Unknown option";
2633 goto skip;
2634 }
2635
2636 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
2637 if (options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) { /* hidden option: skip */
2638 /* Only give an error message when requesting the value of
2639 * a hidden option, ignore setting it. */
2640 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"=:!&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)
2641 && (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_BOOL0x01)
2642 || nextchar == '?'))
2643 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E519: Option not supported")"E519: Option not supported";
2644 goto skip;
2645 }
2646
2647 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
2648 varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), opt_flags);
2649 } else {
2650 flags = P_STRING0x04;
2651 if (key < 0) {
2652 key_name[0] = KEY2TERMCAP0(key)((-(key)) & 0xff);
2653 key_name[1] = KEY2TERMCAP1(key)(((unsigned)(-(key)) >> 8) & 0xff);
2654 } else {
2655 key_name[0] = KS_KEY242;
2656 key_name[1] = (key & 0xff);
2657 }
2658 }
2659
2660 /* Skip all options that are not window-local (used when showing
2661 * an already loaded buffer in a window). */
2662 if ((opt_flags & OPT_WINONLY16)
2663 && (opt_idx < 0 || options[opt_idx].var != VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1)))
2664 goto skip;
2665
2666 /* Skip all options that are window-local (used for :vimgrep). */
2667 if ((opt_flags & OPT_NOWIN32) && opt_idx >= 0
2668 && options[opt_idx].var == VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1))
2669 goto skip;
2670
2671 /* Disallow changing some options from modelines. */
2672 if (opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE8) {
2673 if (flags & (P_SECURE0x40000L | P_NO_ML0x1000000L)) {
2674 errmsg = (char_u *)_("E520: Not allowed in a modeline")gettext((char *)("E520: Not allowed in a modeline"));
2675 goto skip;
2676 }
2677 /* In diff mode some options are overruled. This avoids that
2678 * 'foldmethod' becomes "marker" instead of "diff" and that
2679 * "wrap" gets set. */
2680 if (curwin->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff
2681 && opt_idx >= 0 /* shut up coverity warning */
2682 && (options[opt_idx].indir == PV_FDM(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDM))
2683 || options[opt_idx].indir == PV_WRAP(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WRAP))))
2684 goto skip;
2685 }
2686
2687#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
2688 /* Disallow changing some options in the sandbox */
2689 if (sandbox != 0 && (flags & P_SECURE0x40000L)) {
2690 errmsg = (char_u *)_(e_sandbox)gettext((char *)(e_sandbox));
2691 goto skip;
2692 }
2693#endif
2694
2695 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"?=:!&<", nextchar) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2696 arg += len;
2697 cp_val = p_cp;
2698 if (nextchar == '&' && arg[1] == 'v' && arg[2] == 'i') {
2699 if (arg[3] == 'm') { /* "opt&vim": set to Vim default */
2700 cp_val = FALSE0;
2701 arg += 3;
2702 } else { /* "opt&vi": set to Vi default */
2703 cp_val = TRUE1;
2704 arg += 2;
2705 }
2706 }
2707 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"?!&<", nextchar) != NULL((void*)0)
2708 && arg[1] != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(arg[1])((arg[1]) == ' ' || (arg[1]) == '\t')) {
2709 errmsg = e_trailing;
2710 goto skip;
2711 }
2712 }
2713
2714 /*
2715 * allow '=' and ':' as MSDOS command.com allows only one
2716 * '=' character per "set" command line. grrr. (jw)
2717 */
2718 if (nextchar == '?'
2719 || (prefix == 1
2720 && vim_strchr((char_u *)"=:&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)
2721 && !(flags & P_BOOL0x01))) {
2722 /*
2723 * print value
2724 */
2725 if (did_show)
2726 msg_putchar('\n'); /* cursor below last one */
2727 else {
2728 gotocmdline(TRUE1); /* cursor at status line */
2729 did_show = TRUE1; /* remember that we did a line */
2730 }
2731 if (opt_idx >= 0) {
2732 showoneopt(&options[opt_idx], opt_flags);
2733 if (p_verbose > 0) {
2734 /* Mention where the option was last set. */
2735 if (varp == options[opt_idx].var)
2736 last_set_msg(options[opt_idx].scriptID);
2737 else if ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_WIN0x2000)
2738 last_set_msg(curwin->w_p_scriptIDw_onebuf_opt.wo_scriptID[
2739 (int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_MASK0x0fff]);
2740 else if ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BUF0x4000)
2741 last_set_msg(curbuf->b_p_scriptID[
2742 (int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_MASK0x0fff]);
2743 }
2744 } else {
2745 char_u *p;
2746
2747 p = find_termcode(key_name);
2748 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
2749 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E846: Key code not set")"E846: Key code not set";
2750 goto skip;
2751 } else
2752 (void)show_one_termcode(key_name, p, TRUE1);
2753 }
2754 if (nextchar != '?'
2755 && nextchar != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(afterchar)((afterchar) == ' ' || (afterchar) == '\t'))
2756 errmsg = e_trailing;
2757 } else {
2758 if (flags & P_BOOL0x01) { /* boolean */
2759 if (nextchar == '=' || nextchar == ':') {
2760 errmsg = e_invarg;
2761 goto skip;
2762 }
2763
2764 /*
2765 * ":set opt!": invert
2766 * ":set opt&": reset to default value
2767 * ":set opt<": reset to global value
2768 */
2769 if (nextchar == '!')
2770 value = *(int *)(varp) ^ 1;
2771 else if (nextchar == '&')
2772 value = (int)(intptr_t)options[opt_idx].def_val[
2773 ((flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) || cp_val)
2774 ? VI_DEFAULT0 : VIM_DEFAULT1];
2775 else if (nextchar == '<') {
2776 /* For 'autoread' -1 means to use global value. */
2777 if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ar
2778 && opt_flags == OPT_LOCAL4)
2779 value = -1;
2780 else
2781 value = *(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]),
2782 OPT_GLOBAL2);
2783 } else {
2784 /*
2785 * ":set invopt": invert
2786 * ":set opt" or ":set noopt": set or reset
2787 */
2788 if (nextchar != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(afterchar)((afterchar) == ' ' || (afterchar) == '\t')) {
2789 errmsg = e_trailing;
2790 goto skip;
2791 }
2792 if (prefix == 2) /* inv */
2793 value = *(int *)(varp) ^ 1;
2794 else
2795 value = prefix;
2796 }
2797
2798 errmsg = set_bool_option(opt_idx, varp, (int)value,
2799 opt_flags);
2800 } else { /* numeric or string */
2801 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"=:&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)
2802 || prefix != 1) {
2803 errmsg = e_invarg;
2804 goto skip;
2805 }
2806
2807 if (flags & P_NUM0x02) { /* numeric */
2808 /*
2809 * Different ways to set a number option:
2810 * & set to default value
2811 * < set to global value
2812 * <xx> accept special key codes for 'wildchar'
2813 * c accept any non-digit for 'wildchar'
2814 * [-]0-9 set number
2815 * other error
2816 */
2817 ++arg;
2818 if (nextchar == '&')
2819 value = (long)options[opt_idx].def_val[
2820 ((flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) || cp_val)
2821 ? VI_DEFAULT0 : VIM_DEFAULT1];
2822 else if (nextchar == '<') {
2823 /* For 'undolevels' NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL means to
2824 * use the global value. */
2825 if ((long *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ul
2826 && opt_flags == OPT_LOCAL4)
2827 value = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL-123456;
2828 else
2829 value = *(long *)get_varp_scope(
2830 &(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2);
2831 } else if (((long *)varp == &p_wc
2832 || (long *)varp == &p_wcm)
2833 && (*arg == '<'
2834 || *arg == '^'
2835 || ((!arg[1] || vim_iswhite(arg[1])((arg[1]) == ' ' || (arg[1]) == '\t'))
2836 && !VIM_ISDIGIT(*arg)((unsigned)(*arg) - '0' < 10)))) {
2837 value = string_to_key(arg);
2838 if (value == 0 && (long *)varp != &p_wcm) {
2839 errmsg = e_invarg;
2840 goto skip;
2841 }
2842 }
2843 /* allow negative numbers (for 'undolevels') */
2844 else if (*arg == '-' || VIM_ISDIGIT(*arg)((unsigned)(*arg) - '0' < 10)) {
2845 i = 0;
2846 if (*arg == '-')
2847 i = 1;
2848 value = strtol((char *)arg, NULL((void*)0), 0);
2849 if (arg[i] == '0' && TOLOWER_ASC(arg[i + 1])(((arg[i + 1]) < 'A' || (arg[i + 1]) > 'Z') ? (arg[i + 1
]) : (arg[i + 1]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'x')
2850 i += 2;
2851 while (VIM_ISDIGIT(arg[i])((unsigned)(arg[i]) - '0' < 10))
2852 ++i;
2853 if (arg[i] != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(arg[i])((arg[i]) == ' ' || (arg[i]) == '\t')) {
2854 errmsg = e_invarg;
2855 goto skip;
2856 }
2857 } else {
2858 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E521: Number required after =")"E521: Number required after =";
2859 goto skip;
2860 }
2861
2862 if (adding)
2863 value = *(long *)varp + value;
2864 if (prepending)
2865 value = *(long *)varp * value;
2866 if (removing)
2867 value = *(long *)varp - value;
2868 errmsg = set_num_option(opt_idx, varp, value,
2869 errbuf, sizeof(errbuf), opt_flags);
2870 } else if (opt_idx >= 0) { /* string */
2871 char_u *save_arg = NULL((void*)0);
2872 char_u *s = NULL((void*)0);
2873 char_u *oldval; /* previous value if *varp */
2874 char_u *newval;
2875 char_u *origval;
2876 unsigned newlen;
2877 int comma;
2878 int bs;
2879 int new_value_alloced; /* new string option
2880 was allocated */
2881
2882 /* When using ":set opt=val" for a global option
2883 * with a local value the local value will be
2884 * reset, use the global value here. */
2885 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0
2886 && ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BOTH0x1000))
2887 varp = options[opt_idx].var;
2888
2889 /* The old value is kept until we are sure that the
2890 * new value is valid. */
2891 oldval = *(char_u **)varp;
2892 if (nextchar == '&') { /* set to default val */
2893 newval = options[opt_idx].def_val[
2894 ((flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) || cp_val)
2895 ? VI_DEFAULT0 : VIM_DEFAULT1];
2896 if ((char_u **)varp == &p_bg) {
2897 /* guess the value of 'background' */
2898 newval = term_bg_default();
2899 }
2900
2901 /* expand environment variables and ~ (since the
2902 * default value was already expanded, only
2903 * required when an environment variable was set
2904 * later */
2905 if (newval == NULL((void*)0))
2906 newval = empty_option;
2907 else {
2908 s = option_expand(opt_idx, newval);
2909 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
2910 s = newval;
2911 newval = vim_strsave(s);
2912 }
2913 new_value_alloced = TRUE1;
2914 } else if (nextchar == '<') { /* set to global val */
2915 newval = vim_strsave(*(char_u **)get_varp_scope(
2916 &(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2));
2917 new_value_alloced = TRUE1;
2918 } else {
2919 ++arg; /* jump to after the '=' or ':' */
2920
2921 /*
2922 * Set 'keywordprg' to ":help" if an empty
2923 * value was passed to :set by the user.
2924 * Misuse errbuf[] for the resulting string.
2925 */
2926 if (varp == (char_u *)&p_kp
2927 && (*arg == NUL'\000' || *arg == ' ')) {
2928 STRCPY(errbuf, ":help")strcpy((char *)(errbuf), (char *)(":help"));
2929 save_arg = arg;
2930 arg = errbuf;
2931 }
2932 /*
2933 * Convert 'backspace' number to string, for
2934 * adding, prepending and removing string.
2935 */
2936 else if (varp == (char_u *)&p_bs
2937 && VIM_ISDIGIT(**(char_u **)varp)((unsigned)(**(char_u **)varp) - '0' < 10)) {
2938 i = getdigits((char_u **)varp);
2939 switch (i) {
2940 case 0:
2941 *(char_u **)varp = empty_option;
2942 break;
2943 case 1:
2944 *(char_u **)varp = vim_strsave(
2945 (char_u *)"indent,eol");
2946 break;
2947 case 2:
2948 *(char_u **)varp = vim_strsave(
2949 (char_u *)"indent,eol,start");
2950 break;
2951 }
2952 free(oldval);
2953 oldval = *(char_u **)varp;
2954 }
2955 /*
2956 * Convert 'whichwrap' number to string, for
2957 * backwards compatibility with Vim 3.0.
2958 * Misuse errbuf[] for the resulting string.
2959 */
2960 else if (varp == (char_u *)&p_ww
2961 && VIM_ISDIGIT(*arg)((unsigned)(*arg) - '0' < 10)) {
2962 *errbuf = NUL'\000';
2963 i = getdigits(&arg);
2964 if (i & 1)
2965 STRCAT(errbuf, "b,")strcat((char *)(errbuf), (char *)("b,"));
2966 if (i & 2)
2967 STRCAT(errbuf, "s,")strcat((char *)(errbuf), (char *)("s,"));
2968 if (i & 4)
2969 STRCAT(errbuf, "h,l,")strcat((char *)(errbuf), (char *)("h,l,"));
2970 if (i & 8)
2971 STRCAT(errbuf, "<,>,")strcat((char *)(errbuf), (char *)("<,>,"));
2972 if (i & 16)
2973 STRCAT(errbuf, "[,],")strcat((char *)(errbuf), (char *)("[,],"));
2974 if (*errbuf != NUL'\000') /* remove trailing , */
2975 errbuf[STRLEN(errbuf)strlen((char *)(errbuf)) - 1] = NUL'\000';
2976 save_arg = arg;
2977 arg = errbuf;
2978 }
2979 /*
2980 * Remove '>' before 'dir' and 'bdir', for
2981 * backwards compatibility with version 3.0
2982 */
2983 else if ( *arg == '>'
2984 && (varp == (char_u *)&p_dir
2985 || varp == (char_u *)&p_bdir)) {
2986 ++arg;
2987 }
2988
2989 /* When setting the local value of a global
2990 * option, the old value may be the global value. */
2991 if (((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BOTH0x1000)
2992 && (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4))
2993 origval = *(char_u **)get_varp(
2994 &options[opt_idx]);
2995 else
2996 origval = oldval;
2997
2998 /*
2999 * Copy the new string into allocated memory.
3000 * Can't use set_string_option_direct(), because
3001 * we need to remove the backslashes.
3002 */
3003 /* get a bit too much */
3004 newlen = (unsigned)STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)) + 1;
3005 if (adding || prepending || removing)
3006 newlen += (unsigned)STRLEN(origval)strlen((char *)(origval)) + 1;
3007 newval = xmalloc(newlen);
3008 s = newval;
3009
3010 /*
3011 * Copy the string, skip over escaped chars.
3012 * For WIN32 backslashes before normal
3013 * file name characters are not removed, and keep
3014 * backslash at start, for "\\machine\path", but
3015 * do remove it for "\\\\machine\\path".
3016 * The reverse is found in ExpandOldSetting().
3017 */
3018 while (*arg && !vim_iswhite(*arg)((*arg) == ' ' || (*arg) == '\t')) {
3019 if (*arg == '\\' && arg[1] != NUL'\000'
3020#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
3021 && !((flags & P_EXPAND0x10)
3022 && vim_isfilec(arg[1])
3023 && (arg[1] != '\\'
3024 || (s == newval
3025 && arg[2] != '\\')))
3026#endif
3027 )
3028 ++arg; /* remove backslash */
3029 if (has_mbyte
3030 && (i = (*mb_ptr2len)(arg)) > 1) {
3031 /* copy multibyte char */
3032 memmove(s, arg, (size_t)i);
3033 arg += i;
3034 s += i;
3035 } else
3036 *s++ = *arg++;
3037 }
3038 *s = NUL'\000';
3039
3040 /*
3041 * Expand environment variables and ~.
3042 * Don't do it when adding without inserting a
3043 * comma.
3044 */
3045 if (!(adding || prepending || removing)
3046 || (flags & P_COMMA0x8000)) {
3047 s = option_expand(opt_idx, newval);
3048 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
3049 free(newval);
3050 newlen = (unsigned)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)) + 1;
3051 if (adding || prepending || removing)
3052 newlen += (unsigned)STRLEN(origval)strlen((char *)(origval)) + 1;
3053 newval = xmalloc(newlen);
3054 STRCPY(newval, s)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(s));
3055 }
3056 }
3057
3058 /* locate newval[] in origval[] when removing it
3059 * and when adding to avoid duplicates */
3060 i = 0; /* init for GCC */
3061 if (removing || (flags & P_NODUP0x10000L)) {
3062 i = (int)STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval));
3063 bs = 0;
3064 for (s = origval; *s; ++s) {
3065 if ((!(flags & P_COMMA0x8000)
3066 || s == origval
3067 || (s[-1] == ',' && !(bs & 1)))
3068 && STRNCMP(s, newval, i)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)(newval), (size_t)(i)) == 0
3069 && (!(flags & P_COMMA0x8000)
3070 || s[i] == ','
3071 || s[i] == NUL'\000'))
3072 break;
3073 /* Count backslashes. Only a comma with an
3074 * even number of backslashes before it is
3075 * recognized as a separator */
3076 if (s > origval && s[-1] == '\\')
3077 ++bs;
3078 else
3079 bs = 0;
3080 }
3081
3082 /* do not add if already there */
3083 if ((adding || prepending) && *s) {
3084 prepending = FALSE0;
3085 adding = FALSE0;
3086 STRCPY(newval, origval)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(origval));
3087 }
3088 }
3089
3090 /* concatenate the two strings; add a ',' if
3091 * needed */
3092 if (adding || prepending) {
3093 comma = ((flags & P_COMMA0x8000) && *origval != NUL'\000'
3094 && *newval != NUL'\000');
3095 if (adding) {
3096 i = (int)STRLEN(origval)strlen((char *)(origval));
3097 memmove(newval + i + comma, newval,
3098 STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)) + 1);
3099 memmove(newval, origval, (size_t)i);
3100 } else {
3101 i = (int)STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval));
3102 STRMOVE(newval + i + comma, origval)memmove((newval + i + comma), (origval), strlen((char *)(origval
)) + 1);
3103 }
3104 if (comma)
3105 newval[i] = ',';
3106 }
3107
3108 /* Remove newval[] from origval[]. (Note: "i" has
3109 * been set above and is used here). */
3110 if (removing) {
3111 STRCPY(newval, origval)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(origval));
3112 if (*s) {
3113 /* may need to remove a comma */
3114 if (flags & P_COMMA0x8000) {
3115 if (s == origval) {
3116 /* include comma after string */
3117 if (s[i] == ',')
3118 ++i;
3119 } else {
3120 /* include comma before string */
3121 --s;
3122 ++i;
3123 }
3124 }
3125 STRMOVE(newval + (s - origval), s + i)memmove((newval + (s - origval)), (s + i), strlen((char *)(s +
i)) + 1);
3126 }
3127 }
3128
3129 if (flags & P_FLAGLIST0x20000L) {
3130 /* Remove flags that appear twice. */
3131 for (s = newval; *s; ++s)
3132 if ((!(flags & P_COMMA0x8000) || *s != ',')
3133 && vim_strchr(s + 1, *s) != NULL((void*)0)) {
3134 STRMOVE(s, s + 1)memmove((s), (s + 1), strlen((char *)(s + 1)) + 1);
3135 --s;
3136 }
3137 }
3138
3139 if (save_arg != NULL((void*)0)) /* number for 'whichwrap' */
3140 arg = save_arg;
3141 new_value_alloced = TRUE1;
3142 }
3143
3144 /* Set the new value. */
3145 *(char_u **)(varp) = newval;
3146
3147 /* Handle side effects, and set the global value for
3148 * ":set" on local options. */
3149 errmsg = did_set_string_option(opt_idx, (char_u **)varp,
3150 new_value_alloced, oldval, errbuf, opt_flags);
3151
3152 /* If error detected, print the error message. */
3153 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0))
3154 goto skip;
3155 } else { /* key code option */
3156 char_u *p;
3157
3158 if (nextchar == '&') {
3159 if (add_termcap_entry(key_name, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
3160 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E522: Not found in termcap")"E522: Not found in termcap";
3161 } else {
3162 ++arg; /* jump to after the '=' or ':' */
3163 for (p = arg; *p && !vim_iswhite(*p)((*p) == ' ' || (*p) == '\t'); ++p)
3164 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000')
3165 ++p;
3166 nextchar = *p;
3167 *p = NUL'\000';
3168 add_termcode(key_name, arg, FALSE0);
3169 *p = nextchar;
3170 }
3171 if (full_screen)
3172 ttest(FALSE0);
3173 redraw_all_later(CLEAR50);
3174 }
3175 }
3176
3177 if (opt_idx >= 0)
3178 did_set_option(opt_idx, opt_flags,
3179 !prepending && !adding && !removing);
3180 }
3181
3182skip:
3183 /*
3184 * Advance to next argument.
3185 * - skip until a blank found, taking care of backslashes
3186 * - skip blanks
3187 * - skip one "=val" argument (for hidden options ":set gfn =xx")
3188 */
3189 for (i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
3190 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(*arg)((*arg) == ' ' || (*arg) == '\t'))
3191 if (*arg++ == '\\' && *arg != NUL'\000')
3192 ++arg;
3193 arg = skipwhite(arg);
3194 if (*arg != '=')
3195 break;
3196 }
3197 }
3198
3199 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
3200 STRLCPY(IObuff, _(errmsg), IOSIZE)xstrlcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(gettext((char *)(errmsg))
), (size_t)((1024+1)));
3201 i = (int)STRLEN(IObuff)strlen((char *)(IObuff)) + 2;
3202 if (i + (arg - startarg) < IOSIZE(1024+1)) {
3203 /* append the argument with the error */
3204 STRCAT(IObuff, ": ")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(": "));
3205 memmove(IObuff + i, startarg, (arg - startarg));
3206 IObuff[i + (arg - startarg)] = NUL'\000';
3207 }
3208 /* make sure all characters are printable */
3209 trans_characters(IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1));
3210
3211 ++no_wait_return; /* wait_return done later */
3212 emsg(IObuff); /* show error highlighted */
3213 --no_wait_return;
3214
3215 return FAIL0;
3216 }
3217
3218 arg = skipwhite(arg);
3219 }
3220
3221theend:
3222 if (silent_mode && did_show) {
3223 /* After displaying option values in silent mode. */
3224 silent_mode = FALSE0;
3225 info_message = TRUE1; /* use mch_msg(), not mch_errmsg() */
3226 msg_putchar('\n');
3227 cursor_on(); /* msg_start() switches it off */
3228 out_flush();
3229 silent_mode = TRUE1;
3230 info_message = FALSE0; /* use mch_msg(), not mch_errmsg() */
3231 }
3232
3233 return OK1;
3234}
3235
3236/*
3237 * Call this when an option has been given a new value through a user command.
3238 * Sets the P_WAS_SET flag and takes care of the P_INSECURE flag.
3239 */
3240static void
3241did_set_option (
3242 int opt_idx,
3243 int opt_flags, /* possibly with OPT_MODELINE */
3244 int new_value /* value was replaced completely */
3245)
3246{
3247 long_u *p;
3248
3249 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_WAS_SET0x100;
3250
3251 /* When an option is set in the sandbox, from a modeline or in secure mode
3252 * set the P_INSECURE flag. Otherwise, if a new value is stored reset the
3253 * flag. */
3254 p = insecure_flag(opt_idx, opt_flags);
3255 if (secure
3256#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
3257 || sandbox != 0
3258#endif
3259 || (opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE8))
3260 *p = *p | P_INSECURE0x400000L;
3261 else if (new_value)
3262 *p = *p & ~P_INSECURE0x400000L;
3263}
3264
3265static char_u *illegal_char(char_u *errbuf, int c)
3266{
3267 if (errbuf == NULL((void*)0))
3268 return (char_u *)"";
3269 sprintf((char *)errbuf, _("E539: Illegal character <%s>")gettext((char *)("E539: Illegal character <%s>")),
3270 (char *)transchar(c));
3271 return errbuf;
3272}
3273
3274/*
3275 * Convert a key name or string into a key value.
3276 * Used for 'wildchar' and 'cedit' options.
3277 */
3278static int string_to_key(char_u *arg)
3279{
3280 if (*arg == '<')
3281 return find_key_option(arg + 1);
3282 if (*arg == '^')
3283 return Ctrl_chr(arg[1])((((arg[1]) < 'a' || (arg[1]) > 'z') ? (arg[1]) : (arg[
1]) - ('a' - 'A')) ^ 0x40);
3284 return *arg;
3285}
3286
3287/*
3288 * Check value of 'cedit' and set cedit_key.
3289 * Returns NULL if value is OK, error message otherwise.
3290 */
3291static char_u *check_cedit(void)
3292{
3293 int n;
3294
3295 if (*p_cedit == NUL'\000')
3296 cedit_key = -1;
3297 else {
3298 n = string_to_key(p_cedit);
3299 if (vim_isprintc(n))
3300 return e_invarg;
3301 cedit_key = n;
3302 }
3303 return NULL((void*)0);
3304}
3305
3306/*
3307 * When changing 'title', 'titlestring', 'icon' or 'iconstring', call
3308 * maketitle() to create and display it.
3309 * When switching the title or icon off, call mch_restore_title() to get
3310 * the old value back.
3311 */
3312static void
3313did_set_title (
3314 int icon /* Did set icon instead of title */
3315)
3316{
3317 if (starting != NO_SCREEN2
3318 ) {
3319 maketitle();
3320 if (icon) {
3321 if (!p_icon)
3322 mch_restore_title(2);
3323 } else {
3324 if (!p_title)
3325 mch_restore_title(1);
3326 }
3327 }
3328}
3329
3330/*
3331 * set_options_bin - called when 'bin' changes value.
3332 */
3333void
3334set_options_bin (
3335 int oldval,
3336 int newval,
3337 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
3338)
3339{
3340 /*
3341 * The option values that are changed when 'bin' changes are
3342 * copied when 'bin is set and restored when 'bin' is reset.
3343 */
3344 if (newval) {
3345 if (!oldval) { /* switched on */
3346 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2)) {
3347 curbuf->b_p_tw_nobin = curbuf->b_p_tw;
3348 curbuf->b_p_wm_nobin = curbuf->b_p_wm;
3349 curbuf->b_p_ml_nobin = curbuf->b_p_ml;
3350 curbuf->b_p_et_nobin = curbuf->b_p_et;
3351 }
3352 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)) {
3353 p_tw_nobin = p_tw;
3354 p_wm_nobin = p_wm;
3355 p_ml_nobin = p_ml;
3356 p_et_nobin = p_et;
3357 }
3358 }
3359
3360 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2)) {
3361 curbuf->b_p_tw = 0; /* no automatic line wrap */
3362 curbuf->b_p_wm = 0; /* no automatic line wrap */
3363 curbuf->b_p_ml = 0; /* no modelines */
3364 curbuf->b_p_et = 0; /* no expandtab */
3365 }
3366 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)) {
3367 p_tw = 0;
3368 p_wm = 0;
3369 p_ml = FALSE0;
3370 p_et = FALSE0;
3371 p_bin = TRUE1; /* needed when called for the "-b" argument */
3372 }
3373 } else if (oldval) { /* switched off */
3374 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2)) {
3375 curbuf->b_p_tw = curbuf->b_p_tw_nobin;
3376 curbuf->b_p_wm = curbuf->b_p_wm_nobin;
3377 curbuf->b_p_ml = curbuf->b_p_ml_nobin;
3378 curbuf->b_p_et = curbuf->b_p_et_nobin;
3379 }
3380 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)) {
3381 p_tw = p_tw_nobin;
3382 p_wm = p_wm_nobin;
3383 p_ml = p_ml_nobin;
3384 p_et = p_et_nobin;
3385 }
3386 }
3387}
3388
3389/*
3390 * Find the parameter represented by the given character (eg ', :, ", or /),
3391 * and return its associated value in the 'viminfo' string.
3392 * Only works for number parameters, not for 'r' or 'n'.
3393 * If the parameter is not specified in the string or there is no following
3394 * number, return -1.
3395 */
3396int get_viminfo_parameter(int type)
3397{
3398 char_u *p;
3399
3400 p = find_viminfo_parameter(type);
3401 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10))
3402 return atoi((char *)p);
3403 return -1;
3404}
3405
3406/*
3407 * Find the parameter represented by the given character (eg ''', ':', '"', or
3408 * '/') in the 'viminfo' option and return a pointer to the string after it.
3409 * Return NULL if the parameter is not specified in the string.
3410 */
3411char_u *find_viminfo_parameter(int type)
3412{
3413 char_u *p;
3414
3415 for (p = p_viminfo; *p; ++p) {
3416 if (*p == type)
3417 return p + 1;
3418 if (*p == 'n') /* 'n' is always the last one */
3419 break;
3420 p = vim_strchr(p, ','); /* skip until next ',' */
3421 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) /* hit the end without finding parameter */
3422 break;
3423 }
3424 return NULL((void*)0);
3425}
3426
3427/*
3428 * Expand environment variables for some string options.
3429 * These string options cannot be indirect!
3430 * If "val" is NULL expand the current value of the option.
3431 * Return pointer to NameBuff, or NULL when not expanded.
3432 */
3433static char_u *option_expand(int opt_idx, char_u *val)
3434{
3435 /* if option doesn't need expansion nothing to do */
3436 if (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_EXPAND0x10) || options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0))
3437 return NULL((void*)0);
3438
3439 /* If val is longer than MAXPATHL no meaningful expansion can be done,
3440 * expand_env() would truncate the string. */
3441 if (val != NULL((void*)0) && STRLEN(val)strlen((char *)(val)) > MAXPATHL4096)
3442 return NULL((void*)0);
3443
3444 if (val == NULL((void*)0))
3445 val = *(char_u **)options[opt_idx].var;
3446
3447 /*
3448 * Expanding this with NameBuff, expand_env() must not be passed IObuff.
3449 * Escape spaces when expanding 'tags', they are used to separate file
3450 * names.
3451 * For 'spellsuggest' expand after "file:".
3452 */
3453 expand_env_esc(val, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096,
3454 (char_u **)options[opt_idx].var == &p_tags, FALSE0,
3455 (char_u **)options[opt_idx].var == &p_sps ? (char_u *)"file:" :
3456 NULL((void*)0));
3457 if (STRCMP(NameBuff, val)strcmp((char *)(NameBuff), (char *)(val)) == 0) /* they are the same */
3458 return NULL((void*)0);
3459
3460 return NameBuff;
3461}
3462
3463/*
3464 * After setting various option values: recompute variables that depend on
3465 * option values.
3466 */
3467static void didset_options(void)
3468{
3469 /* initialize the table for 'iskeyword' et.al. */
3470 (void)init_chartab();
3471
3472 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_cmp, p_cmp_values, &cmp_flags, TRUE1);
3473 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_bkc, p_bkc_values, &bkc_flags, TRUE1);
3474 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_ssop, p_ssop_values, &ssop_flags, TRUE1);
3475 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_vop, p_ssop_values, &vop_flags, TRUE1);
3476 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_fdo, p_fdo_values, &fdo_flags, TRUE1);
3477 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_dy, p_dy_values, &dy_flags, TRUE1);
3478 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_ve, p_ve_values, &ve_flags, TRUE1);
3479#if defined(FEAT_MOUSE) && defined(UNIX)
3480 (void)opt_strings_flags(p_ttym, p_ttym_values, &ttym_flags, FALSE0);
3481#endif
3482 (void)spell_check_msm();
3483 (void)spell_check_sps();
3484 (void)compile_cap_prog(curwin->w_s);
3485 /* set cedit_key */
3486 (void)check_cedit();
3487 briopt_check();
3488}
3489
3490/*
3491 * Check for string options that are NULL (normally only termcap options).
3492 */
3493void check_options(void)
3494{
3495 int opt_idx;
3496
3497 for (opt_idx = 0; options[opt_idx].fullname != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++)
3498 if ((options[opt_idx].flags & P_STRING0x04) && options[opt_idx].var != NULL((void*)0))
3499 check_string_option((char_u **)get_varp(&(options[opt_idx])));
3500}
3501
3502/*
3503 * Check string options in a buffer for NULL value.
3504 */
3505void check_buf_options(buf_T *buf)
3506{
3507 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_bh);
3508 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_bt);
3509 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_fenc);
3510 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_ff);
3511 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_def);
3512 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_inc);
3513 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_inex);
3514 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_inde);
3515 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_indk);
3516 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_fex);
3517 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_kp);
3518 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_mps);
3519 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_fo);
3520 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_flp);
3521 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_isk);
3522 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_com);
3523 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cms);
3524 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_nf);
3525 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_qe);
3526 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_syn);
3527 check_string_option(&buf->b_s.b_p_spc);
3528 check_string_option(&buf->b_s.b_p_spf);
3529 check_string_option(&buf->b_s.b_p_spl);
3530 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_sua);
3531 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cink);
3532 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cino);
3533 parse_cino(buf);
3534 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_ft);
3535 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cinw);
3536 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cpt);
3537 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_cfu);
3538 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_ofu);
3539 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_keymap);
3540 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_gp);
3541 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_mp);
3542 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_efm);
3543 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_ep);
3544 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_path);
3545 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_tags);
3546 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_dict);
3547 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_tsr);
3548 check_string_option(&buf->b_p_lw);
3549}
3550
3551/*
3552 * Free the string allocated for an option.
3553 * Checks for the string being empty_option. This may happen if we're out of
3554 * memory, vim_strsave() returned NULL, which was replaced by empty_option by
3555 * check_options().
3556 * Does NOT check for P_ALLOCED flag!
3557 */
3558void free_string_option(char_u *p)
3559{
3560 if (p != empty_option)
3561 free(p);
3562}
3563
3564void clear_string_option(char_u **pp)
3565{
3566 if (*pp != empty_option)
3567 free(*pp);
3568 *pp = empty_option;
3569}
3570
3571static void check_string_option(char_u **pp)
3572{
3573 if (*pp == NULL((void*)0))
3574 *pp = empty_option;
3575}
3576
3577/*
3578 * Mark a terminal option as allocated, found by a pointer into term_strings[].
3579 */
3580void set_term_option_alloced(char_u **p)
3581{
3582 int opt_idx;
3583
3584 for (opt_idx = 1; options[opt_idx].fullname != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++)
3585 if (options[opt_idx].var == (char_u *)p) {
3586 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_ALLOCED0x08;
3587 return;
3588 }
3589 return; /* cannot happen: didn't find it! */
3590}
3591
3592/*
3593 * Return TRUE when option "opt" was set from a modeline or in secure mode.
3594 * Return FALSE when it wasn't.
3595 * Return -1 for an unknown option.
3596 */
3597int was_set_insecurely(char_u *opt, int opt_flags)
3598{
3599 int idx = findoption(opt);
3600 long_u *flagp;
3601
3602 if (idx >= 0) {
3603 flagp = insecure_flag(idx, opt_flags);
3604 return (*flagp & P_INSECURE0x400000L) != 0;
3605 }
3606 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "was_set_insecurely()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("was_set_insecurely()"
));
3607 return -1;
3608}
3609
3610/*
3611 * Get a pointer to the flags used for the P_INSECURE flag of option
3612 * "opt_idx". For some local options a local flags field is used.
3613 */
3614static long_u *insecure_flag(int opt_idx, int opt_flags)
3615{
3616 if (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)
3617 switch ((int)options[opt_idx].indir) {
3618 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL)))): return &curwin->w_p_stl_flags;
3619 case PV_FDE(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDE)): return &curwin->w_p_fde_flags;
3620 case PV_FDT(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDT)): return &curwin->w_p_fdt_flags;
