3621 case PV_INDE(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INDE)): return &curbuf->b_p_inde_flags;
3622 case PV_FEX(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FEX)): return &curbuf->b_p_fex_flags;
3623 case PV_INEX(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INEX)): return &curbuf->b_p_inex_flags;
3624 }
3625
3626 /* Nothing special, return global flags field. */
3627 return &options[opt_idx].flags;
3628}
3629
3630
3631/*
3632 * Redraw the window title and/or tab page text later.
3633 */
3634static void redraw_titles(void) {
3635 need_maketitle = TRUE1;
3636 redraw_tabline = TRUE1;
3637}
3638
3639/*
3640 * Set a string option to a new value (without checking the effect).
3641 * The string is copied into allocated memory.
3642 * if ("opt_idx" == -1) "name" is used, otherwise "opt_idx" is used.
3643 * When "set_sid" is zero set the scriptID to current_SID. When "set_sid" is
3644 * SID_NONE don't set the scriptID. Otherwise set the scriptID to "set_sid".
3645 */
3646void
3647set_string_option_direct (
3648 char_u *name,
3649 int opt_idx,
3650 char_u *val,
3651 int opt_flags, /* OPT_FREE, OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
3652 int set_sid
3653)
3654{
3655 char_u *s;
3656 char_u **varp;
3657 int both = (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0;
3658 int idx = opt_idx;
3659
3660 if (idx == -1) { /* use name */
3661 idx = findoption(name);
3662 if (idx < 0) { /* not found (should not happen) */
3663 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "set_string_option_direct()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("set_string_option_direct()"
));
3664 return;
3665 }
3666 }
3667
3668 if (options[idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) /* can't set hidden option */
3669 return;
3670
3671 s = vim_strsave(val);
3672 {
3673 varp = (char_u **)get_varp_scope(&(options[idx]),
3674 both ? OPT_LOCAL4 : opt_flags);
3675 if ((opt_flags & OPT_FREE1) && (options[idx].flags & P_ALLOCED0x08))
3676 free_string_option(*varp);
3677 *varp = s;
3678
3679 /* For buffer/window local option may also set the global value. */
3680 if (both)
3681 set_string_option_global(idx, varp);
3682
3683 options[idx].flags |= P_ALLOCED0x08;
3684
3685 /* When setting both values of a global option with a local value,
3686 * make the local value empty, so that the global value is used. */
3687 if (((int)options[idx].indir & PV_BOTH0x1000) && both) {
3688 free_string_option(*varp);
3689 *varp = empty_option;
3690 }
3691 if (set_sid != SID_NONE-6)
3692 set_option_scriptID_idx(idx, opt_flags,
3693 set_sid == 0 ? current_SID : set_sid);
3694 }
3695}
3696
3697/*
3698 * Set global value for string option when it's a local option.
3699 */
3700static void
3701set_string_option_global (
3702 int opt_idx, /* option index */
3703 char_u **varp /* pointer to option variable */
3704)
3705{
3706 char_u **p, *s;
3707
3708 /* the global value is always allocated */
3709 if (options[opt_idx].var == VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1))
3710 p = (char_u **)GLOBAL_WO(varp)((char *)varp + sizeof(winopt_T));
3711 else
3712 p = (char_u **)options[opt_idx].var;
3713 if (options[opt_idx].indir != PV_NONE && p != varp) {
3714 s = vim_strsave(*varp);
3715 free_string_option(*p);
3716 *p = s;
3717 }
3718}
3719
3720/*
3721 * Set a string option to a new value, and handle the effects.
3722 *
3723 * Returns NULL on success or error message on error.
3724 */
3725static char_u *
3726set_string_option (
3727 int opt_idx,
3728 char_u *value,
3729 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
3730)
3731{
3732 char_u *s;
3733 char_u **varp;
3734 char_u *oldval;
3735 char_u *r = NULL((void*)0);
3736
3737 if (options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) /* don't set hidden option */
3738 return NULL((void*)0);
3739
3740 s = vim_strsave(value);
3741 varp = (char_u **)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]),
3742 (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0
3743 ? (((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BOTH0x1000)
3744 ? OPT_GLOBAL2 : OPT_LOCAL4)
3745 : opt_flags);
3746 oldval = *varp;
3747 *varp = s;
3748 if ((r = did_set_string_option(opt_idx, varp, TRUE1, oldval, NULL((void*)0),
3749 opt_flags)) == NULL((void*)0))
3750 did_set_option(opt_idx, opt_flags, TRUE1);
3751
3752 return r;
3753}
3754
3755/*
3756 * Handle string options that need some action to perform when changed.
3757 * Returns NULL for success, or an error message for an error.
3758 */
3759static char_u *
3760did_set_string_option (
3761 int opt_idx, /* index in options[] table */
3762 char_u **varp, /* pointer to the option variable */
3763 int new_value_alloced, /* new value was allocated */
3764 char_u *oldval, /* previous value of the option */
3765 char_u *errbuf, /* buffer for errors, or NULL */
3766 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
3767)
3768{
3769 char_u *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
3770 char_u *s, *p;
3771 int did_chartab = FALSE0;
3772 char_u **gvarp;
3773 long_u free_oldval = (options[opt_idx].flags & P_ALLOCED0x08);
3774
3775 /* Get the global option to compare with, otherwise we would have to check
3776 * two values for all local options. */
3777 gvarp = (char_u **)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2);
3778
3779 /* Disallow changing some options from secure mode */
3780 if ((secure
3781#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
3782 || sandbox != 0
3783#endif
3784 ) && (options[opt_idx].flags & P_SECURE0x40000L)) {
3785 errmsg = e_secure;
3786 }
3787 /* Check for a "normal" file name in some options. Disallow a path
3788 * separator (slash and/or backslash), wildcards and characters that are
3789 * often illegal in a file name. */
3790 else if ((options[opt_idx].flags & P_NFNAME0x200000L)
3791 && vim_strpbrk(*varp, (char_u *)"/\\*?[|<>")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(*varp), (char *)((char_u *)"/\\*?[|<>"
)) != NULL((void*)0)) {
3792 errmsg = e_invarg;
3793 }
3794 /* 'term' */
3795 else if (varp == &T_NAME(term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])) {
3796 if (T_NAME(term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])[0] == NUL'\000')
3797 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E529: Cannot set 'term' to empty string")"E529: Cannot set 'term' to empty string";
3798 else if (set_termname(T_NAME(term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])) == FAIL0)
3799 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E522: Not found in termcap")"E522: Not found in termcap";
3800 else
3801 /* Screen colors may have changed. */
3802 redraw_later_clear();
3803 }
3804 /* 'backupcopy' */
3805 else if (varp == &p_bkc) {
3806 if (opt_strings_flags(p_bkc, p_bkc_values, &bkc_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
3807 errmsg = e_invarg;
3808 if (((bkc_flags & BKC_AUTO0x002) != 0)
3809 + ((bkc_flags & BKC_YES0x001) != 0)
3810 + ((bkc_flags & BKC_NO0x004) != 0) != 1) {
3811 /* Must have exactly one of "auto", "yes" and "no". */
3812 (void)opt_strings_flags(oldval, p_bkc_values, &bkc_flags, TRUE1);
3813 errmsg = e_invarg;
3814 }
3815 }
3816 /* 'backupext' and 'patchmode' */
3817 else if (varp == &p_bex || varp == &p_pm) {
3818 if (STRCMP(*p_bex == '.' ? p_bex + 1 : p_bex,strcmp((char *)(*p_bex == '.' ? p_bex + 1 : p_bex), (char *)(
*p_pm == '.' ? p_pm + 1 : p_pm))
3819 *p_pm == '.' ? p_pm + 1 : p_pm)strcmp((char *)(*p_bex == '.' ? p_bex + 1 : p_bex), (char *)(
*p_pm == '.' ? p_pm + 1 : p_pm)) == 0)
3820 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E589: 'backupext' and 'patchmode' are equal")"E589: 'backupext' and 'patchmode' are equal";
3821 }
3822 /* 'breakindentopt' */
3823 else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_brioptw_onebuf_opt.wo_briopt) {
3824 if (briopt_check() == FAIL0)
3825 errmsg = e_invarg;
3826 }
3827 /*
3828 * 'isident', 'iskeyword', 'isprint or 'isfname' option: refill chartab[]
3829 * If the new option is invalid, use old value. 'lisp' option: refill
3830 * chartab[] for '-' char
3831 */
3832 else if ( varp == &p_isi
3833 || varp == &(curbuf->b_p_isk)
3834 || varp == &p_isp
3835 || varp == &p_isf) {
3836 if (init_chartab() == FAIL0) {
3837 did_chartab = TRUE1; /* need to restore it below */
3838 errmsg = e_invarg; /* error in value */
3839 }
3840 }
3841 /* 'helpfile' */
3842 else if (varp == &p_hf) {
3843 /* May compute new values for $VIM and $VIMRUNTIME */
3844 if (didset_vim) {
3845 vim_setenv((char_u *)"VIM", (char_u *)"");
3846 didset_vim = FALSE0;
3847 }
3848 if (didset_vimruntime) {
3849 vim_setenv((char_u *)"VIMRUNTIME", (char_u *)"");
3850 didset_vimruntime = FALSE0;
3851 }
3852 }
3853 /* 'colorcolumn' */
3854 else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_ccw_onebuf_opt.wo_cc)
3855 errmsg = check_colorcolumn(curwin);
3856
3857 /* 'helplang' */
3858 else if (varp == &p_hlg) {
3859 /* Check for "", "ab", "ab,cd", etc. */
3860 for (s = p_hlg; *s != NUL'\000'; s += 3) {
3861 if (s[1] == NUL'\000' || ((s[2] != ',' || s[3] == NUL'\000') && s[2] != NUL'\000')) {
3862 errmsg = e_invarg;
3863 break;
3864 }
3865 if (s[2] == NUL'\000')
3866 break;
3867 }
3868 }
3869 /* 'highlight' */
3870 else if (varp == &p_hl) {
3871 if (highlight_changed() == FAIL0)
3872 errmsg = e_invarg; /* invalid flags */
3873 }
3874 /* 'nrformats' */
3875 else if (gvarp == &p_nf) {
3876 if (check_opt_strings(*varp, p_nf_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
3877 errmsg = e_invarg;
3878 }
3879 /* 'sessionoptions' */
3880 else if (varp == &p_ssop) {
3881 if (opt_strings_flags(p_ssop, p_ssop_values, &ssop_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
3882 errmsg = e_invarg;
3883 if ((ssop_flags & SSOP_CURDIR0x1000) && (ssop_flags & SSOP_SESDIR0x800)) {
3884 /* Don't allow both "sesdir" and "curdir". */
3885 (void)opt_strings_flags(oldval, p_ssop_values, &ssop_flags, TRUE1);
3886 errmsg = e_invarg;
3887 }
3888 }
3889 /* 'viewoptions' */
3890 else if (varp == &p_vop) {
3891 if (opt_strings_flags(p_vop, p_ssop_values, &vop_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
3892 errmsg = e_invarg;
3893 }
3894 /* 'scrollopt' */
3895 else if (varp == &p_sbo) {
3896 if (check_opt_strings(p_sbo, p_scbopt_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
3897 errmsg = e_invarg;
3898 }
3899 /* 'ambiwidth' */
3900 else if (varp == &p_ambw) {
3901 if (check_opt_strings(p_ambw, p_ambw_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
3902 errmsg = e_invarg;
3903 else if (set_chars_option(&p_lcs) != NULL((void*)0))
3904 errmsg = (char_u *)_("E834: Conflicts with value of 'listchars'")gettext((char *)("E834: Conflicts with value of 'listchars'")
);
3905 else if (set_chars_option(&p_fcs) != NULL((void*)0))
3906 errmsg = (char_u *)_("E835: Conflicts with value of 'fillchars'")gettext((char *)("E835: Conflicts with value of 'fillchars'")
);
3907 }
3908 /* 'background' */
3909 else if (varp == &p_bg) {
3910 if (check_opt_strings(p_bg, p_bg_values, FALSE0) == OK1) {
3911 int dark = (*p_bg == 'd');
3912
3913 init_highlight(FALSE0, FALSE0);
3914
3915 if (dark != (*p_bg == 'd')
3916 && get_var_value((char_u *)"g:colors_name") != NULL((void*)0)) {
3917 /* The color scheme must have set 'background' back to another
3918 * value, that's not what we want here. Disable the color
3919 * scheme and set the colors again. */
3920 do_unlet((char_u *)"g:colors_name", TRUE1);
3921 free_string_option(p_bg);
3922 p_bg = vim_strsave((char_u *)(dark ? "dark" : "light"));
3923 check_string_option(&p_bg);
3924 init_highlight(FALSE0, FALSE0);
3925 }
3926 } else
3927 errmsg = e_invarg;
3928 }
3929 /* 'wildmode' */
3930 else if (varp == &p_wim) {
3931 if (check_opt_wim() == FAIL0)
3932 errmsg = e_invarg;
3933 }
3934 /* 'wildoptions' */
3935 else if (varp == &p_wop) {
3936 if (check_opt_strings(p_wop, p_wop_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
3937 errmsg = e_invarg;
3938 }
3939 /* 'winaltkeys' */
3940 else if (varp == &p_wak) {
3941 if (*p_wak == NUL'\000'
3942 || check_opt_strings(p_wak, p_wak_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
3943 errmsg = e_invarg;
3944 }
3945 /* 'eventignore' */
3946 else if (varp == &p_ei) {
3947 if (check_ei() == FAIL0)
3948 errmsg = e_invarg;
3949 }
3950 /* 'encoding' and 'fileencoding' */
3951 else if (varp == &p_enc || gvarp == &p_fenc || varp == &p_tenc) {
3952 if (gvarp == &p_fenc) {
3953 if (!curbuf->b_p_ma && opt_flags != OPT_GLOBAL2)
3954 errmsg = e_modifiable;
3955 else if (vim_strchr(*varp, ',') != NULL((void*)0))
3956 /* No comma allowed in 'fileencoding'; catches confusing it
3957 * with 'fileencodings'. */
3958 errmsg = e_invarg;
3959 else {
3960 /* May show a "+" in the title now. */
3961 redraw_titles();
3962 /* Add 'fileencoding' to the swap file. */
3963 ml_setflags(curbuf);
3964 }
3965 }
3966 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
3967 /* canonize the value, so that STRCMP() can be used on it */
3968 p = enc_canonize(*varp);
3969 free(*varp);
3970 *varp = p;
3971 if (varp == &p_enc) {
3972 errmsg = mb_init();
3973 redraw_titles();
3974 }
3975 }
3976
3977
3978 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
3979 /* When 'keymap' is used and 'encoding' changes, reload the keymap
3980 * (with another encoding). */
3981 if (varp == &p_enc && *curbuf->b_p_keymap != NUL'\000')
3982 (void)keymap_init();
3983
3984 /* When 'termencoding' is not empty and 'encoding' changes or when
3985 * 'termencoding' changes, need to setup for keyboard input and
3986 * display output conversion. */
3987 if (((varp == &p_enc && *p_tenc != NUL'\000') || varp == &p_tenc)) {
3988 convert_setup(&input_conv, p_tenc, p_enc);
3989 convert_setup(&output_conv, p_enc, p_tenc);
3990 }
3991
3992 }
3993 } else if (varp == &p_penc) {
3994 /* Canonize printencoding if VIM standard one */
3995 p = enc_canonize(p_penc);
3996 free(p_penc);
3997 p_penc = p;
3998 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_keymap) {
3999 /* load or unload key mapping tables */
4000 errmsg = keymap_init();
4001
4002 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
4003 if (*curbuf->b_p_keymap != NUL'\000') {
4004 /* Installed a new keymap, switch on using it. */
4005 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_LMAP1;
4006 if (curbuf->b_p_imsearch != B_IMODE_USE_INSERT-1)
4007 curbuf->b_p_imsearch = B_IMODE_LMAP1;
4008 } else {
4009 /* Cleared the keymap, may reset 'iminsert' and 'imsearch'. */
4010 if (curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_LMAP1)
4011 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
4012 if (curbuf->b_p_imsearch == B_IMODE_LMAP1)
4013 curbuf->b_p_imsearch = B_IMODE_USE_INSERT-1;
4014 }
4015 if ((opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4) == 0) {
4016 set_iminsert_global();
4017 set_imsearch_global();
4018 }
4019 status_redraw_curbuf();
4020 }
4021 }
4022 /* 'fileformat' */
4023 else if (gvarp == &p_ff) {
4024 if (!curbuf->b_p_ma && !(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2))
4025 errmsg = e_modifiable;
4026 else if (check_opt_strings(*varp, p_ff_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4027 errmsg = e_invarg;
4028 else {
4029 redraw_titles();
4030 /* update flag in swap file */
4031 ml_setflags(curbuf);
4032 /* Redraw needed when switching to/from "mac": a CR in the text
4033 * will be displayed differently. */
4034 if (get_fileformat(curbuf) == EOL_MAC2 || *oldval == 'm')
4035 redraw_curbuf_later(NOT_VALID40);
4036 }
4037 }
4038 /* 'fileformats' */
4039 else if (varp == &p_ffs) {
4040 if (check_opt_strings(p_ffs, p_ff_values, TRUE1) != OK1) {
4041 errmsg = e_invarg;
4042 }
4043 }
4044
4045 /* 'matchpairs' */
4046 else if (gvarp == &p_mps) {
4047 if (has_mbyte) {
4048 for (p = *varp; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p) {
4049 int x2 = -1;
4050 int x3 = -1;
4051
4052 if (*p != NUL'\000')
4053 p += mb_ptr2len(p);
4054 if (*p != NUL'\000')
4055 x2 = *p++;
4056 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
4057 x3 = mb_ptr2char(p);
4058 p += mb_ptr2len(p);
4059 }
4060 if (x2 != ':' || x3 == -1 || (*p != NUL'\000' && *p != ',')) {
4061 errmsg = e_invarg;
4062 break;
4063 }
4064 if (*p == NUL'\000')
4065 break;
4066 }
4067 } else {
4068 /* Check for "x:y,x:y" */
4069 for (p = *varp; *p != NUL'\000'; p += 4) {
4070 if (p[1] != ':' || p[2] == NUL'\000' || (p[3] != NUL'\000' && p[3] != ',')) {
4071 errmsg = e_invarg;
4072 break;
4073 }
4074 if (p[3] == NUL'\000')
4075 break;
4076 }
4077 }
4078 }
4079 /* 'comments' */
4080 else if (gvarp == &p_com) {
4081 for (s = *varp; *s; ) {
4082 while (*s && *s != ':') {
4083 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)COM_ALL"nbsmexflrO", *s) == NULL((void*)0)
4084 && !VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10) && *s != '-') {
4085 errmsg = illegal_char(errbuf, *s);
4086 break;
4087 }
4088 ++s;
4089 }
4090 if (*s++ == NUL'\000')
4091 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E524: Missing colon")"E524: Missing colon";
4092 else if (*s == ',' || *s == NUL'\000')
4093 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E525: Zero length string")"E525: Zero length string";
4094 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0))
4095 break;
4096 while (*s && *s != ',') {
4097 if (*s == '\\' && s[1] != NUL'\000')
4098 ++s;
4099 ++s;
4100 }
4101 s = skip_to_option_part(s);
4102 }
4103 }
4104 /* 'listchars' */
4105 else if (varp == &p_lcs) {
4106 errmsg = set_chars_option(varp);
4107 }
4108 /* 'fillchars' */
4109 else if (varp == &p_fcs) {
4110 errmsg = set_chars_option(varp);
4111 }
4112 /* 'cedit' */
4113 else if (varp == &p_cedit) {
4114 errmsg = check_cedit();
4115 }
4116 /* 'verbosefile' */
4117 else if (varp == &p_vfile) {
4118 verbose_stop();
4119 if (*p_vfile != NUL'\000' && verbose_open() == FAIL0)
4120 errmsg = e_invarg;
4121 }
4122 /* 'viminfo' */
4123 else if (varp == &p_viminfo) {
4124 for (s = p_viminfo; *s; ) {
4125 /* Check it's a valid character */
4126 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"!\"%'/:<@cfhnrs", *s) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4127 errmsg = illegal_char(errbuf, *s);
4128 break;
4129 }
4130 if (*s == 'n') { /* name is always last one */
4131 break;
4132 } else if (*s == 'r') { /* skip until next ',' */
4133 while (*++s && *s != ',')
4134 ;
4135 } else if (*s == '%') {
4136 /* optional number */
4137 while (vim_isdigit(*++s))
4138 ;
4139 } else if (*s == '!' || *s == 'h' || *s == 'c')
4140 ++s; /* no extra chars */
4141 else { /* must have a number */
4142 while (vim_isdigit(*++s))
4143 ;
4144
4145 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*(s - 1))((unsigned)(*(s - 1)) - '0' < 10)) {
4146 if (errbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
4147 sprintf((char *)errbuf,
4148 _("E526: Missing number after <%s>")gettext((char *)("E526: Missing number after <%s>")),
4149 transchar_byte(*(s - 1)));
4150 errmsg = errbuf;
4151 } else
4152 errmsg = (char_u *)"";
4153 break;
4154 }
4155 }
4156 if (*s == ',')
4157 ++s;
4158 else if (*s) {
4159 if (errbuf != NULL((void*)0))
4160 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E527: Missing comma")"E527: Missing comma";
4161 else
4162 errmsg = (char_u *)"";
4163 break;
4164 }
4165 }
4166 if (*p_viminfo && errmsg == NULL((void*)0) && get_viminfo_parameter('\'') < 0)
4167 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E528: Must specify a ' value")"E528: Must specify a ' value";
4168 }
4169 /* terminal options */
4170 else if (istermoption(&options[opt_idx]) && full_screen) {
4171 /* ":set t_Co=0" and ":set t_Co=1" do ":set t_Co=" */
4172 if (varp == &T_CCO(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCO)])) {
4173 int colors = atoi((char *)T_CCO(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCO)]));
4174
4175 /* Only reinitialize colors if t_Co value has really changed to
4176 * avoid expensive reload of colorscheme if t_Co is set to the
4177 * same value multiple times. */
4178 if (colors != t_colors) {
4179 t_colors = colors;
4180 if (t_colors <= 1) {
4181 if (new_value_alloced)
4182 free(T_CCO(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCO)]));
4183 T_CCO(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCO)]) = empty_option;
4184 }
4185 /* We now have a different color setup, initialize it again. */
4186 init_highlight(TRUE1, FALSE0);
4187 }
4188 }
4189 ttest(FALSE0);
4190 if (varp == &T_ME(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)])) {
4191 out_str(T_ME(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)]));
4192 redraw_later(CLEAR50);
4193 }
4194 }
4195 /* 'showbreak' */
4196 else if (varp == &p_sbr) {
4197 for (s = p_sbr; *s; ) {
4198 if (ptr2cells(s) != 1)
4199 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E595: contains unprintable or wide character")"E595: contains unprintable or wide character";
4200 mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1;
4201 }
4202 }
4203
4204 /* 'guicursor' */
4205 else if (varp == &p_guicursor)
4206 errmsg = parse_shape_opt(SHAPE_CURSOR2);
4207
4208 else if (varp == &p_popt)
4209 errmsg = parse_printoptions();
4210 else if (varp == &p_pmfn)
4211 errmsg = parse_printmbfont();
4212
4213 /* 'langmap' */
4214 else if (varp == &p_langmap)
4215 langmap_set();
4216
4217 /* 'breakat' */
4218 else if (varp == &p_breakat)
4219 fill_breakat_flags();
4220
4221 /* 'titlestring' and 'iconstring' */
4222 else if (varp == &p_titlestring || varp == &p_iconstring) {
4223 int flagval = (varp == &p_titlestring) ? STL_IN_TITLE2 : STL_IN_ICON1;
4224
4225 /* NULL => statusline syntax */
4226 if (vim_strchr(*varp, '%') && check_stl_option(*varp) == NULL((void*)0))
4227 stl_syntax |= flagval;
4228 else
4229 stl_syntax &= ~flagval;
4230 did_set_title(varp == &p_iconstring);
4231
4232 }
4233
4234
4235
4236#if defined(FEAT_MOUSE_TTY) && defined(UNIX)
4237 /* 'ttymouse' */
4238 else if (varp == &p_ttym) {
4239 /* Switch the mouse off before changing the escape sequences used for
4240 * that. */
4241 mch_setmouse(FALSE0);
4242 if (opt_strings_flags(p_ttym, p_ttym_values, &ttym_flags, FALSE0) != OK1)
4243 errmsg = e_invarg;
4244 else
4245 check_mouse_termcode();
4246 if (termcap_active)
4247 setmouse(); /* may switch it on again */
4248 }
4249#endif
4250
4251 /* 'selection' */
4252 else if (varp == &p_sel) {
4253 if (*p_sel == NUL'\000'
4254 || check_opt_strings(p_sel, p_sel_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4255 errmsg = e_invarg;
4256 }
4257 /* 'selectmode' */
4258 else if (varp == &p_slm) {
4259 if (check_opt_strings(p_slm, p_slm_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4260 errmsg = e_invarg;
4261 }
4262 /* 'keymodel' */
4263 else if (varp == &p_km) {
4264 if (check_opt_strings(p_km, p_km_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4265 errmsg = e_invarg;
4266 else {
4267 km_stopsel = (vim_strchr(p_km, 'o') != NULL((void*)0));
4268 km_startsel = (vim_strchr(p_km, 'a') != NULL((void*)0));
4269 }
4270 }

4272 else if (varp == &p_mousem) {
4273 if (check_opt_strings(p_mousem, p_mousem_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4274 errmsg = e_invarg;
4275 }

4277 else if (varp == &p_swb) {

4279 errmsg = e_invarg;
4280 }
4281 /* 'debug' */
4282 else if (varp == &p_debug) {
4283 if (check_opt_strings(p_debug, p_debug_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4284 errmsg = e_invarg;
4285 }
4286 /* 'display' */
4287 else if (varp == &p_dy) {

4289 errmsg = e_invarg;
4290 else
4291 (void)init_chartab();
4292
4293 }
4294 /* 'eadirection' */
4295 else if (varp == &p_ead) {
4296 if (check_opt_strings(p_ead, p_ead_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4297 errmsg = e_invarg;
4298 }
4299 /* When 'spelllang' or 'spellfile' is set and there is a window for this
4300 * buffer in which 'spell' is set load the wordlists. */
4301 else if (varp == &(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl) || varp == &(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf)) {
4302 int l;
4303
4304 if (varp == &(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf)) {
4305 l = (int)STRLEN(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf)strlen((char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf));
4306 if (l > 0 && (l < 4 || STRCMP(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf + l - 4,strcmp((char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf + l - 4), (char *)(".add"
))
4307 ".add")strcmp((char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spf + l - 4), (char *)(".add"
)) != 0))
4308 errmsg = e_invarg;
4309 }
4310
4311 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
4312 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, curtab)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4313 if (wp->w_buffer == curbuf && wp->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell) {
4314 errmsg = did_set_spelllang(wp);
4315 break;
4316 }
4317 }
4318 }
4319 }
4320 /* When 'spellcapcheck' is set compile the regexp program. */
4321 else if (varp == &(curwin->w_s->b_p_spc)) {
4322 errmsg = compile_cap_prog(curwin->w_s);
4323 }
4324 /* 'spellsuggest' */
4325 else if (varp == &p_sps) {
4326 if (spell_check_sps() != OK1)
4327 errmsg = e_invarg;
4328 }
4329 /* 'mkspellmem' */
4330 else if (varp == &p_msm) {
4331 if (spell_check_msm() != OK1)
4332 errmsg = e_invarg;
4333 }
4334 /* When 'bufhidden' is set, check for valid value. */
4335 else if (gvarp == &p_bh) {
4336 if (check_opt_strings(curbuf->b_p_bh, p_bufhidden_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4337 errmsg = e_invarg;
4338 }
4339 /* When 'buftype' is set, check for valid value. */
4340 else if (gvarp == &p_bt) {
4341 if (check_opt_strings(curbuf->b_p_bt, p_buftype_values, FALSE0) != OK1)
4342 errmsg = e_invarg;
4343 else {
4344 if (curwin->w_status_height) {
4345 curwin->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
4346 redraw_later(VALID10);
4347 }
4348 curbuf->b_help = (curbuf->b_p_bt[0] == 'h');
4349 redraw_titles();
4350 }
4351 }
4352 /* 'statusline' or 'rulerformat' */
4353 else if (gvarp == &p_stl || varp == &p_ruf) {
4354 int wid;
4355
4356 if (varp == &p_ruf) /* reset ru_wid first */
4357 ru_wid = 0;
4358 s = *varp;
4359 if (varp == &p_ruf && *s == '%') {
4360 /* set ru_wid if 'ruf' starts with "%99(" */
4361 if (*++s == '-') /* ignore a '-' */
4362 s++;
4363 wid = getdigits(&s);
4364 if (wid && *s == '(' && (errmsg = check_stl_option(p_ruf)) == NULL((void*)0))
4365 ru_wid = wid;
4366 else
4367 errmsg = check_stl_option(p_ruf);
4368 }
4369 /* check 'statusline' only if it doesn't start with "%!" */
4370 else if (varp == &p_ruf || s[0] != '%' || s[1] != '!')
4371 errmsg = check_stl_option(s);
4372 if (varp == &p_ruf && errmsg == NULL((void*)0))
4373 comp_col();
4374 }
4375 /* check if it is a valid value for 'complete' -- Acevedo */
4376 else if (gvarp == &p_cpt) {
4377 for (s = *varp; *s; ) {
4378 while (*s == ',' || *s == ' ')
4379 s++;
4380 if (!*s)
4381 break;
4382 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)".wbuksid]tU", *s) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4383 errmsg = illegal_char(errbuf, *s);
4384 break;
4385 }
4386 if (*++s != NUL'\000' && *s != ',' && *s != ' ') {
4387 if (s[-1] == 'k' || s[-1] == 's') {
4388 /* skip optional filename after 'k' and 's' */
4389 while (*s && *s != ',' && *s != ' ') {
4390 if (*s == '\\')
4391 ++s;
4392 ++s;
4393 }
4394 } else {
4395 if (errbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
4396 sprintf((char *)errbuf,
4397 _("E535: Illegal character after <%c>")gettext((char *)("E535: Illegal character after <%c>")),
4398 *--s);
4399 errmsg = errbuf;
4400 } else
4401 errmsg = (char_u *)"";
4402 break;
4403 }
4404 }
4405 }
4406 }
4407 /* 'completeopt' */
4408 else if (varp == &p_cot) {
4409 if (check_opt_strings(p_cot, p_cot_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4410 errmsg = e_invarg;
4411 }
4412 /* 'pastetoggle': translate key codes like in a mapping */
4413 else if (varp == &p_pt) {
4414 if (*p_pt) {
4415 (void)replace_termcodes(p_pt, &p, TRUE1, TRUE1, FALSE0);
4416 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
4417 if (new_value_alloced)
4418 free_string_option(p_pt);
4419 p_pt = p;
4420 new_value_alloced = TRUE1;
4421 }
4422 }
4423 }
4424 /* 'backspace' */
4425 else if (varp == &p_bs) {
4426 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*p_bs)((unsigned)(*p_bs) - '0' < 10)) {
4427 if (*p_bs >'2' || p_bs[1] != NUL'\000')
4428 errmsg = e_invarg;
4429 } else if (check_opt_strings(p_bs, p_bs_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4430 errmsg = e_invarg;
4431 }
4432 /* 'casemap' */
4433 else if (varp == &p_cmp) {
4434 if (opt_strings_flags(p_cmp, p_cmp_values, &cmp_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
4435 errmsg = e_invarg;
4436 }
4437 /* 'diffopt' */
4438 else if (varp == &p_dip) {
4439 if (diffopt_changed() == FAIL0)
4440 errmsg = e_invarg;
4441 }
4442 /* 'foldmethod' */
4443 else if (gvarp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_fdm) {
4444 if (check_opt_strings(*varp, p_fdm_values, FALSE0) != OK1
4445 || *curwin->w_p_fdmw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdm == NUL'\000')
4446 errmsg = e_invarg;
4447 else {
4448 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4449 if (foldmethodIsDiff(curwin))
4450 newFoldLevel();
4451 }
4452 }
4453 /* 'foldexpr' */
4454 else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_fdew_onebuf_opt.wo_fde) {
4455 if (foldmethodIsExpr(curwin))
4456 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4457 }
4458 /* 'foldmarker' */
4459 else if (gvarp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_fmr) {
4460 p = vim_strchr(*varp, ',');
4461 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
4462 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E536: comma required")"E536: comma required";
4463 else if (p == *varp || p[1] == NUL'\000')
4464 errmsg = e_invarg;
4465 else if (foldmethodIsMarker(curwin))
4466 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4467 }
4468 /* 'commentstring' */
4469 else if (gvarp == &p_cms) {
4470 if (**varp != NUL'\000' && strstr((char *)*varp, "%s") == NULL((void*)0))
4471 errmsg = (char_u *)N_("E537: 'commentstring' must be empty or contain %s")"E537: 'commentstring' must be empty or contain %s";
4472 }
4473 /* 'foldopen' */
4474 else if (varp == &p_fdo) {
4475 if (opt_strings_flags(p_fdo, p_fdo_values, &fdo_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
4476 errmsg = e_invarg;
4477 }
4478 /* 'foldclose' */
4479 else if (varp == &p_fcl) {
4480 if (check_opt_strings(p_fcl, p_fcl_values, TRUE1) != OK1)
4481 errmsg = e_invarg;
4482 }
4483 /* 'foldignore' */
4484 else if (gvarp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_fdi) {
4485 if (foldmethodIsIndent(curwin))
4486 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4487 }
4488 /* 'virtualedit' */
4489 else if (varp == &p_ve) {
4490 if (opt_strings_flags(p_ve, p_ve_values, &ve_flags, TRUE1) != OK1)
4491 errmsg = e_invarg;
4492 else if (STRCMP(p_ve, oldval)strcmp((char *)(p_ve), (char *)(oldval)) != 0) {
4493 /* Recompute cursor position in case the new 've' setting
4494 * changes something. */
4495 validate_virtcol();
4496 coladvance(curwin->w_virtcol);
4497 }
4498 } else if (varp == &p_csqf) {
4499 if (p_csqf != NULL((void*)0)) {
4500 p = p_csqf;
4501 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
4502 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)CSQF_CMDS"sgdctefi", *p) == NULL((void*)0)
4503 || p[1] == NUL'\000'
4504 || vim_strchr((char_u *)CSQF_FLAGS"+-0", p[1]) == NULL((void*)0)
4505 || (p[2] != NUL'\000' && p[2] != ',')) {
4506 errmsg = e_invarg;
4507 break;
4508 } else if (p[2] == NUL'\000')
4509 break;
4510 else
4511 p += 3;
4512 }
4513 }
4514 }
4515 /* 'cinoptions' */
4516 else if (gvarp == &p_cino) {
4517 /* TODO: recognize errors */
4518 parse_cino(curbuf);
4519 }
4520 /* Options that are a list of flags. */
4521 else {
4522 p = NULL((void*)0);
4523 if (varp == &p_ww)
4524 p = (char_u *)WW_ALL"bshl<>[],~";
4525 if (varp == &p_shm)
4526 p = (char_u *)SHM_ALL"rmfixlnwaWtToOsAIc";
4527 else if (varp == &(p_cpo))
4528 p = (char_u *)CPO_ALL"aAbBcCdDeEfFgHiIjJkKlLmMnoOpPqrRsStuvwWxXyZ$!%*-+<>#{|&/\\.;";
4529 else if (varp == &(curbuf->b_p_fo))
4530 p = (char_u *)FO_ALL"tcroq2vlb1mMBn,awj";
4531 else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu)
4532 p = (char_u *)COCU_ALL"nvic";
4533 else if (varp == &p_mouse) {
4534 p = (char_u *)MOUSE_ALL"anvichr";
4535 }
4536 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
4537 for (s = *varp; *s; ++s)
4538 if (vim_strchr(p, *s) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4539 errmsg = illegal_char(errbuf, *s);
4540 break;
4541 }
4542 }
4543 }
4544
4545 /*
4546 * If error detected, restore the previous value.
4547 */
4548 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
4549 if (new_value_alloced)
4550 free_string_option(*varp);
4551 *varp = oldval;
4552 /*
4553 * When resetting some values, need to act on it.
4554 */
4555 if (did_chartab)
4556 (void)init_chartab();
4557 if (varp == &p_hl)
4558 (void)highlight_changed();
4559 } else {
4560 /* Remember where the option was set. */
4561 set_option_scriptID_idx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_SID);
4562 /*
4563 * Free string options that are in allocated memory.
4564 * Use "free_oldval", because recursiveness may change the flags under
4565 * our fingers (esp. init_highlight()).
4566 */
4567 if (free_oldval)
4568 free_string_option(oldval);
4569 if (new_value_alloced)
4570 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_ALLOCED0x08;
4571 else
4572 options[opt_idx].flags &= ~P_ALLOCED0x08;
4573
4574 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0
4575 && ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BOTH0x1000)) {
4576 /* global option with local value set to use global value; free
4577 * the local value and make it empty */
4578 p = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_LOCAL4);
4579 free_string_option(*(char_u **)p);
4580 *(char_u **)p = empty_option;
4581 }
4582 /* May set global value for local option. */
4583 else if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4) && opt_flags != OPT_GLOBAL2)
4584 set_string_option_global(opt_idx, varp);
4585
4586 /*
4587 * Trigger the autocommand only after setting the flags.
4588 */
4589 /* When 'syntax' is set, load the syntax of that name */
4590 if (varp == &(curbuf->b_p_syn)) {
4591 apply_autocmds(EVENT_SYNTAX, curbuf->b_p_syn,
4592 curbuf->b_fname, TRUE1, curbuf);
4593 } else if (varp == &(curbuf->b_p_ft)) {
4594 /* 'filetype' is set, trigger the FileType autocommand */
4595 did_filetype = TRUE1;
4596 apply_autocmds(EVENT_FILETYPE, curbuf->b_p_ft,
4597 curbuf->b_fname, TRUE1, curbuf);
4598 }
4599 if (varp == &(curwin->w_s->b_p_spl)) {
4600 char_u fname[200];
4601 char_u *q = curwin->w_s->b_p_spl;
4602
4603 /* Skip the first name if it is "cjk". */
4604 if (STRNCMP(q, "cjk,", 4)strncmp((char *)(q), (char *)("cjk,"), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
4605 q += 4;
4606
4607 /*
4608 * Source the spell/LANG.vim in 'runtimepath'.
4609 * They could set 'spellcapcheck' depending on the language.
4610 * Use the first name in 'spelllang' up to '_region' or
4611 * '.encoding'.
4612 */
4613 for (p = q; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p)
4614 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"_.,", *p) != NULL((void*)0))
4615 break;
4616 vim_snprintf((char *)fname, 200, "spell/%.*s.vim", (int)(p - q), q);
4617 source_runtime(fname, TRUE1);
4618 }
4619 }
4620
4621 if (varp == &p_mouse) {
4622 if (*p_mouse == NUL'\000')
4623 mch_setmouse(FALSE0); /* switch mouse off */
4624 else
4625 setmouse(); /* in case 'mouse' changed */
4626 }
4627
4628 if (curwin->w_curswant != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
4629 && (options[opt_idx].flags & (P_CURSWANT0x2000000L | P_RCLR0x7000)) != 0)
4630 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
4631
4632 check_redraw(options[opt_idx].flags);
4633
4634 return errmsg;
4635}
4636
4637/*
4638 * Simple int comparison function for use with qsort()
4639 */
4640static int int_cmp(const void *a, const void *b)
4641{
4642 return *(const int *)a - *(const int *)b;
4643}
4644
4645/*
4646 * Handle setting 'colorcolumn' or 'textwidth' in window "wp".
4647 * Returns error message, NULL if it's OK.
4648 */
4649char_u *check_colorcolumn(win_T *wp)
4650{
4651 char_u *s;
4652 int col;
4653 int count = 0;
4654 int color_cols[256];
4655 int i;
4656 int j = 0;
4657
4658 if (wp->w_buffer == NULL((void*)0))
4659 return NULL((void*)0); /* buffer was closed */
4660
4661 for (s = wp->w_p_ccw_onebuf_opt.wo_cc; *s != NUL'\000' && count < 255; ) {
4662 if (*s == '-' || *s == '+') {
4663 /* -N and +N: add to 'textwidth' */
4664 col = (*s == '-') ? -1 : 1;
4665 ++s;
4666 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10))
4667 return e_invarg;
4668 col = col * getdigits(&s);
4669 if (wp->w_buffer->b_p_tw == 0)
4670 goto skip; /* 'textwidth' not set, skip this item */
4671 col += wp->w_buffer->b_p_tw;
4672 if (col < 0)
4673 goto skip;
4674 } else if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10))
4675 col = getdigits(&s);
4676 else
4677 return e_invarg;
4678 color_cols[count++] = col - 1; /* 1-based to 0-based */
4679skip:
4680 if (*s == NUL'\000')
4681 break;
4682 if (*s != ',')
4683 return e_invarg;
4684 if (*++s == NUL'\000')
4685 return e_invarg; /* illegal trailing comma as in "set cc=80," */
4686 }
4687
4688 free(wp->w_p_cc_cols);
4689 if (count == 0)
4690 wp->w_p_cc_cols = NULL((void*)0);
4691 else {
4692 wp->w_p_cc_cols = xmalloc(sizeof(int) * (count + 1));
4693 /* sort the columns for faster usage on screen redraw inside
4694 * win_line() */
4695 qsort(color_cols, count, sizeof(int), int_cmp);
4696
4697 for (i = 0; i < count; ++i)
4698 /* skip duplicates */
4699 if (j == 0 || wp->w_p_cc_cols[j - 1] != color_cols[i])
4700 wp->w_p_cc_cols[j++] = color_cols[i];
4701 wp->w_p_cc_cols[j] = -1; /* end marker */
4702 }
4703
4704 return NULL((void*)0); /* no error */
4705}
4706
4707/*
4708 * Handle setting 'listchars' or 'fillchars'.
4709 * Returns error message, NULL if it's OK.
4710 */
4711static char_u *set_chars_option(char_u **varp)
4712{
4713 int round, i, len, entries;
4714 char_u *p, *s;
4715 int c1, c2 = 0;
4716 struct charstab {
4717 int *cp;
4718 char *name;
4719 };
4720 static struct charstab filltab[] =
4721 {
4722 {&fill_stl, "stl"},
4723 {&fill_stlnc, "stlnc"},
4724 {&fill_vert, "vert"},
4725 {&fill_fold, "fold"},
4726 {&fill_diff, "diff"},
4727 };
4728 static struct charstab lcstab[] =
4729 {
4730 {&lcs_eol, "eol"},
4731 {&lcs_ext, "extends"},
4732 {&lcs_nbsp, "nbsp"},
4733 {&lcs_prec, "precedes"},
4734 {&lcs_tab2, "tab"},
4735 {&lcs_trail, "trail"},
4736 {&lcs_conceal, "conceal"},
4737 };
4738 struct charstab *tab;
4739
4740 if (varp == &p_lcs) {
4741 tab = lcstab;
4742 entries = sizeof(lcstab) / sizeof(struct charstab);
4743 } else {
4744 tab = filltab;
4745 entries = sizeof(filltab) / sizeof(struct charstab);
4746 }
4747
4748 /* first round: check for valid value, second round: assign values */
4749 for (round = 0; round <= 1; ++round) {
4750 if (round > 0) {
4751 /* After checking that the value is valid: set defaults: space for
4752 * 'fillchars', NUL for 'listchars' */
4753 for (i = 0; i < entries; ++i)
4754 if (tab[i].cp != NULL((void*)0))
4755 *(tab[i].cp) = (varp == &p_lcs ? NUL'\000' : ' ');
4756 if (varp == &p_lcs)
4757 lcs_tab1 = NUL'\000';
4758 else
4759 fill_diff = '-';
4760 }
4761 p = *varp;
4762 while (*p) {
4763 for (i = 0; i < entries; ++i) {
4764 len = (int)STRLEN(tab[i].name)strlen((char *)(tab[i].name));
4765 if (STRNCMP(p, tab[i].name, len)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)(tab[i].name), (size_t)(len)) == 0
4766 && p[len] == ':'
4767 && p[len + 1] != NUL'\000') {
4768 s = p + len + 1;
4769 c1 = mb_ptr2char_adv(&s);
4770 if (mb_char2cells(c1) > 1)
4771 continue;
4772 if (tab[i].cp == &lcs_tab2) {
4773 if (*s == NUL'\000')
4774 continue;
4775 c2 = mb_ptr2char_adv(&s);
4776 if (mb_char2cells(c2) > 1)
4777 continue;
4778 }
4779 if (*s == ',' || *s == NUL'\000') {
4780 if (round) {
4781 if (tab[i].cp == &lcs_tab2) {
4782 lcs_tab1 = c1;
4783 lcs_tab2 = c2;
4784 } else if (tab[i].cp != NULL((void*)0))
4785 *(tab[i].cp) = c1;
4786
4787 }
4788 p = s;
4789 break;
4790 }
4791 }
4792 }
4793
4794 if (i == entries)
4795 return e_invarg;
4796 if (*p == ',')
4797 ++p;
4798 }
4799 }
4800
4801 return NULL((void*)0); /* no error */
4802}
4803
4804/*
4805 * Check validity of options with the 'statusline' format.
4806 * Return error message or NULL.
4807 */
4808char_u *check_stl_option(char_u *s)
4809{
4810 int itemcnt = 0;
4811 int groupdepth = 0;
4812 static char_u errbuf[80];
4813
4814 while (*s && itemcnt < STL_MAX_ITEM80) {
4815 /* Check for valid keys after % sequences */
4816 while (*s && *s != '%')
4817 s++;
4818 if (!*s)
4819 break;
4820 s++;
4821 if (*s != '%' && *s != ')')
4822 ++itemcnt;
4823 if (*s == '%' || *s == STL_TRUNCMARK'<' || *s == STL_MIDDLEMARK'=') {
4824 s++;
4825 continue;
4826 }
4827 if (*s == ')') {
4828 s++;
4829 if (--groupdepth < 0)
4830 break;
4831 continue;
4832 }
4833 if (*s == '-')
4834 s++;
4835 while (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10))
4836 s++;
4837 if (*s == STL_USER_HL'*')
4838 continue;
4839 if (*s == '.') {
4840 s++;
4841 while (*s && VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10))
4842 s++;
4843 }
4844 if (*s == '(') {
4845 groupdepth++;
4846 continue;
4847 }
4848 if (vim_strchr(STL_ALL((char_u *) "fFtcvVlLknoObBrRhHmYyWwMqpPaN{#"), *s) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4849 return illegal_char(errbuf, *s);
4850 }
4851 if (*s == '{') {
4852 s++;
4853 while (*s != '}' && *s)
4854 s++;
4855 if (*s != '}')
4856 return (char_u *)N_("E540: Unclosed expression sequence")"E540: Unclosed expression sequence";
4857 }
4858 }
4859 if (itemcnt >= STL_MAX_ITEM80)
4860 return (char_u *)N_("E541: too many items")"E541: too many items";
4861 if (groupdepth != 0)
4862 return (char_u *)N_("E542: unbalanced groups")"E542: unbalanced groups";
4863 return NULL((void*)0);
4864}
4865
4866
4867/*
4868 * Set curbuf->b_cap_prog to the regexp program for 'spellcapcheck'.
4869 * Return error message when failed, NULL when OK.
4870 */
4871static char_u *compile_cap_prog(synblock_T *synblock)
4872{
4873 regprog_T *rp = synblock->b_cap_prog;
4874 char_u *re;
4875
4876 if (*synblock->b_p_spc == NUL'\000')
4877 synblock->b_cap_prog = NULL((void*)0);
4878 else {
4879 /* Prepend a ^ so that we only match at one column */
4880 re = concat_str((char_u *)"^", synblock->b_p_spc);
4881 synblock->b_cap_prog = vim_regcomp(re, RE_MAGIC1);
4882 free(re);
4883 if (synblock->b_cap_prog == NULL((void*)0)) {
4884 synblock->b_cap_prog = rp; /* restore the previous program */
4885 return e_invarg;
4886 }
4887 }
4888
4889 vim_regfree(rp);
4890 return NULL((void*)0);
4891}
4892
4893/*
4894 * Set the scriptID for an option, taking care of setting the buffer- or
4895 * window-local value.
4896 */
4897static void set_option_scriptID_idx(int opt_idx, int opt_flags, int id)
4898{
4899 int both = (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0;
4900 int indir = (int)options[opt_idx].indir;
4901
4902 /* Remember where the option was set. For local options need to do that
4903 * in the buffer or window structure. */
4904 if (both || (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) || (indir & (PV_BUF0x4000|PV_WIN0x2000)) == 0)
4905 options[opt_idx].scriptID = id;
4906 if (both || (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)) {
4907 if (indir & PV_BUF0x4000)
4908 curbuf->b_p_scriptID[indir & PV_MASK0x0fff] = id;
4909 else if (indir & PV_WIN0x2000)
4910 curwin->w_p_scriptIDw_onebuf_opt.wo_scriptID[indir & PV_MASK0x0fff] = id;
4911 }
4912}
4913
4914/*
4915 * Set the value of a boolean option, and take care of side effects.
4916 * Returns NULL for success, or an error message for an error.
4917 */
4918static char_u *
4919set_bool_option (
4920 int opt_idx, /* index in options[] table */
4921 char_u *varp, /* pointer to the option variable */
4922 int value, /* new value */
4923 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
4924)
4925{
4926 int old_value = *(int *)varp;
4927
4928 /* Disallow changing some options from secure mode */
4929 if ((secure
4930#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
4931 || sandbox != 0
4932#endif
4933 ) && (options[opt_idx].flags & P_SECURE0x40000L))
4934 return e_secure;
4935
4936 *(int *)varp = value; /* set the new value */
4937 /* Remember where the option was set. */
4938 set_option_scriptID_idx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_SID);
4939
4940
4941 /* May set global value for local option. */
4942 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0)
4943 *(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2) = value;
4944
4945 /*
4946 * Handle side effects of changing a bool option.
4947 */
4948
4949 /* 'compatible' */
4950 if ((int *)varp == &p_cp) {
4951 compatible_set();
4952 }
4953 /* 'undofile' */
4954 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_udf || (int *)varp == &p_udf) {
4955 /* Only take action when the option was set. When reset we do not
4956 * delete the undo file, the option may be set again without making
4957 * any changes in between. */
4958 if (curbuf->b_p_udf || p_udf) {
4959 char_u hash[UNDO_HASH_SIZE32];
4960 buf_T *save_curbuf = curbuf;
4961
4962 for (curbuf = firstbuf; curbuf != NULL((void*)0); curbuf = curbuf->b_next) {
4963 /* When 'undofile' is set globally: for every buffer, otherwise
4964 * only for the current buffer: Try to read in the undofile,
4965 * if one exists, the buffer wasn't changed and the buffer was
4966 * loaded */
4967 if ((curbuf == save_curbuf
4968 || (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) || opt_flags == 0)
4969 && !curbufIsChanged() && curbuf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0)) {
4970 u_compute_hash(hash);
4971 u_read_undo(NULL((void*)0), hash, curbuf->b_fname);
4972 }
4973 }
4974 curbuf = save_curbuf;
4975 }
4976 } else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ro) {
4977 /* when 'readonly' is reset globally, also reset readonlymode */
4978 if (!curbuf->b_p_ro && (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4) == 0)
4979 readonlymode = FALSE0;
4980
4981 /* when 'readonly' is set may give W10 again */
4982 if (curbuf->b_p_ro)
4983 curbuf->b_did_warn = FALSE0;
4984
4985 redraw_titles();
4986 }
4987 /* when 'modifiable' is changed, redraw the window title */
4988 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ma) {
4989 redraw_titles();
4990 }
4991 /* when 'endofline' is changed, redraw the window title */
4992 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_eol) {
4993 redraw_titles();
4994 }
4995 /* when 'bomb' is changed, redraw the window title and tab page text */
4996 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_bomb) {
4997 redraw_titles();
4998 }
4999 /* when 'bin' is set also set some other options */
5000 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_bin) {
5001 set_options_bin(old_value, curbuf->b_p_bin, opt_flags);
5002 redraw_titles();
5003 }
5004 /* when 'buflisted' changes, trigger autocommands */
5005 else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_bl && old_value != curbuf->b_p_bl) {
5006 apply_autocmds(curbuf->b_p_bl ? EVENT_BUFADD : EVENT_BUFDELETE,
5007 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), TRUE1, curbuf);
5008 }
5009 /* when 'swf' is set, create swapfile, when reset remove swapfile */
5010 else if ((int *)varp == (int *)&curbuf->b_p_swf) {
5011 if (curbuf->b_p_swf && p_uc)
5012 ml_open_file(curbuf); /* create the swap file */
5013 else
5014 /* no need to reset curbuf->b_may_swap, ml_open_file() will check
5015 * buf->b_p_swf */
5016 mf_close_file(curbuf, TRUE1); /* remove the swap file */
5017 }
5018 /* when 'terse' is set change 'shortmess' */
5019 else if ((int *)varp == &p_terse) {
5020 char_u *p;
5021
5022 p = vim_strchr(p_shm, SHM_SEARCH's');
5023
5024 /* insert 's' in p_shm */
5025 if (p_terse && p == NULL((void*)0)) {
5026 STRCPY(IObuff, p_shm)strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(p_shm));
5027 STRCAT(IObuff, "s")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("s"));
5028 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"shm", -1, IObuff, OPT_FREE1, 0);
5029 }
5030 /* remove 's' from p_shm */
5031 else if (!p_terse && p != NULL((void*)0))
5032 STRMOVE(p, p + 1)memmove((p), (p + 1), strlen((char *)(p + 1)) + 1);
5033 }
5034 /* when 'paste' is set or reset also change other options */
5035 else if ((int *)varp == &p_paste) {
5036 paste_option_changed();
5037 }
5038 /* when 'insertmode' is set from an autocommand need to do work here */
5039 else if ((int *)varp == &p_im) {
5040 if (p_im) {
5041 if ((State & INSERT0x10) == 0)
5042 need_start_insertmode = TRUE1;
5043 stop_insert_mode = FALSE0;
5044 } else {
5045 need_start_insertmode = FALSE0;
5046 stop_insert_mode = TRUE1;
5047 if (restart_edit != 0 && mode_displayed)
5048 clear_cmdline = TRUE1; /* remove "(insert)" */
5049 restart_edit = 0;
5050 }
5051 }
5052 /* when 'ignorecase' is set or reset and 'hlsearch' is set, redraw */
5053 else if ((int *)varp == &p_ic && p_hls) {
5054 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
5055 }
5056 /* when 'hlsearch' is set or reset: reset no_hlsearch */
5057 else if ((int *)varp == &p_hls) {
5058 SET_NO_HLSEARCH(FALSE)no_hlsearch = (0); set_vim_var_nr( VV_HLSEARCH, !no_hlsearch);
5059 }
5060 /* when 'scrollbind' is set: snapshot the current position to avoid a jump
5061 * at the end of normal_cmd() */
5062 else if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb) {
5063 if (curwin->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb) {
5064 do_check_scrollbind(FALSE0);
5065 curwin->w_scbind_pos = curwin->w_topline;
5066 }
5067 }
5068 /* There can be only one window with 'previewwindow' set. */
5069 else if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw) {
5070 if (curwin->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw) {
5071 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(win, curtab)for (win_T *win = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; win != ((void*)0); win = win->w_next) {
5072 if (win->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw && win != curwin) {
5073 curwin->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw = FALSE0;
5074 return (char_u *)N_("E590: A preview window already exists")"E590: A preview window already exists";
5075 }
5076 }
5077 }
5078 }
5079
5080 /*
5081 * When 'lisp' option changes include/exclude '-' in
5082 * keyword characters.
5083 */
5084 else if (varp == (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_lisp)) {
5085 (void)buf_init_chartab(curbuf, FALSE0); /* ignore errors */
5086 }
5087 /* when 'title' changed, may need to change the title; same for 'icon' */
5088 else if ((int *)varp == &p_title) {
5089 did_set_title(FALSE0);
5090 } else if ((int *)varp == &p_icon) {
5091 did_set_title(TRUE1);
5092 } else if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_changed) {
5093 if (!value)
5094 save_file_ff(curbuf); /* Buffer is unchanged */
5095 redraw_titles();
5096 modified_was_set = value;
5097 }
5098
5099#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
5100 else if ((int *)varp == &p_ssl) {
5101 if (p_ssl) {
5102 psepc = '/';
5103 psepcN = '\\';
5104 pseps[0] = '/';
5105 } else {
5106 psepc = '\\';
5107 psepcN = '/';
5108 pseps[0] = '\\';
5109 }
5110
5111 /* need to adjust the file name arguments and buffer names. */
5112 buflist_slash_adjust();
5113 alist_slash_adjust();
5114 scriptnames_slash_adjust();
5115 }
5116#endif
5117
5118 /* If 'wrap' is set, set w_leftcol to zero. */
5119 else if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap) {
5120 if (curwin->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap)
5121 curwin->w_leftcol = 0;
5122 } else if ((int *)varp == &p_ea) {
5123 if (p_ea && !old_value)
5124 win_equal(curwin, FALSE0, 0);
5125 } else if ((int *)varp == &p_wiv) {
5126 /*
5127 * When 'weirdinvert' changed, set/reset 't_xs'.
5128 * Then set 'weirdinvert' according to value of 't_xs'.
5129 */
5130 if (p_wiv && !old_value)
5131 T_XS(term_strings[(int)(KS_XS)]) = (char_u *)"y";
5132 else if (!p_wiv && old_value)
5133 T_XS(term_strings[(int)(KS_XS)]) = empty_option;
5134 p_wiv = (*T_XS(term_strings[(int)(KS_XS)]) != NUL'\000');
5135 } else if ((int *)varp == &p_acd) {
5136 /* Change directories when the 'acd' option is set now. */
5137 do_autochdir();
5138 }
5139 /* 'diff' */
5140 else if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff) {
5141 /* May add or remove the buffer from the list of diff buffers. */
5142 diff_buf_adjust(curwin);
5143 if (foldmethodIsDiff(curwin))
5144 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
5145 }
5146
5147#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
5148 /* 'imdisable' */
5149 else if ((int *)varp == &p_imdisable) {
5150 /* Only de-activate it here, it will be enabled when changing mode. */
5151 if (p_imdisable)
5152 im_set_active(FALSE0);
5153 else if (State & INSERT0x10)
5154 /* When the option is set from an autocommand, it may need to take
5155 * effect right away. */
5156 im_set_active(curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_IM);
5157 }
5158#endif
5159
5160 /* 'spell' */
5161 else if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell) {
5162 if (curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell) {
5163 char_u *errmsg = did_set_spelllang(curwin);
5164 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0))
5165 EMSG(_(errmsg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(errmsg))));
5166 }
5167 } else if ((int *)varp == &p_altkeymap) {
5168 if (old_value != p_altkeymap) {
5169 if (!p_altkeymap) {
5170 p_hkmap = p_fkmap;
5171 p_fkmap = 0;
5172 } else {
5173 p_fkmap = p_hkmap;
5174 p_hkmap = 0;
5175 }
5176 (void)init_chartab();
5177 }
5178 }
5179
5180 /*
5181 * In case some second language keymapping options have changed, check
5182 * and correct the setting in a consistent way.
5183 */
5184
5185 /*
5186 * If hkmap or fkmap are set, reset Arabic keymapping.
5187 */
5188 if ((p_hkmap || p_fkmap) && p_altkeymap) {
5189 p_altkeymap = p_fkmap;
5190 curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab = FALSE0;
5191 (void)init_chartab();
5192 }
5193
5194 /*
5195 * If hkmap set, reset Farsi keymapping.
5196 */
5197 if (p_hkmap && p_altkeymap) {
5198 p_altkeymap = 0;
5199 p_fkmap = 0;
5200 curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab = FALSE0;
5201 (void)init_chartab();
5202 }
5203
5204 /*
5205 * If fkmap set, reset Hebrew keymapping.
5206 */
5207 if (p_fkmap && !p_altkeymap) {
5208 p_altkeymap = 1;
5209 p_hkmap = 0;
5210 curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab = FALSE0;
5211 (void)init_chartab();
5212 }
5213
5214 if ((int *)varp == &curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab) {
5215 if (curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab) {
5216 /*
5217 * 'arabic' is set, handle various sub-settings.
5218 */
5219 if (!p_tbidi) {
5220 /* set rightleft mode */
5221 if (!curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
5222 curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl = TRUE1;
5223 changed_window_setting();
5224 }
5225
5226 /* Enable Arabic shaping (major part of what Arabic requires) */
5227 if (!p_arshape) {
5228 p_arshape = TRUE1;
5229 redraw_later_clear();
5230 }
5231 }
5232
5233 /* Arabic requires a utf-8 encoding, inform the user if its not
5234 * set. */
5235 if (STRCMP(p_enc, "utf-8")strcmp((char *)(p_enc), (char *)("utf-8")) != 0) {
5236 static char *w_arabic = N_("W17: Arabic requires UTF-8, do ':set encoding=utf-8'"
5237 "W17: Arabic requires UTF-8, do ':set encoding=utf-8'")"W17: Arabic requires UTF-8, do ':set encoding=utf-8'";
5238
5239 msg_source(hl_attr(HLF_W)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_W)]);
5240 MSG_ATTR(_(w_arabic), hl_attr(HLF_W))msg_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(w_arabic))), (highlight_attr
[(int)(HLF_W)]));
5241 set_vim_var_string(VV_WARNINGMSG, (char_u *)_(w_arabic)gettext((char *)(w_arabic)), -1);
5242 }
5243
5244 /* set 'delcombine' */
5245 p_deco = TRUE1;
5246
5247 /* Force-set the necessary keymap for arabic */
5248 set_option_value((char_u *)"keymap", 0L, (char_u *)"arabic",
5249 OPT_LOCAL4);
5250 p_altkeymap = 0;
5251 p_hkmap = 0;
5252 p_fkmap = 0;
5253 (void)init_chartab();
5254 } else {
5255 /*
5256 * 'arabic' is reset, handle various sub-settings.
5257 */
5258 if (!p_tbidi) {
5259 /* reset rightleft mode */
5260 if (curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
5261 curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl = FALSE0;
5262 changed_window_setting();
5263 }
5264
5265 /* 'arabicshape' isn't reset, it is a global option and
5266 * another window may still need it "on". */
5267 }
5268
5269 /* 'delcombine' isn't reset, it is a global option and another
5270 * window may still want it "on". */
5271
5272 /* Revert to the default keymap */
5273 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
5274 curbuf->b_p_imsearch = B_IMODE_USE_INSERT-1;
5275 }
5276 }
5277
5278
5279 /*
5280 * End of handling side effects for bool options.
5281 */
5282
5283 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_WAS_SET0x100;
5284
5285 comp_col(); /* in case 'ruler' or 'showcmd' changed */
5286 if (curwin->w_curswant != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
5287 && (options[opt_idx].flags & (P_CURSWANT0x2000000L | P_RCLR0x7000)) != 0)
5288 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5289 check_redraw(options[opt_idx].flags);
5290
5291 return NULL((void*)0);
5292}
5293
5294/*
5295 * Set the value of a number option, and take care of side effects.
5296 * Returns NULL for success, or an error message for an error.
5297 */
5298static char_u *
5299set_num_option (
5300 int opt_idx, /* index in options[] table */
5301 char_u *varp, /* pointer to the option variable */
5302 long value, /* new value */
5303 char_u *errbuf, /* buffer for error messages */
5304 size_t errbuflen, /* length of "errbuf" */
5305 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL and
5306 OPT_MODELINE */
5307)
5308{
5309 char_u *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
5310 long old_value = *(long *)varp;
5311 long old_Rows = Rows; /* remember old Rows */
5312 long old_Columns = Columns; /* remember old Columns */
5313 long *pp = (long *)varp;
5314
5315 /* Disallow changing some options from secure mode. */
5316 if ((secure
5317#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
5318 || sandbox != 0
5319#endif
5320 ) && (options[opt_idx].flags & P_SECURE0x40000L))
5321 return e_secure;
5322
5323 *pp = value;
5324 /* Remember where the option was set. */
5325 set_option_scriptID_idx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_SID);
5326
5327 if (curbuf->b_p_sw < 0) {
5328 errmsg = e_positive;
5329 curbuf->b_p_sw = curbuf->b_p_ts;
5330 }
5331
5332 /*
5333 * Number options that need some action when changed
5334 */
5335 if (pp == &p_wh || pp == &p_hh) {
5336 if (p_wh < 1) {
5337 errmsg = e_positive;
5338 p_wh = 1;
5339 }
5340 if (p_wmh > p_wh) {
5341 errmsg = e_winheight;
5342 p_wh = p_wmh;
5343 }
5344 if (p_hh < 0) {
5345 errmsg = e_positive;
5346 p_hh = 0;
5347 }
5348
5349 /* Change window height NOW */
5350 if (lastwin != firstwin) {
5351 if (pp == &p_wh && curwin->w_height < p_wh)
5352 win_setheight((int)p_wh);
5353 if (pp == &p_hh && curbuf->b_help && curwin->w_height < p_hh)
5354 win_setheight((int)p_hh);
5355 }
5356 }
5357 /* 'winminheight' */
5358 else if (pp == &p_wmh) {
5359 if (p_wmh < 0) {
5360 errmsg = e_positive;
5361 p_wmh = 0;
5362 }
5363 if (p_wmh > p_wh) {
5364 errmsg = e_winheight;
5365 p_wmh = p_wh;
5366 }
5367 win_setminheight();
5368 } else if (pp == &p_wiw) {
5369 if (p_wiw < 1) {
5370 errmsg = e_positive;
5371 p_wiw = 1;
5372 }
5373 if (p_wmw > p_wiw) {
5374 errmsg = e_winwidth;
5375 p_wiw = p_wmw;
5376 }
5377
5378 /* Change window width NOW */
5379 if (lastwin != firstwin && curwin->w_width < p_wiw)
5380 win_setwidth((int)p_wiw);
5381 }
5382 /* 'winminwidth' */
5383 else if (pp == &p_wmw) {
5384 if (p_wmw < 0) {
5385 errmsg = e_positive;
5386 p_wmw = 0;
5387 }
5388 if (p_wmw > p_wiw) {
5389 errmsg = e_winwidth;
5390 p_wmw = p_wiw;
5391 }
5392 win_setminheight();
5393 }
5394 /* (re)set last window status line */
5395 else if (pp == &p_ls) {
5396 last_status(FALSE0);
5397 }
5398 /* (re)set tab page line */
5399 else if (pp == &p_stal) {
5400 shell_new_rows(); /* recompute window positions and heights */
5401 }
5402 /* 'foldlevel' */
5403 else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl) {
5404 if (curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl < 0)
5405 curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl = 0;
5406 newFoldLevel();
5407 }
5408 /* 'foldminlines' */
5409 else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_fmlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fml) {
5410 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
5411 }
5412 /* 'foldnestmax' */
5413 else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn) {
5414 if (foldmethodIsSyntax(curwin) || foldmethodIsIndent(curwin))
5415 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
5416 }
5417 /* 'foldcolumn' */
5418 else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc) {
5419 if (curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc < 0) {
5420 errmsg = e_positive;
5421 curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc = 0;
5422 } else if (curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc > 12) {
5423 errmsg = e_invarg;
5424 curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc = 12;
5425 }
5426 }
5427 /* 'shiftwidth' or 'tabstop' */
5428 else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_sw || pp == &curbuf->b_p_ts) {
5429 if (foldmethodIsIndent(curwin))
5430 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
5431 /* When 'shiftwidth' changes, or it's zero and 'tabstop' changes:
5432 * parse 'cinoptions'. */
5433 if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_sw || curbuf->b_p_sw == 0)
5434 parse_cino(curbuf);
5435 }
5436 /* 'maxcombine' */
5437 else if (pp == &p_mco) {
5438 if (p_mco > MAX_MCO6)
5439 p_mco = MAX_MCO6;
5440 else if (p_mco < 0)
5441 p_mco = 0;
5442 screenclear(); /* will re-allocate the screen */
5443 } else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_iminsert) {
5444 if (curbuf->b_p_iminsert < 0 || curbuf->b_p_iminsert > B_IMODE_LAST1) {
5445 errmsg = e_invarg;
5446 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
5447 }
5448 p_iminsert = curbuf->b_p_iminsert;
5449 if (termcap_active) /* don't do this in the alternate screen */
5450 showmode();
5451 /* Show/unshow value of 'keymap' in status lines. */
5452 status_redraw_curbuf();
5453 } else if (pp == &p_window) {
5454 if (p_window < 1)
5455 p_window = 1;
5456 else if (p_window >= Rows)
5457 p_window = Rows - 1;
5458 } else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_imsearch) {
5459 if (curbuf->b_p_imsearch < -1 || curbuf->b_p_imsearch > B_IMODE_LAST1) {
5460 errmsg = e_invarg;
5461 curbuf->b_p_imsearch = B_IMODE_NONE0;
5462 }
5463 p_imsearch = curbuf->b_p_imsearch;
5464 }
5465 /* if 'titlelen' has changed, redraw the title */
5466 else if (pp == &p_titlelen) {
5467 if (p_titlelen < 0) {
5468 errmsg = e_positive;
5469 p_titlelen = 85;
5470 }
5471 if (starting != NO_SCREEN2 && old_value != p_titlelen)
5472 need_maketitle = TRUE1;
5473 }
5474 /* if p_ch changed value, change the command line height */
5475 else if (pp == &p_ch) {
5476 if (p_ch < 1) {
5477 errmsg = e_positive;
5478 p_ch = 1;
5479 }
5480 if (p_ch > Rows - min_rows() + 1)
5481 p_ch = Rows - min_rows() + 1;
5482
5483 /* Only compute the new window layout when startup has been
5484 * completed. Otherwise the frame sizes may be wrong. */
5485 if (p_ch != old_value && full_screen
5486 )
5487 command_height();
5488 }
5489 /* when 'updatecount' changes from zero to non-zero, open swap files */
5490 else if (pp == &p_uc) {
5491 if (p_uc < 0) {
5492 errmsg = e_positive;
5493 p_uc = 100;
5494 }
5495 if (p_uc && !old_value)
5496 ml_open_files();
5497 } else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole) {
5498 if (curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole < 0) {
5499 errmsg = e_positive;
5500 curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole = 0;
5501 } else if (curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 3) {
5502 errmsg = e_invarg;
5503 curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole = 3;
5504 }
5505 }
5506 /* sync undo before 'undolevels' changes */
5507 else if (pp == &p_ul) {
5508 /* use the old value, otherwise u_sync() may not work properly */
5509 p_ul = old_value;
5510 u_sync(TRUE1);
5511 p_ul = value;
5512 } else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_ul) {
5513 /* use the old value, otherwise u_sync() may not work properly */
5514 curbuf->b_p_ul = old_value;
5515 u_sync(TRUE1);
5516 curbuf->b_p_ul = value;
5517 }
5518 /* 'numberwidth' must be positive */
5519 else if (pp == &curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw) {
5520 if (curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw < 1) {
5521 errmsg = e_positive;
5522 curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw = 1;
5523 }
5524 if (curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw > 10) {
5525 errmsg = e_invarg;
5526 curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw = 10;
5527 }
5528 curwin->w_nrwidth_line_count = 0;
5529 } else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_tw) {
5530 if (curbuf->b_p_tw < 0) {
5531 errmsg = e_positive;
5532 curbuf->b_p_tw = 0;
5533 }
5534
5535 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
5536 check_colorcolumn(wp);
5537 }
5538
5539 }
5540
5541 /*
5542 * Check the bounds for numeric options here
5543 */
5544 if (Rows < min_rows() && full_screen) {
5545 if (errbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
5546 vim_snprintf((char *)errbuf, errbuflen,
5547 _("E593: Need at least %d lines")gettext((char *)("E593: Need at least %d lines")), min_rows());
5548 errmsg = errbuf;
5549 }
5550 Rows = min_rows();
5551 }
5552 if (Columns < MIN_COLUMNS12 && full_screen) {
5553 if (errbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
5554 vim_snprintf((char *)errbuf, errbuflen,
5555 _("E594: Need at least %d columns")gettext((char *)("E594: Need at least %d columns")), MIN_COLUMNS12);
5556 errmsg = errbuf;
5557 }
5558 Columns = MIN_COLUMNS12;
5559 }
5560 limit_screen_size();
5561
5562
5563 /*
5564 * If the screen (shell) height has been changed, assume it is the
5565 * physical screenheight.
5566 */
5567 if (old_Rows != Rows || old_Columns != Columns) {
5568 /* Changing the screen size is not allowed while updating the screen. */
5569 if (updating_screen)
5570 *pp = old_value;
5571 else if (full_screen
5572 )
5573 set_shellsize((int)Columns, (int)Rows, TRUE1);
5574 else {
5575 /* Postpone the resizing; check the size and cmdline position for
5576 * messages. */
5577 check_shellsize();
5578 if (cmdline_row > Rows - p_ch && Rows > p_ch)
5579 cmdline_row = Rows - p_ch;
5580 }
5581 if (p_window >= Rows || !option_was_set((char_u *)"window"))
5582 p_window = Rows - 1;
5583 }
5584
5585 if (curbuf->b_p_ts <= 0) {
5586 errmsg = e_positive;
5587 curbuf->b_p_ts = 8;
5588 }
5589 if (p_tm < 0) {
5590 errmsg = e_positive;
5591 p_tm = 0;
5592 }
5593 if ((curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr <= 0
5594 || (curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr > curwin->w_height
5595 && curwin->w_height > 0))
5596 && full_screen) {
5597 if (pp == &(curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr)) {
5598 if (curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr != 0)
5599 errmsg = e_scroll;
5600 win_comp_scroll(curwin);
5601 }
5602 /* If 'scroll' became invalid because of a side effect silently adjust
5603 * it. */
5604 else if (curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr <= 0)
5605 curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr = 1;
5606 else /* curwin->w_p_scr > curwin->w_height */
5607 curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr = curwin->w_height;
5608 }
5609 if (p_hi < 0) {
5610 errmsg = e_positive;
5611 p_hi = 0;
5612 }
5613 if (p_re < 0 || p_re > 2) {
5614 errmsg = e_invarg;
5615 p_re = 0;
5616 }
5617 if (p_report < 0) {
5618 errmsg = e_positive;
5619 p_report = 1;
5620 }
5621 if ((p_sj < -100 || p_sj >= Rows) && full_screen) {
5622 if (Rows != old_Rows) /* Rows changed, just adjust p_sj */
5623 p_sj = Rows / 2;
5624 else {
5625 errmsg = e_scroll;
5626 p_sj = 1;
5627 }
5628 }
5629 if (p_so < 0 && full_screen) {
5630 errmsg = e_scroll;
5631 p_so = 0;
5632 }
5633 if (p_siso < 0 && full_screen) {
5634 errmsg = e_positive;
5635 p_siso = 0;
5636 }
5637 if (p_cwh < 1) {
5638 errmsg = e_positive;
5639 p_cwh = 1;
5640 }
5641 if (p_ut < 0) {
5642 errmsg = e_positive;
5643 p_ut = 2000;
5644 }
5645 if (p_ss < 0) {
5646 errmsg = e_positive;
5647 p_ss = 0;
5648 }
5649
5650 /* May set global value for local option. */
5651 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL4 | OPT_GLOBAL2)) == 0)
5652 *(long *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL2) = *pp;
5653
5654 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_WAS_SET0x100;
5655
5656 comp_col(); /* in case 'columns' or 'ls' changed */
5657 if (curwin->w_curswant != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
5658 && (options[opt_idx].flags & (P_CURSWANT0x2000000L | P_RCLR0x7000)) != 0)
5659 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5660 check_redraw(options[opt_idx].flags);
5661
5662 return errmsg;
5663}
5664
5665/*
5666 * Called after an option changed: check if something needs to be redrawn.
5667 */
5668static void check_redraw(long_u flags)
5669{
5670 /* Careful: P_RCLR and P_RALL are a combination of other P_ flags */
5671 int doclear = (flags & P_RCLR0x7000) == P_RCLR0x7000;
5672 int all = ((flags & P_RALL0x6000) == P_RALL0x6000 || doclear);
5673
5674 if ((flags & P_RSTAT0x1000) || all) /* mark all status lines dirty */
5675 status_redraw_all();
5676
5677 if ((flags & P_RBUF0x4000) || (flags & P_RWIN0x2000) || all)
5678 changed_window_setting();
5679 if (flags & P_RBUF0x4000)
5680 redraw_curbuf_later(NOT_VALID40);
5681 if (doclear)
5682 redraw_all_later(CLEAR50);
5683 else if (all)
5684 redraw_all_later(NOT_VALID40);
5685}
5686
5687/*
5688 * Find index for option 'arg'.
5689 * Return -1 if not found.
5690 */
5691static int findoption(char_u *arg)
5692{
5693 int opt_idx;
5694 char *s, *p;
5695 static short quick_tab[27] = {0, 0}; /* quick access table */
5696 int is_term_opt;
5697
5698 /*
5699 * For first call: Initialize the quick-access table.
5700 * It contains the index for the first option that starts with a certain
5701 * letter. There are 26 letters, plus the first "t_" option.
5702 */
5703 if (quick_tab[1] == 0) {
5704 p = options[0].fullname;
5705 for (opt_idx = 1; (s = options[opt_idx].fullname) != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++) {
5706 if (s[0] != p[0]) {
5707 if (s[0] == 't' && s[1] == '_')
5708 quick_tab[26] = opt_idx;
5709 else
5710 quick_tab[CharOrdLow(s[0])((s[0]) - 'a')] = opt_idx;
5711 }
5712 p = s;
5713 }
5714 }
5715
5716 /*
5717 * Check for name starting with an illegal character.
5718 */
5719 if (arg[0] < 'a' || arg[0] > 'z')
5720 return -1;
5721
5722 is_term_opt = (arg[0] == 't' && arg[1] == '_');
5723 if (is_term_opt)
5724 opt_idx = quick_tab[26];
5725 else
5726 opt_idx = quick_tab[CharOrdLow(arg[0])((arg[0]) - 'a')];
5727 for (; (s = options[opt_idx].fullname) != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++) {
5728 if (STRCMP(arg, s)strcmp((char *)(arg), (char *)(s)) == 0) /* match full name */
5729 break;
5730 }
5731 if (s == NULL((void*)0) && !is_term_opt) {
5732 opt_idx = quick_tab[CharOrdLow(arg[0])((arg[0]) - 'a')];
5733 for (; options[opt_idx].fullname != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++) {
5734 s = options[opt_idx].shortname;
5735 if (s != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(arg, s)strcmp((char *)(arg), (char *)(s)) == 0) /* match short name */
5736 break;
5737 s = NULL((void*)0);
5738 }
5739 }
5740 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
5741 opt_idx = -1;
5742 return opt_idx;
5743}
5744
5745/*
5746 * Get the value for an option.
5747 *
5748 * Returns:
5749 * Number or Toggle option: 1, *numval gets value.
5750 * String option: 0, *stringval gets allocated string.
5751 * Hidden Number or Toggle option: -1.
5752 * hidden String option: -2.
5753 * unknown option: -3.
5754 */
5755int
5756get_option_value (
5757 char_u *name,
5758 long *numval,
5759 char_u **stringval, /* NULL when only checking existence */
5760 int opt_flags
5761)
5762{
5763 int opt_idx;
5764 char_u *varp;
5765
5766 opt_idx = findoption(name);
5767 if (opt_idx < 0) /* unknown option */
5768 return -3;
5769
5770 varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), opt_flags);
5771
5772 if (options[opt_idx].flags & P_STRING0x04) {
5773 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) /* hidden option */
5774 return -2;
5775 if (stringval != NULL((void*)0)) {
5776 *stringval = vim_strsave(*(char_u **)(varp));
5777 }
5778 return 0;
5779 }
5780
5781 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) /* hidden option */
5782 return -1;
5783 if (options[opt_idx].flags & P_NUM0x02)
5784 *numval = *(long *)varp;
5785 else {
5786 /* Special case: 'modified' is b_changed, but we also want to consider
5787 * it set when 'ff' or 'fenc' changed. */
5788 if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_changed)
5789 *numval = curbufIsChanged();
5790 else
5791 *numval = *(int *)varp;
5792 }
5793 return 1;
5794}
5795
5796// Returns the option attributes and its value. Unlike the above function it
5797// will return either global value or local value of the option depending on
5798// what was requested, but it will never return global value if it was
5799// requested to return local one and vice versa. Neither it will return
5800// buffer-local value if it was requested to return window-local one.
5801//
5802// Pretends that option is absent if it is not present in the requested scope
5803// (i.e. has no global, window-local or buffer-local value depending on
5804// opt_type). Uses
5805//
5806// Returned flags:
5807// 0 hidden or unknown option, also option that does not have requested
5808// type (see SREQ_* in option_defs.h)
5809// see SOPT_* in option_defs.h for other flags
5810//
5811// Possible opt_type values: see SREQ_* in option_defs.h
5812int get_option_value_strict(char *name,
5813 int64_t *numval,
5814 char **stringval,
5815 int opt_type,
5816 void *from)
5817{
5818 char_u *varp = NULL((void*)0);
5819 struct vimoption *p;
5820 int rv = 0;
5821 int opt_idx = findoption((uint8_t *)name);
5822 if (opt_idx < 0) {
5823 return 0;
5824 }
5825
5826 p = &(options[opt_idx]);
5827
5828 // Hidden option
5829 if (p->var == NULL((void*)0)) {
5830 return 0;
5831 }
5832
5833 if (p->flags & P_BOOL0x01) {
5834 rv |= SOPT_BOOL0x01;
5835 } else if (p->flags & P_NUM0x02) {
5836 rv |= SOPT_NUM0x02;
5837 } else if (p->flags & P_STRING0x04) {
5838 rv |= SOPT_STRING0x04;
5839 }
5840
5841 if (p->indir == PV_NONE) {
5842 if (opt_type == SREQ_GLOBAL0)
5843 rv |= SOPT_GLOBAL0x08;
5844 else
5845 return 0; // Did not request global-only option
5846 } else {
5847 if (p->indir & PV_BOTH0x1000) {
5848 rv |= SOPT_GLOBAL0x08;
5849 } else if (opt_type == SREQ_GLOBAL0) {
5850 return 0; // Requested global option
5851 }
5852
5853 if (p->indir & PV_WIN0x2000) {
5854 if (opt_type == SREQ_BUF2) {
5855 return 0; // Did not request window-local option
5856 } else {
5857 rv |= SOPT_WIN0x10;
5858 }
5859 } else if (p->indir & PV_BUF0x4000) {
5860 if (opt_type == SREQ_WIN1) {
5861 return 0; // Did not request buffer-local option
5862 } else {
5863 rv |= SOPT_BUF0x20;
5864 }
5865 }
5866 }
5867
5868 if (stringval == NULL((void*)0)) {
5869 return rv;
5870 }
5871
5872 if (opt_type == SREQ_GLOBAL0) {
5873 varp = p->var;
5874 } else {
5875 if (opt_type == SREQ_BUF2) {
5876 // Special case: 'modified' is b_changed, but we also want to
5877 // consider it set when 'ff' or 'fenc' changed.
5878 if (p->indir == PV_MOD(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MOD))) {
5879 *numval = bufIsChanged((buf_T *) from);
5880 varp = NULL((void*)0);
5881 } else {
5882 aco_save_T aco;
5883 aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, (buf_T *) from);
5884 varp = get_varp(p);
5885 aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
5886 }
5887 } else if (opt_type == SREQ_WIN1) {
5888 win_T *save_curwin;
5889 save_curwin = curwin;
5890 curwin = (win_T *) from;
5891 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
5892 varp = get_varp(p);
5893 curwin = save_curwin;
5894 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
5895 }
5896
5897 if (varp == p->var) {
5898 return (rv | SOPT_UNSET0x40);
5899 }
5900 }
5901
5902 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
5903 if (p->flags & P_STRING0x04) {
5904 *stringval = xstrdup(*(char **)(varp));
5905 } else if (p->flags & P_NUM0x02) {
5906 *numval = *(long *) varp;
5907 } else {
5908 *numval = *(int *)varp;
5909 }
5910 }
5911
5912 return rv;
5913}
5914
5915/*
5916 * Set the value of option "name".
5917 * Use "string" for string options, use "number" for other options.
5918 *
5919 * Returns NULL on success or error message on error.
5920 */
5921char_u *
5922set_option_value (
5923 char_u *name,
5924 long number,
5925 char_u *string,
5926 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL or 0 (both) */
5927)
5928{
5929 int opt_idx;
5930 char_u *varp;
5931 long_u flags;
5932
5933 opt_idx = findoption(name);
5934 if (opt_idx < 0)
5935 EMSG2(_("E355: Unknown option: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E355: Unknown option: %s")
)), (char_u *)(name));
5936 else {
5937 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
5938#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
5939 /* Disallow changing some options in the sandbox */
5940 if (sandbox > 0 && (flags & P_SECURE0x40000L)) {
5941 EMSG(_(e_sandbox))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_sandbox))));
5942 return NULL((void*)0);
5943 }
5944#endif
5945 if (flags & P_STRING0x04)
5946 return set_string_option(opt_idx, string, opt_flags);
5947 else {
5948 varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), opt_flags);
5949 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) { /* hidden option is not changed */
5950 if (number == 0 && string != NULL((void*)0)) {
5951 int idx;
5952
5953 /* Either we are given a string or we are setting option
5954 * to zero. */
5955 for (idx = 0; string[idx] == '0'; ++idx)
5956 ;
5957 if (string[idx] != NUL'\000' || idx == 0) {
5958 /* There's another character after zeros or the string
5959 * is empty. In both cases, we are trying to set a
5960 * num option using a string. */
5961 EMSG3(_("E521: Number required: &%s = '%s'"),emsg3((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E521: Number required: &%s = '%s'"
))), (char_u *)(name), (char_u *)(string))
5962 name, string)emsg3((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E521: Number required: &%s = '%s'"
))), (char_u *)(name), (char_u *)(string));
5963 return NULL((void*)0); /* do nothing as we hit an error */
5964
5965 }
5966 }
5967 if (flags & P_NUM0x02)
5968 return set_num_option(opt_idx, varp, number,
5969 NULL((void*)0), 0, opt_flags);
5970 else
5971 return set_bool_option(opt_idx, varp, (int)number,
5972 opt_flags);
5973 }
5974 }
5975 }
5976 return NULL((void*)0);
5977}
5978
5979/*
5980 * Get the terminal code for a terminal option.
5981 * Returns NULL when not found.
5982 */
5983char_u *get_term_code(char_u *tname)
5984{
5985 int opt_idx;
5986 char_u *varp;
5987
5988 if (tname[0] != 't' || tname[1] != '_' ||
5989 tname[2] == NUL'\000' || tname[3] == NUL'\000')
5990 return NULL((void*)0);
5991 if ((opt_idx = findoption(tname)) >= 0) {
5992 varp = get_varp(&(options[opt_idx]));
5993 if (varp != NULL((void*)0))
5994 varp = *(char_u **)(varp);
5995 return varp;
5996 }
5997 return find_termcode(tname + 2);
5998}
5999
6000char_u *get_highlight_default(void)
6001{
6002 int i;
6003
6004 i = findoption((char_u *)"hl");
6005 if (i >= 0)
6006 return options[i].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0];
6007 return (char_u *)NULL((void*)0);
6008}
6009
6010char_u *get_encoding_default(void)
6011{
6012 int i;
6013
6014 i = findoption((char_u *)"enc");
6015 if (i >= 0)
6016 return options[i].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0];
6017 return (char_u *)NULL((void*)0);
6018}
6019
6020/*
6021 * Translate a string like "t_xx", "<t_xx>" or "<S-Tab>" to a key number.
6022 */
6023static int find_key_option(char_u *arg)
6024{
6025 int key;
6026 int modifiers;
6027
6028 /*
6029 * Don't use get_special_key_code() for t_xx, we don't want it to call
6030 * add_termcap_entry().
6031 */
6032 if (arg[0] == 't' && arg[1] == '_' && arg[2] && arg[3])
6033 key = TERMCAP2KEY(arg[2], arg[3])(-((arg[2]) + ((int)(arg[3]) << 8)));
6034 else {
6035 --arg; /* put arg at the '<' */
6036 modifiers = 0;
6037 key = find_special_key(&arg, &modifiers, TRUE1, TRUE1);
6038 if (modifiers) /* can't handle modifiers here */
6039 key = 0;
6040 }
6041 return key;
6042}
6043
6044/*
6045 * if 'all' == 0: show changed options
6046 * if 'all' == 1: show all normal options
6047 * if 'all' == 2: show all terminal options
6048 */
6049static void
6050showoptions (
6051 int all,
6052 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL */
6053)
6054{
6055 struct vimoption *p;
6056 int col;
6057 int isterm;
6058 char_u *varp;
6059 int item_count;
6060 int run;
6061 int row, rows;
6062 int cols;
6063 int i;
6064 int len;
6065
6066#define INC20 20
6067#define GAP3 3
6068
6069 struct vimoption **items = xmalloc(sizeof(struct vimoption *) * PARAM_COUNT(sizeof(options) / sizeof(struct vimoption)));
6070
6071 /* Highlight title */
6072 if (all == 2)
6073 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Terminal codes ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Terminal codes ---"
))));
6074 else if (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2)
6075 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Global option values ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Global option values ---"
))));
6076 else if (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4)
6077 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Local option values ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Local option values ---"
))));
6078 else
6079 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Options ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Options ---"
))));
6080
6081 /*
6082 * do the loop two times:
6083 * 1. display the short items
6084 * 2. display the long items (only strings and numbers)
6085 */
6086 for (run = 1; run <= 2 && !got_int; ++run) {
6087 /*
6088 * collect the items in items[]
6089 */
6090 item_count = 0;
6091 for (p = &options[0]; p->fullname != NULL((void*)0); p++) {
6092 varp = NULL((void*)0);
6093 isterm = istermoption(p);
6094 if (opt_flags != 0) {
6095 if (p->indir != PV_NONE && !isterm)
6096 varp = get_varp_scope(p, opt_flags);
6097 } else
6098 varp = get_varp(p);
6099 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)
6100 && ((all == 2 && isterm)
6101 || (all == 1 && !isterm)
6102 || (all == 0 && !optval_default(p, varp)))) {
6103 if (p->flags & P_BOOL0x01)
6104 len = 1; /* a toggle option fits always */
6105 else {
6106 option_value2string(p, opt_flags);
6107 len = (int)STRLEN(p->fullname)strlen((char *)(p->fullname)) + vim_strsize(NameBuff) + 1;
6108 }
6109 if ((len <= INC20 - GAP3 && run == 1) ||
6110 (len > INC20 - GAP3 && run == 2))
6111 items[item_count++] = p;
6112 }
6113 }
6114
6115 /*
6116 * display the items
6117 */
6118 if (run == 1) {
6119 cols = (Columns + GAP3 - 3) / INC20;
6120 if (cols == 0)
6121 cols = 1;
6122 rows = (item_count + cols - 1) / cols;
6123 } else /* run == 2 */
6124 rows = item_count;
6125 for (row = 0; row < rows && !got_int; ++row) {
6126 msg_putchar('\n'); /* go to next line */
6127 if (got_int) /* 'q' typed in more */
6128 break;
6129 col = 0;
6130 for (i = row; i < item_count; i += rows) {
6131 msg_col = col; /* make columns */
6132 showoneopt(items[i], opt_flags);
6133 col += INC20;
6134 }
6135 out_flush();
6136 ui_breakcheck();
6137 }
6138 }
6139 free(items);
6140}
6141
6142/*
6143 * Return TRUE if option "p" has its default value.
6144 */
6145static int optval_default(struct vimoption *p, char_u *varp)
6146{
6147 int dvi;
6148
6149 if (varp == NULL((void*)0))
6150 return TRUE1; /* hidden option is always at default */
6151 dvi = ((p->flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) || p_cp) ? VI_DEFAULT0 : VIM_DEFAULT1;
6152 if (p->flags & P_NUM0x02)
6153 return *(long *)varp == (long)p->def_val[dvi];
6154 if (p->flags & P_BOOL0x01)
6155 return *(int *)varp == (int)(intptr_t)p->def_val[dvi];
6156 /* P_STRING */
6157 return STRCMP(*(char_u **)varp, p->def_val[dvi])strcmp((char *)(*(char_u **)varp), (char *)(p->def_val[dvi
])) == 0;
6158}
6159
6160/*
6161 * showoneopt: show the value of one option
6162 * must not be called with a hidden option!
6163 */
6164static void
6165showoneopt (
6166 struct vimoption *p,
6167 int opt_flags /* OPT_LOCAL or OPT_GLOBAL */
6168)
6169{
6170 char_u *varp;
6171 int save_silent = silent_mode;
6172
6173 silent_mode = FALSE0;
6174 info_message = TRUE1; /* use mch_msg(), not mch_errmsg() */
6175
6176 varp = get_varp_scope(p, opt_flags);
6177
6178 /* for 'modified' we also need to check if 'ff' or 'fenc' changed. */
6179 if ((p->flags & P_BOOL0x01) && ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_changed
6180 ? !curbufIsChanged() : !*(int *)varp))
6181 MSG_PUTS("no")msg_puts((char_u *)("no"));
6182 else if ((p->flags & P_BOOL0x01) && *(int *)varp < 0)
6183 MSG_PUTS("--")msg_puts((char_u *)("--"));
6184 else
6185 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
6186 MSG_PUTS(p->fullname)msg_puts((char_u *)(p->fullname));
6187 if (!(p->flags & P_BOOL0x01)) {
6188 msg_putchar('=');
6189 /* put value string in NameBuff */
6190 option_value2string(p, opt_flags);
