6191 msg_outtrans(NameBuff);
6192 }
6193
6194 silent_mode = save_silent;
6195 info_message = FALSE0;
6196}
6197
6198/*
6199 * Write modified options as ":set" commands to a file.
6200 *
6201 * There are three values for "opt_flags":
6202 * OPT_GLOBAL: Write global option values and fresh values of
6203 * buffer-local options (used for start of a session
6204 * file).
6205 * OPT_GLOBAL + OPT_LOCAL: Idem, add fresh values of window-local options for
6206 * curwin (used for a vimrc file).
6207 * OPT_LOCAL: Write buffer-local option values for curbuf, fresh
6208 * and local values for window-local options of
6209 * curwin. Local values are also written when at the
6210 * default value, because a modeline or autocommand
6211 * may have set them when doing ":edit file" and the
6212 * user has set them back at the default or fresh
6213 * value.
6214 * When "local_only" is TRUE, don't write fresh
6215 * values, only local values (for ":mkview").
6216 * (fresh value = value used for a new buffer or window for a local option).
6217 *
6218 * Return FAIL on error, OK otherwise.
6219 */
6220int makeset(FILE *fd, int opt_flags, int local_only)
6221{
6222 struct vimoption *p;
6223 char_u *varp; /* currently used value */
6224 char_u *varp_fresh; /* local value */
6225 char_u *varp_local = NULL((void*)0); /* fresh value */
6226 char *cmd;
6227 int round;
6228 int pri;
6229
6230 /*
6231 * The options that don't have a default (terminal name, columns, lines)
6232 * are never written. Terminal options are also not written.
6233 * Do the loop over "options[]" twice: once for options with the
6234 * P_PRI_MKRC flag and once without.
6235 */
6236 for (pri = 1; pri >= 0; --pri) {
6237 for (p = &options[0]; !istermoption(p); p++)
6238 if (!(p->flags & P_NO_MKRC0x200)
6239 && !istermoption(p)
6240 && ((pri == 1) == ((p->flags & P_PRI_MKRC0x800000L) != 0))) {
6241 /* skip global option when only doing locals */
6242 if (p->indir == PV_NONE && !(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2))
6243 continue;
6244
6245 /* Do not store options like 'bufhidden' and 'syntax' in a vimrc
6246 * file, they are always buffer-specific. */
6247 if ((opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) && (p->flags & P_NOGLOB0x100000L))
6248 continue;
6249
6250 /* Global values are only written when not at the default value. */
6251 varp = get_varp_scope(p, opt_flags);
6252 if ((opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) && optval_default(p, varp))
6253 continue;
6254
6255 round = 2;
6256 if (p->indir != PV_NONE) {
6257 if (p->var == VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1)) {
6258 /* skip window-local option when only doing globals */
6259 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4))
6260 continue;
6261 /* When fresh value of window-local option is not at the
6262 * default, need to write it too. */
6263 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) && !local_only) {
6264 varp_fresh = get_varp_scope(p, OPT_GLOBAL2);
6265 if (!optval_default(p, varp_fresh)) {
6266 round = 1;
6267 varp_local = varp;
6268 varp = varp_fresh;
6269 }
6270 }
6271 }
6272 }
6273
6274 /* Round 1: fresh value for window-local options.
6275 * Round 2: other values */
6276 for (; round <= 2; varp = varp_local, ++round) {
6277 if (round == 1 || (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2))
6278 cmd = "set";
6279 else
6280 cmd = "setlocal";
6281
6282 if (p->flags & P_BOOL0x01) {
6283 if (put_setbool(fd, cmd, p->fullname, *(int *)varp) == FAIL0)
6284 return FAIL0;
6285 } else if (p->flags & P_NUM0x02) {
6286 if (put_setnum(fd, cmd, p->fullname, (long *)varp) == FAIL0)
6287 return FAIL0;
6288 } else { /* P_STRING */
6289 int do_endif = FALSE0;
6290
6291 /* Don't set 'syntax' and 'filetype' again if the value is
6292 * already right, avoids reloading the syntax file. */
6293 if (
6294 p->indir == PV_SYN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SYN))
6295 ||
6296 p->indir == PV_FT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FT))
6297 ) {
6298 if (fprintf(fd, "if &%s != '%s'", p->fullname,
6299 *(char_u **)(varp)) < 0
6300 || put_eol(fd) < 0)
6301 return FAIL0;
6302 do_endif = TRUE1;
6303 }
6304 if (put_setstring(fd, cmd, p->fullname, (char_u **)varp,
6305 (p->flags & P_EXPAND0x10) != 0) == FAIL0)
6306 return FAIL0;
6307 if (do_endif) {
6308 if (put_line(fd, "endif") == FAIL0)
6309 return FAIL0;
6310 }
6311 }
6312 }
6313 }
6314 }
6315 return OK1;
6316}
6317
6318/*
6319 * Generate set commands for the local fold options only. Used when
6320 * 'sessionoptions' or 'viewoptions' contains "folds" but not "options".
6321 */
6322int makefoldset(FILE *fd)
6323{
6324 if (put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fdm", &curwin->w_p_fdmw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdm, FALSE0) == FAIL0
6325 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fde", &curwin->w_p_fdew_onebuf_opt.wo_fde, FALSE0)
6326 == FAIL0
6327 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fmr", &curwin->w_p_fmrw_onebuf_opt.wo_fmr, FALSE0)
6328 == FAIL0
6329 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fdi", &curwin->w_p_fdiw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdi, FALSE0)
6330 == FAIL0
6331 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fdl", &curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl) == FAIL0
6332 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fml", &curwin->w_p_fmlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fml) == FAIL0
6333 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fdn", &curwin->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn) == FAIL0
6334 || put_setbool(fd, "setlocal", "fen", curwin->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen) == FAIL0
6335 )
6336 return FAIL0;
6337
6338 return OK1;
6339}
6340
6341static int put_setstring(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, char_u **valuep, int expand)
6342{
6343 char_u *s;
6344 char_u *buf;
6345
6346 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s=", cmd, name) < 0)
6347 return FAIL0;
6348 if (*valuep != NULL((void*)0)) {
6349 /* Output 'pastetoggle' as key names. For other
6350 * options some characters have to be escaped with
6351 * CTRL-V or backslash */
6352 if (valuep == &p_pt) {
6353 s = *valuep;
6354 while (*s != NUL'\000')
6355 if (put_escstr(fd, str2special(&s, FALSE0), 2) == FAIL0)
6356 return FAIL0;
6357 } else if (expand) {
6358 buf = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
6359 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), *valuep, buf, MAXPATHL4096, FALSE0);
6360 if (put_escstr(fd, buf, 2) == FAIL0) {
6361 free(buf);
6362 return FAIL0;
6363 }
6364 free(buf);
6365 } else if (put_escstr(fd, *valuep, 2) == FAIL0)
6366 return FAIL0;
6367 }
6368 if (put_eol(fd) < 0)
6369 return FAIL0;
6370 return OK1;
6371}
6372
6373static int put_setnum(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, long *valuep)
6374{
6375 long wc;
6376
6377 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s=", cmd, name) < 0)
6378 return FAIL0;
6379 if (wc_use_keyname((char_u *)valuep, &wc)) {
6380 /* print 'wildchar' and 'wildcharm' as a key name */
6381 if (fputs((char *)get_special_key_name((int)wc, 0), fd) < 0)
6382 return FAIL0;
6383 } else if (fprintf(fd, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)*valuep) < 0)
6384 return FAIL0;
6385 if (put_eol(fd) < 0)
6386 return FAIL0;
6387 return OK1;
6388}
6389
6390static int put_setbool(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, int value)
6391{
6392 if (value < 0) /* global/local option using global value */
6393 return OK1;
6394 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s%s", cmd, value ? "" : "no", name) < 0
6395 || put_eol(fd) < 0)
6396 return FAIL0;
6397 return OK1;
6398}
6399
6400/*
6401 * Clear all the terminal options.
6402 * If the option has been allocated, free the memory.
6403 * Terminal options are never hidden or indirect.
6404 */
6405void clear_termoptions(void)
6406{
6407 /*
6408 * Reset a few things before clearing the old options. This may cause
6409 * outputting a few things that the terminal doesn't understand, but the
6410 * screen will be cleared later, so this is OK.
6411 */
6412 mch_setmouse(FALSE0); /* switch mouse off */
6413 mch_restore_title(3); /* restore window titles */
6414 stoptermcap(); /* stop termcap mode */
6415
6416 free_termoptions();
6417}
6418
6419void free_termoptions(void)
6420{
6421 struct vimoption *p;
6422
6423 for (p = &options[0]; p->fullname != NULL((void*)0); p++)
6424 if (istermoption(p)) {
6425 if (p->flags & P_ALLOCED0x08)
6426 free_string_option(*(char_u **)(p->var));
6427 if (p->flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80)
6428 free_string_option(p->def_val[VI_DEFAULT0]);
6429 *(char_u **)(p->var) = empty_option;
6430 p->def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = empty_option;
6431 p->flags &= ~(P_ALLOCED0x08|P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80);
6432 }
6433 clear_termcodes();
6434}
6435
6436/*
6437 * Free the string for one term option, if it was allocated.
6438 * Set the string to empty_option and clear allocated flag.
6439 * "var" points to the option value.
6440 */
6441void free_one_termoption(char_u *var)
6442{
6443 struct vimoption *p;
6444
6445 for (p = &options[0]; p->fullname != NULL((void*)0); p++)
6446 if (p->var == var) {
6447 if (p->flags & P_ALLOCED0x08)
6448 free_string_option(*(char_u **)(p->var));
6449 *(char_u **)(p->var) = empty_option;
6450 p->flags &= ~P_ALLOCED0x08;
6451 break;
6452 }
6453}
6454
6455/*
6456 * Set the terminal option defaults to the current value.
6457 * Used after setting the terminal name.
6458 */
6459void set_term_defaults(void)
6460{
6461 struct vimoption *p;
6462
6463 for (p = &options[0]; p->fullname != NULL((void*)0); p++) {
6464 if (istermoption(p) && p->def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] != *(char_u **)(p->var)) {
6465 if (p->flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80) {
6466 free_string_option(p->def_val[VI_DEFAULT0]);
6467 p->flags &= ~P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
6468 }
6469 p->def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = *(char_u **)(p->var);
6470 if (p->flags & P_ALLOCED0x08) {
6471 p->flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x80;
6472 p->flags &= ~P_ALLOCED0x08; /* don't free the value now */
6473 }
6474 }
6475 }
6476}
6477
6478/*
6479 * return TRUE if 'p' starts with 't_'
6480 */
6481static int istermoption(struct vimoption *p)
6482{
6483 return p->fullname[0] == 't' && p->fullname[1] == '_';
6484}
6485
6486/*
6487 * Compute columns for ruler and shown command. 'sc_col' is also used to
6488 * decide what the maximum length of a message on the status line can be.
6489 * If there is a status line for the last window, 'sc_col' is independent
6490 * of 'ru_col'.
6491 */
6492
6493#define COL_RULER17 17 /* columns needed by standard ruler */
6494
6495void comp_col(void)
6496{
6497 int last_has_status = (p_ls == 2 || (p_ls == 1 && firstwin != lastwin));
6498
6499 sc_col = 0;
6500 ru_col = 0;
6501 if (p_ru) {
6502 ru_col = (ru_wid ? ru_wid : COL_RULER17) + 1;
6503 /* no last status line, adjust sc_col */
6504 if (!last_has_status)
6505 sc_col = ru_col;
6506 }
6507 if (p_sc) {
6508 sc_col += SHOWCMD_COLS10;
6509 if (!p_ru || last_has_status) /* no need for separating space */
6510 ++sc_col;
6511 }
6512 sc_col = Columns - sc_col;
6513 ru_col = Columns - ru_col;
6514 if (sc_col <= 0) /* screen too narrow, will become a mess */
6515 sc_col = 1;
6516 if (ru_col <= 0)
6517 ru_col = 1;
6518}
6519
6520// Unset local option value, similar to ":set opt<".
6521void unset_global_local_option(char *name, void *from)
6522{
6523 struct vimoption *p;
6524 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)from;
6525
6526 int opt_idx = findoption((uint8_t *)name);
6527 if (opt_idx < 0) {
6528 EMSG2(_("E355: Unknown option: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E355: Unknown option: %s")
)), (char_u *)(name));
6529 return;
6530 }
6531 p = &(options[opt_idx]);
6532
6533 switch ((int)p->indir)
6534 {
6535 // global option with local value: use local value if it's been set
6536 case PV_EP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EP)))):
6537 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_ep);
6538 break;
6539 case PV_KP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_KP)))):
6540 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_kp);
6541 break;
6542 case PV_PATH(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_PATH)))):
6543 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_path);
6544 break;
6545 case PV_AR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AR)))):
6546 buf->b_p_ar = -1;
6547 break;
6548 case PV_TAGS(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TAGS)))):
6549 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_tags);
6550 break;
6551 case PV_DEF(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DEF)))):
6552 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_def);
6553 break;
6554 case PV_INC(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INC)))):
6555 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_inc);
6556 break;
6557 case PV_DICT(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DICT)))):
6558 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_dict);
6559 break;
6560 case PV_TSR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TSR)))):
6561 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_tsr);
6562 break;
6563 case PV_EFM(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EFM)))):
6564 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_efm);
6565 break;
6566 case PV_GP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_GP)))):
6567 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_gp);
6568 break;
6569 case PV_MP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MP)))):
6570 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_mp);
6571 break;
6572 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL)))):
6573 clear_string_option(&((win_T *)from)->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl);
6574 break;
6575 case PV_UL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UL)))):
6576 buf->b_p_ul = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL-123456;
6577 break;
6578 case PV_LW(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_LW)))):
6579 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_lw);
6580 break;
6581 }
6582}
6583
6584/*
6585 * Get pointer to option variable, depending on local or global scope.
6586 */
6587static char_u *get_varp_scope(struct vimoption *p, int opt_flags)
6588{
6589 if ((opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL2) && p->indir != PV_NONE) {
6590 if (p->var == VAR_WIN((char_u *)-1))
6591 return (char_u *)GLOBAL_WO(get_varp(p))((char *)get_varp(p) + sizeof(winopt_T));
6592 return p->var;
6593 }
6594 if ((opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL4) && ((int)p->indir & PV_BOTH0x1000)) {
6595 switch ((int)p->indir) {
6596 case PV_EFM(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EFM)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_efm);
6597 case PV_GP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_GP)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_gp);
6598 case PV_MP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MP)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_mp);
6599 case PV_EP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EP)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ep);
6600 case PV_KP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_KP)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_kp);
6601 case PV_PATH(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_PATH)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_path);
6602 case PV_AR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AR)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ar);
6603 case PV_TAGS(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TAGS)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_tags);
6604 case PV_DEF(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DEF)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_def);
6605 case PV_INC(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INC)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_inc);
6606 case PV_DICT(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DICT)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_dict);
6607 case PV_TSR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TSR)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_tsr);
6608 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL)))): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl);
6609 case PV_UL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UL)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ul);
6610 case PV_LW(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_LW)))): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_lw);
6611 }
6612 return NULL((void*)0); /* "cannot happen" */
6613 }
6614 return get_varp(p);
6615}
6616
6617/*
6618 * Get pointer to option variable.
6619 */
6620static char_u *get_varp(struct vimoption *p)
6621{
6622 /* hidden option, always return NULL */
6623 if (p->var == NULL((void*)0))
6624 return NULL((void*)0);
6625
6626 switch ((int)p->indir) {
6627 case PV_NONE: return p->var;
6628
6629 /* global option with local value: use local value if it's been set */
6630 case PV_EP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EP)))): return *curbuf->b_p_ep != NUL'\000'
6631 ? (char_u *)&curbuf->b_p_ep : p->var;
6632 case PV_KP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_KP)))): return *curbuf->b_p_kp != NUL'\000'
6633 ? (char_u *)&curbuf->b_p_kp : p->var;
6634 case PV_PATH(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_PATH)))): return *curbuf->b_p_path != NUL'\000'
6635 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_path) : p->var;
6636 case PV_AR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AR)))): return curbuf->b_p_ar >= 0
6637 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ar) : p->var;
6638 case PV_TAGS(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TAGS)))): return *curbuf->b_p_tags != NUL'\000'
6639 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_tags) : p->var;
6640 case PV_DEF(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DEF)))): return *curbuf->b_p_def != NUL'\000'
6641 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_def) : p->var;
6642 case PV_INC(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INC)))): return *curbuf->b_p_inc != NUL'\000'
6643 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_inc) : p->var;
6644 case PV_DICT(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_DICT)))): return *curbuf->b_p_dict != NUL'\000'
6645 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_dict) : p->var;
6646 case PV_TSR(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TSR)))): return *curbuf->b_p_tsr != NUL'\000'
6647 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_tsr) : p->var;
6648 case PV_EFM(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EFM)))): return *curbuf->b_p_efm != NUL'\000'
6649 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_efm) : p->var;
6650 case PV_GP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_GP)))): return *curbuf->b_p_gp != NUL'\000'
6651 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_gp) : p->var;
6652 case PV_MP(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MP)))): return *curbuf->b_p_mp != NUL'\000'
6653 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_mp) : p->var;
6654 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_STL)))): return *curwin->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000'
6655 ? (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl) : p->var;
6656 case PV_UL(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UL)))): return curbuf->b_p_ul != NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL-123456
6657 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ul) : p->var;
6658 case PV_LW(idopt_T)(0x1000 + (int)((idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_LW)))): return *curbuf->b_p_lw != NUL'\000'
6659 ? (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_lw) : p->var;
6660
6661 case PV_ARAB(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_ARAB)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab);
6662 case PV_LIST(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_LIST)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list);
6663 case PV_SPELL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_SPELL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell);
6664 case PV_CUC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUC)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc);
6665 case PV_CUL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CUL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul);
6666 case PV_CC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CC)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_ccw_onebuf_opt.wo_cc);
6667 case PV_DIFF(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_DIFF)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff);
6668 case PV_FDC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDC)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc);
6669 case PV_FEN(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FEN)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen);
6670 case PV_FDI(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDI)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdiw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdi);
6671 case PV_FDL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl);
6672 case PV_FDM(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDM)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdmw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdm);
6673 case PV_FML(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FML)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fmlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fml);
6674 case PV_FDN(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDN)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn);
6675 case PV_FDE(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDE)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdew_onebuf_opt.wo_fde);
6676 case PV_FDT(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FDT)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fdtw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdt);
6677 case PV_FMR(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_FMR)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_fmrw_onebuf_opt.wo_fmr);
6678 case PV_NU(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_NU)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu);
6679 case PV_RNU(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_RNU)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu);
6680 case PV_NUW(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_NUW)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw);
6681 case PV_WFH(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFH)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_wfhw_onebuf_opt.wo_wfh);
6682 case PV_WFW(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WFW)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_wfww_onebuf_opt.wo_wfw);
6683 case PV_PVW(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_PVW)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw);
6684 case PV_RL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_RL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl);
6685 case PV_RLC(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_RLC)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_rlcw_onebuf_opt.wo_rlc);
6686 case PV_SCROLL(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_SCROLL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr);
6687 case PV_WRAP(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_WRAP)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap);
6688 case PV_LBR(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_LBR)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr);
6689 case PV_BRI(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRI)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_briw_onebuf_opt.wo_bri);
6690 case PV_BRIOPT(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_BRIOPT)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_brioptw_onebuf_opt.wo_briopt);
6691 case PV_SCBIND(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_SCBIND)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb);
6692 case PV_CRBIND(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_CRBIND)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb);
6693 case PV_COCU(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COCU)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu);
6694 case PV_COLE(idopt_T)(0x2000 + (int)(WV_COLE)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole);
6695
6696 case PV_AI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_AI)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ai);
6697 case PV_BIN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BIN)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_bin);
6698 case PV_BOMB(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BOMB)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_bomb);
6699 case PV_BH(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BH)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_bh);
6700 case PV_BT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BT)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_bt);
6701 case PV_BL(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_BL)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_bl);
6702 case PV_CI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CI)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ci);
6703 case PV_CIN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CIN)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cin);
6704 case PV_CINK(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINK)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cink);
6705 case PV_CINO(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINO)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cino);
6706 case PV_CINW(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CINW)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cinw);
6707 case PV_COM(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_COM)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_com);
6708 case PV_CMS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CMS)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cms);
6709 case PV_CPT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CPT)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cpt);
6710 case PV_CFU(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_CFU)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_cfu);
6711 case PV_OFU(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_OFU)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ofu);
6712 case PV_EOL(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_EOL)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_eol);
6713 case PV_ET(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_ET)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_et);
6714 case PV_FENC(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FENC)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_fenc);
6715 case PV_FF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FF)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ff);
6716 case PV_FT(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FT)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ft);
6717 case PV_FO(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FO)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_fo);
6718 case PV_FLP(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FLP)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_flp);
6719 case PV_IMI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_IMI)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_iminsert);
6720 case PV_IMS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_IMS)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_imsearch);
6721 case PV_INF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INF)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_inf);
6722 case PV_ISK(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_ISK)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_isk);
6723 case PV_INEX(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INEX)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_inex);
6724 case PV_INDE(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INDE)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_inde);
6725 case PV_INDK(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_INDK)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_indk);
6726 case PV_FEX(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_FEX)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_fex);
6727 case PV_LISP(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_LISP)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_lisp);
6728 case PV_ML(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_ML)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ml);
6729 case PV_MPS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MPS)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_mps);
6730 case PV_MA(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MA)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ma);
6731 case PV_MOD(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_MOD)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_changed);
6732 case PV_NF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_NF)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_nf);
6733 case PV_PI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_PI)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_pi);
6734 case PV_QE(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_QE)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_qe);
6735 case PV_RO(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_RO)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ro);
6736 case PV_SI(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SI)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_si);
6737 case PV_STS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_STS)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_sts);
6738 case PV_SUA(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SUA)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_sua);
6739 case PV_SWF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SWF)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_swf);
6740 case PV_SMC(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SMC)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_smc);
6741 case PV_SYN(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SYN)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_syn);
6742 case PV_SPC(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SPC)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_s->b_p_spc);
6743 case PV_SPF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SPF)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_s->b_p_spf);
6744 case PV_SPL(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SPL)): return (char_u *)&(curwin->w_s->b_p_spl);
6745 case PV_SW(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_SW)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_sw);
6746 case PV_TS(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TS)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_ts);
6747 case PV_TW(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_TW)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_tw);
6748 case PV_UDF(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_UDF)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_udf);
6749 case PV_WM(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_WM)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_wm);
6750 case PV_KMAP(idopt_T)(0x4000 + (int)(BV_KMAP)): return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_keymap);
6751 default: EMSG(_("E356: get_varp ERROR"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E356: get_varp ERROR"))));
6752 }
6753 /* always return a valid pointer to avoid a crash! */
6754 return (char_u *)&(curbuf->b_p_wm);
6755}
6756
6757/*
6758 * Get the value of 'equalprg', either the buffer-local one or the global one.
6759 */
6760char_u *get_equalprg(void)
6761{
6762 if (*curbuf->b_p_ep == NUL'\000')
6763 return p_ep;
6764 return curbuf->b_p_ep;
6765}
6766
6767/*
6768 * Copy options from one window to another.
6769 * Used when splitting a window.
6770 */
6771void win_copy_options(win_T *wp_from, win_T *wp_to)
6772{
6773 copy_winopt(&wp_from->w_onebuf_opt, &wp_to->w_onebuf_opt);
6774 copy_winopt(&wp_from->w_allbuf_opt, &wp_to->w_allbuf_opt);
6775 /* Is this right? */
6776 wp_to->w_farsi = wp_from->w_farsi;
6777}
6778
6779/*
6780 * Copy the options from one winopt_T to another.
6781 * Doesn't free the old option values in "to", use clear_winopt() for that.
6782 * The 'scroll' option is not copied, because it depends on the window height.
6783 * The 'previewwindow' option is reset, there can be only one preview window.
6784 */
6785void copy_winopt(winopt_T *from, winopt_T *to)
6786{
6787 to->wo_arab = from->wo_arab;
6788 to->wo_list = from->wo_list;
6789 to->wo_nu = from->wo_nu;
6790 to->wo_rnu = from->wo_rnu;
6791 to->wo_nuw = from->wo_nuw;
6792 to->wo_rl = from->wo_rl;
6793 to->wo_rlc = vim_strsave(from->wo_rlc);
6794 to->wo_stl = vim_strsave(from->wo_stl);
6795 to->wo_wrap = from->wo_wrap;
6796 to->wo_wrap_save = from->wo_wrap_save;
6797 to->wo_lbr = from->wo_lbr;
6798 to->wo_bri = from->wo_bri;
6799 to->wo_briopt = vim_strsave(from->wo_briopt);
6800 to->wo_scb = from->wo_scb;
6801 to->wo_scb_save = from->wo_scb_save;
6802 to->wo_crb = from->wo_crb;
6803 to->wo_crb_save = from->wo_crb_save;
6804 to->wo_spell = from->wo_spell;
6805 to->wo_cuc = from->wo_cuc;
6806 to->wo_cul = from->wo_cul;
6807 to->wo_cc = vim_strsave(from->wo_cc);
6808 to->wo_diff = from->wo_diff;
6809 to->wo_diff_saved = from->wo_diff_saved;
6810 to->wo_cocu = vim_strsave(from->wo_cocu);
6811 to->wo_cole = from->wo_cole;
6812 to->wo_fdc = from->wo_fdc;
6813 to->wo_fdc_save = from->wo_fdc_save;
6814 to->wo_fen = from->wo_fen;
6815 to->wo_fen_save = from->wo_fen_save;
6816 to->wo_fdi = vim_strsave(from->wo_fdi);
6817 to->wo_fml = from->wo_fml;
6818 to->wo_fdl = from->wo_fdl;
6819 to->wo_fdl_save = from->wo_fdl_save;
6820 to->wo_fdm = vim_strsave(from->wo_fdm);
6821 to->wo_fdm_save = from->wo_diff_saved
6822 ? vim_strsave(from->wo_fdm_save) : empty_option;
6823 to->wo_fdn = from->wo_fdn;
6824 to->wo_fde = vim_strsave(from->wo_fde);
6825 to->wo_fdt = vim_strsave(from->wo_fdt);
6826 to->wo_fmr = vim_strsave(from->wo_fmr);
6827 check_winopt(to); /* don't want NULL pointers */
6828}
6829
6830/*
6831 * Check string options in a window for a NULL value.
6832 */
6833void check_win_options(win_T *win)
6834{
6835 check_winopt(&win->w_onebuf_opt);
6836 check_winopt(&win->w_allbuf_opt);
6837}
6838
6839/*
6840 * Check for NULL pointers in a winopt_T and replace them with empty_option.
6841 */
6842static void check_winopt(winopt_T *wop)
6843{
6844 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdi);
6845 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm);
6846 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm_save);
6847 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fde);
6848 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdt);
6849 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fmr);
6850 check_string_option(&wop->wo_rlc);
6851 check_string_option(&wop->wo_stl);
6852 check_string_option(&wop->wo_cc);
6853 check_string_option(&wop->wo_cocu);
6854 check_string_option(&wop->wo_briopt);
6855}
6856
6857/*
6858 * Free the allocated memory inside a winopt_T.
6859 */
6860void clear_winopt(winopt_T *wop)
6861{
6862 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdi);
6863 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm);
6864 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm_save);
6865 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fde);
6866 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdt);
6867 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fmr);
6868 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_rlc);
6869 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_stl);
6870 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_cc);
6871 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_cocu);
6872 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_briopt);
6873}
6874
6875/*
6876 * Copy global option values to local options for one buffer.
6877 * Used when creating a new buffer and sometimes when entering a buffer.
6878 * flags:
6879 * BCO_ENTER We will enter the buf buffer.
6880 * BCO_ALWAYS Always copy the options, but only set b_p_initialized when
6881 * appropriate.
6882 * BCO_NOHELP Don't copy the values to a help buffer.
6883 */
6884void buf_copy_options(buf_T *buf, int flags)
6885{
6886 int should_copy = TRUE1;
6887 char_u *save_p_isk = NULL((void*)0); /* init for GCC */
6888 int dont_do_help;
6889 int did_isk = FALSE0;
6890
6891 /*
6892 * Don't do anything if the buffer is invalid.
6893 */
6894 if (buf == NULL((void*)0) || !buf_valid(buf))
6895 return;
6896
6897 /*
6898 * Skip this when the option defaults have not been set yet. Happens when
6899 * main() allocates the first buffer.
6900 */
6901 if (p_cpo != NULL((void*)0)) {
6902 /*
6903 * Always copy when entering and 'cpo' contains 'S'.
6904 * Don't copy when already initialized.
6905 * Don't copy when 'cpo' contains 's' and not entering.
6906 * 'S' BCO_ENTER initialized 's' should_copy
6907 * yes yes X X TRUE
6908 * yes no yes X FALSE
6909 * no X yes X FALSE
6910 * X no no yes FALSE
6911 * X no no no TRUE
6912 * no yes no X TRUE
6913 */
6914 if ((vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BUFOPTGLOB'S') == NULL((void*)0) || !(flags & BCO_ENTER1))
6915 && (buf->b_p_initialized
6916 || (!(flags & BCO_ENTER1)
6917 && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BUFOPT's') != NULL((void*)0))))
6918 should_copy = FALSE0;
6919
6920 if (should_copy || (flags & BCO_ALWAYS2)) {
6921 /* Don't copy the options specific to a help buffer when
6922 * BCO_NOHELP is given or the options were initialized already
6923 * (jumping back to a help file with CTRL-T or CTRL-O) */
6924 dont_do_help = ((flags & BCO_NOHELP4) && buf->b_help)
6925 || buf->b_p_initialized;
6926 if (dont_do_help) { /* don't free b_p_isk */
6927 save_p_isk = buf->b_p_isk;
6928 buf->b_p_isk = NULL((void*)0);
6929 }
6930 /*
6931 * Always free the allocated strings.
6932 * If not already initialized, set 'readonly' and copy 'fileformat'.
6933 */
6934 if (!buf->b_p_initialized) {
6935 free_buf_options(buf, TRUE1);
6936 buf->b_p_ro = FALSE0; /* don't copy readonly */
6937 buf->b_p_fenc = vim_strsave(p_fenc);
6938 buf->b_p_ff = vim_strsave(p_ff);
6939 buf->b_p_bh = empty_option;
6940 buf->b_p_bt = empty_option;
6941 } else
6942 free_buf_options(buf, FALSE0);
6943
6944 buf->b_p_ai = p_ai;
6945 buf->b_p_ai_nopaste = p_ai_nopaste;
6946 buf->b_p_sw = p_sw;
6947 buf->b_p_tw = p_tw;
6948 buf->b_p_tw_nopaste = p_tw_nopaste;
6949 buf->b_p_tw_nobin = p_tw_nobin;
6950 buf->b_p_wm = p_wm;
6951 buf->b_p_wm_nopaste = p_wm_nopaste;
6952 buf->b_p_wm_nobin = p_wm_nobin;
6953 buf->b_p_bin = p_bin;
6954 buf->b_p_bomb = p_bomb;
6955 buf->b_p_et = p_et;
6956 buf->b_p_et_nobin = p_et_nobin;
6957 buf->b_p_ml = p_ml;
6958 buf->b_p_ml_nobin = p_ml_nobin;
6959 buf->b_p_inf = p_inf;
6960 buf->b_p_swf = p_swf;
6961 buf->b_p_cpt = vim_strsave(p_cpt);
6962 buf->b_p_cfu = vim_strsave(p_cfu);
6963 buf->b_p_ofu = vim_strsave(p_ofu);
6964 buf->b_p_sts = p_sts;
6965 buf->b_p_sts_nopaste = p_sts_nopaste;
6966 buf->b_p_com = vim_strsave(p_com);
6967 buf->b_p_cms = vim_strsave(p_cms);
6968 buf->b_p_fo = vim_strsave(p_fo);
6969 buf->b_p_flp = vim_strsave(p_flp);
6970 buf->b_p_nf = vim_strsave(p_nf);
6971 buf->b_p_mps = vim_strsave(p_mps);
6972 buf->b_p_si = p_si;
6973 buf->b_p_ci = p_ci;
6974 buf->b_p_cin = p_cin;
6975 buf->b_p_cink = vim_strsave(p_cink);
6976 buf->b_p_cino = vim_strsave(p_cino);
6977 /* Don't copy 'filetype', it must be detected */
6978 buf->b_p_ft = empty_option;
6979 buf->b_p_pi = p_pi;
6980 buf->b_p_cinw = vim_strsave(p_cinw);
6981 buf->b_p_lisp = p_lisp;
6982 /* Don't copy 'syntax', it must be set */
6983 buf->b_p_syn = empty_option;
6984 buf->b_p_smc = p_smc;
6985 buf->b_s.b_p_spc = vim_strsave(p_spc);
6986 (void)compile_cap_prog(&buf->b_s);
6987 buf->b_s.b_p_spf = vim_strsave(p_spf);
6988 buf->b_s.b_p_spl = vim_strsave(p_spl);
6989 buf->b_p_inde = vim_strsave(p_inde);
6990 buf->b_p_indk = vim_strsave(p_indk);
6991 buf->b_p_fex = vim_strsave(p_fex);
6992 buf->b_p_sua = vim_strsave(p_sua);
6993 buf->b_p_keymap = vim_strsave(p_keymap);
6994 buf->b_kmap_state |= KEYMAP_INIT1;
6995 /* This isn't really an option, but copying the langmap and IME
6996 * state from the current buffer is better than resetting it. */
6997 buf->b_p_iminsert = p_iminsert;
6998 buf->b_p_imsearch = p_imsearch;
6999
7000 /* options that are normally global but also have a local value
7001 * are not copied, start using the global value */
7002 buf->b_p_ar = -1;
7003 buf->b_p_ul = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL-123456;
7004 buf->b_p_gp = empty_option;
7005 buf->b_p_mp = empty_option;
7006 buf->b_p_efm = empty_option;
7007 buf->b_p_ep = empty_option;
7008 buf->b_p_kp = empty_option;
7009 buf->b_p_path = empty_option;
7010 buf->b_p_tags = empty_option;
7011 buf->b_p_def = empty_option;
7012 buf->b_p_inc = empty_option;
7013 buf->b_p_inex = vim_strsave(p_inex);
7014 buf->b_p_dict = empty_option;
7015 buf->b_p_tsr = empty_option;
7016 buf->b_p_qe = vim_strsave(p_qe);
7017 buf->b_p_udf = p_udf;
7018 buf->b_p_lw = empty_option;
7019
7020 /*
7021 * Don't copy the options set by ex_help(), use the saved values,
7022 * when going from a help buffer to a non-help buffer.
7023 * Don't touch these at all when BCO_NOHELP is used and going from
7024 * or to a help buffer.
7025 */
7026 if (dont_do_help)
7027 buf->b_p_isk = save_p_isk;
7028 else {
7029 buf->b_p_isk = vim_strsave(p_isk);
7030 did_isk = TRUE1;
7031 buf->b_p_ts = p_ts;
7032 buf->b_help = FALSE0;
7033 if (buf->b_p_bt[0] == 'h')
7034 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_bt);
7035 buf->b_p_ma = p_ma;
7036 }
7037 }
7038
7039 /*
7040 * When the options should be copied (ignoring BCO_ALWAYS), set the
7041 * flag that indicates that the options have been initialized.
7042 */
7043 if (should_copy)
7044 buf->b_p_initialized = TRUE1;
7045 }
7046
7047 check_buf_options(buf); /* make sure we don't have NULLs */
7048 if (did_isk)
7049 (void)buf_init_chartab(buf, FALSE0);
7050}
7051
7052/*
7053 * Reset the 'modifiable' option and its default value.
7054 */
7055void reset_modifiable(void)
7056{
7057 int opt_idx;
7058
7059 curbuf->b_p_ma = FALSE0;
7060 p_ma = FALSE0;
7061 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"ma");
7062 if (opt_idx >= 0)
7063 options[opt_idx].def_val[VI_DEFAULT0] = FALSE0;
7064}
7065
7066/*
7067 * Set the global value for 'iminsert' to the local value.
7068 */
7069void set_iminsert_global(void)
7070{
7071 p_iminsert = curbuf->b_p_iminsert;
7072}
7073
7074/*
7075 * Set the global value for 'imsearch' to the local value.
7076 */
7077void set_imsearch_global(void)
7078{
7079 p_imsearch = curbuf->b_p_imsearch;
7080}
7081
7082static int expand_option_idx = -1;
7083static char_u expand_option_name[5] = {'t', '_', NUL'\000', NUL'\000', NUL'\000'};
7084static int expand_option_flags = 0;
7085
7086void
7087set_context_in_set_cmd (
7088 expand_T *xp,
7089 char_u *arg,
7090 int opt_flags /* OPT_GLOBAL and/or OPT_LOCAL */
7091)
7092{
7093 int nextchar;
7094 long_u flags = 0; /* init for GCC */
7095 int opt_idx = 0; /* init for GCC */
7096 char_u *p;
7097 char_u *s;
7098 int is_term_option = FALSE0;
7099 int key;
7100
7101 expand_option_flags = opt_flags;
7102
7103 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTINGS;
7104 if (*arg == NUL'\000') {
7105 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
7106 return;
7107 }
7108 p = arg + STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)) - 1;
7109 if (*p == ' ' && *(p - 1) != '\\') {
7110 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
7111 return;
7112 }
7113 while (p > arg) {
7114 s = p;
7115 /* count number of backslashes before ' ' or ',' */
7116 if (*p == ' ' || *p == ',') {
7117 while (s > arg && *(s - 1) == '\\')
7118 --s;
7119 }
7120 /* break at a space with an even number of backslashes */
7121 if (*p == ' ' && ((p - s) & 1) == 0) {
7122 ++p;
7123 break;
7124 }
7125 --p;
7126 }
7127 if (STRNCMP(p, "no", 2)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("no"), (size_t)(2)) == 0 && STRNCMP(p, "novice", 6)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("novice"), (size_t)(6)) != 0) {
7128 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS;
7129 p += 2;
7130 }
7131 if (STRNCMP(p, "inv", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("inv"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
7132 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS;
7133 p += 3;
7134 }
7135 xp->xp_pattern = arg = p;
7136 if (*arg == '<') {
7137 while (*p != '>')
7138 if (*p++ == NUL'\000') /* expand terminal option name */
7139 return;
7140 key = get_special_key_code(arg + 1);
7141 if (key == 0) { /* unknown name */
7142 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
7143 return;
7144 }
7145 nextchar = *++p;
7146 is_term_option = TRUE1;
7147 expand_option_name[2] = KEY2TERMCAP0(key)((-(key)) & 0xff);
7148 expand_option_name[3] = KEY2TERMCAP1(key)(((unsigned)(-(key)) >> 8) & 0xff);
7149 } else {
7150 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_') {
7151 p += 2;
7152 if (*p != NUL'\000')
7153 ++p;
7154 if (*p == NUL'\000')
7155 return; /* expand option name */
7156 nextchar = *++p;
7157 is_term_option = TRUE1;
7158 expand_option_name[2] = p[-2];
7159 expand_option_name[3] = p[-1];
7160 } else {
7161 /* Allow * wildcard */
7162 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)) || ((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10)) || *p == '_' || *p == '*')
7163 p++;
7164 if (*p == NUL'\000')
7165 return;
7166 nextchar = *p;
7167 *p = NUL'\000';
7168 opt_idx = findoption(arg);
7169 *p = nextchar;
7170 if (opt_idx == -1 || options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) {
7171 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
7172 return;
7173 }
7174 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
7175 if (flags & P_BOOL0x01) {
7176 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
7177 return;
7178 }
7179 }
7180 }
7181 /* handle "-=" and "+=" */
7182 if ((nextchar == '-' || nextchar == '+' || nextchar == '^') && p[1] == '=') {
7183 ++p;
7184 nextchar = '=';
7185 }
7186 if ((nextchar != '=' && nextchar != ':')
7187 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS) {
7188 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL;
7189 return;
7190 }
7191 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS && p[1] == NUL'\000') {
7192 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_OLD_SETTING;
7193 if (is_term_option)
7194 expand_option_idx = -1;
7195 else
7196 expand_option_idx = opt_idx;
7197 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
7198 return;
7199 }
7200 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
7201 if (is_term_option || (flags & P_NUM0x02))
7202 return;
7203
7204 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
7205
7206 if (flags & P_EXPAND0x10) {
7207 p = options[opt_idx].var;
7208 if (p == (char_u *)&p_bdir
7209 || p == (char_u *)&p_dir
7210 || p == (char_u *)&p_path
7211 || p == (char_u *)&p_rtp
7212 || p == (char_u *)&p_cdpath
7213 || p == (char_u *)&p_vdir
7214 ) {
7215 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_DIRECTORIES;
7216 if (p == (char_u *)&p_path
7217 || p == (char_u *)&p_cdpath
7218 )
7219 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_THREE2;
7220 else
7221 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_ONE1;
7222 } else {
7223 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_FILES;
7224 /* for 'tags' need three backslashes for a space */
7225 if (p == (char_u *)&p_tags)
7226 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_THREE2;
7227 else
7228 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_ONE1;
7229 }
7230 }
7231
7232 /* For an option that is a list of file names, find the start of the
7233 * last file name. */
7234 for (p = arg + STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)) - 1; p > xp->xp_pattern; --p) {
7235 /* count number of backslashes before ' ' or ',' */
7236 if (*p == ' ' || *p == ',') {
7237 s = p;
7238 while (s > xp->xp_pattern && *(s - 1) == '\\')
7239 --s;
7240 if ((*p == ' ' && (xp->xp_backslash == XP_BS_THREE2 && (p - s) < 3))
7241 || (*p == ',' && (flags & P_COMMA0x8000) && ((p - s) & 1) == 0)) {
7242 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
7243 break;
7244 }
7245 }
7246
7247 /* for 'spellsuggest' start at "file:" */
7248 if (options[opt_idx].var == (char_u *)&p_sps
7249 && STRNCMP(p, "file:", 5)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("file:"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
7250 xp->xp_pattern = p + 5;
7251 break;
7252 }
7253 }
7254
7255 return;
7256}
7257
7258int ExpandSettings(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, int *num_file, char_u ***file)
7259{
7260 int num_normal = 0; /* Nr of matching non-term-code settings */
7261 int num_term = 0; /* Nr of matching terminal code settings */
7262 int opt_idx;
7263 int match;
7264 int count = 0;
7265 char_u *str;
7266 int loop;
7267 int is_term_opt;
7268 char_u name_buf[MAX_KEY_NAME_LEN25];
7269 static char *(names[]) = {"all", "termcap"};
7270 int ic = regmatch->rm_ic; /* remember the ignore-case flag */
7271
7272 /* do this loop twice:
7273 * loop == 0: count the number of matching options
7274 * loop == 1: copy the matching options into allocated memory
7275 */
7276 for (loop = 0; loop <= 1; ++loop) {
7277 regmatch->rm_ic = ic;
7278 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS) {
7279 for (match = 0; match < (int)(sizeof(names) / sizeof(char *));
7280 ++match)
7281 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, (char_u *)names[match], (colnr_T)0)) {
7282 if (loop == 0)
7283 num_normal++;
7284 else
7285 (*file)[count++] = vim_strsave((char_u *)names[match]);
7286 }
7287 }
7288 for (opt_idx = 0; (str = (char_u *)options[opt_idx].fullname) != NULL((void*)0);
7289 opt_idx++) {
7290 if (options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0))
7291 continue;
7292 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS
7293 && !(options[opt_idx].flags & P_BOOL0x01))
7294 continue;
7295 is_term_opt = istermoption(&options[opt_idx]);
7296 if (is_term_opt && num_normal > 0)
7297 continue;
7298 match = FALSE0;
7299 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, str, (colnr_T)0)
7300 || (options[opt_idx].shortname != NULL((void*)0)
7301 && vim_regexec(regmatch,
7302 (char_u *)options[opt_idx].shortname, (colnr_T)0)))
7303 match = TRUE1;
7304 else if (is_term_opt) {
7305 name_buf[0] = '<';
7306 name_buf[1] = 't';
7307 name_buf[2] = '_';
7308 name_buf[3] = str[2];
7309 name_buf[4] = str[3];
7310 name_buf[5] = '>';
7311 name_buf[6] = NUL'\000';
7312 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, name_buf, (colnr_T)0)) {
7313 match = TRUE1;
7314 str = name_buf;
7315 }
7316 }
7317 if (match) {
7318 if (loop == 0) {
7319 if (is_term_opt)
7320 num_term++;
7321 else
7322 num_normal++;
7323 } else
7324 (*file)[count++] = vim_strsave(str);
7325 }
7326 }
7327 /*
7328 * Check terminal key codes, these are not in the option table
7329 */
7330 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS && num_normal == 0) {
7331 for (opt_idx = 0; (str = get_termcode(opt_idx)) != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++) {
7332 if (!isprint(str[0])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[0]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISprint) || !isprint(str[1])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[1]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISprint))
7333 continue;
7334
7335 name_buf[0] = 't';
7336 name_buf[1] = '_';
7337 name_buf[2] = str[0];
7338 name_buf[3] = str[1];
7339 name_buf[4] = NUL'\000';
7340
7341 match = FALSE0;
7342 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, name_buf, (colnr_T)0))
7343 match = TRUE1;
7344 else {
7345 name_buf[0] = '<';
7346 name_buf[1] = 't';
7347 name_buf[2] = '_';
7348 name_buf[3] = str[0];
7349 name_buf[4] = str[1];
7350 name_buf[5] = '>';
7351 name_buf[6] = NUL'\000';
7352
7353 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, name_buf, (colnr_T)0))
7354 match = TRUE1;
7355 }
7356 if (match) {
7357 if (loop == 0)
7358 num_term++;
7359 else
7360 (*file)[count++] = vim_strsave(name_buf);
7361 }
7362 }
7363
7364 /*
7365 * Check special key names.
7366 */
7367 regmatch->rm_ic = TRUE1; /* ignore case here */
7368 for (opt_idx = 0; (str = get_key_name(opt_idx)) != NULL((void*)0); opt_idx++) {
7369 name_buf[0] = '<';
7370 STRCPY(name_buf + 1, str)strcpy((char *)(name_buf + 1), (char *)(str));
7371 STRCAT(name_buf, ">")strcat((char *)(name_buf), (char *)(">"));
7372
7373 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, name_buf, (colnr_T)0)) {
7374 if (loop == 0)
7375 num_term++;
7376 else
7377 (*file)[count++] = vim_strsave(name_buf);
7378 }
7379 }
7380 }
7381 if (loop == 0) {
7382 if (num_normal > 0)
7383 *num_file = num_normal;
7384 else if (num_term > 0)
7385 *num_file = num_term;
7386 else
7387 return OK1;
7388 *file = (char_u **)xmalloc(*num_file * sizeof(char_u *));
7389 }
7390 }
7391 return OK1;
7392}
7393
7394void ExpandOldSetting(int *num_file, char_u ***file)
7395{
7396 char_u *var = NULL((void*)0);
7397
7398 *num_file = 0;
7399 *file = (char_u **)xmalloc(sizeof(char_u *));
7400
7401 /*
7402 * For a terminal key code expand_option_idx is < 0.
7403 */
7404 if (expand_option_idx < 0) {
7405 var = find_termcode(expand_option_name + 2);
7406 if (var == NULL((void*)0))
7407 expand_option_idx = findoption(expand_option_name);
7408 }
7409
7410 if (expand_option_idx >= 0) {
7411 /* put string of option value in NameBuff */
7412 option_value2string(&options[expand_option_idx], expand_option_flags);
7413 var = NameBuff;
7414 } else if (var == NULL((void*)0))
7415 var = (char_u *)"";
7416
7417 /* A backslash is required before some characters. This is the reverse of
7418 * what happens in do_set(). */
7419 char_u *buf = vim_strsave_escaped(var, escape_chars);
7420
7421#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
7422 /* For MS-Windows et al. we don't double backslashes at the start and
7423 * before a file name character. */
7424 for (var = buf; *var != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(var)var += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(var) : 1)
7425 if (var[0] == '\\' && var[1] == '\\'
7426 && expand_option_idx >= 0
7427 && (options[expand_option_idx].flags & P_EXPAND0x10)
7428 && vim_isfilec(var[2])
7429 && (var[2] != '\\' || (var == buf && var[4] != '\\')))
7430 STRMOVE(var, var + 1)memmove((var), (var + 1), strlen((char *)(var + 1)) + 1);
7431#endif
7432
7433 *file[0] = buf;
7434 *num_file = 1;
7435}
7436
7437/*
7438 * Get the value for the numeric or string option *opp in a nice format into
7439 * NameBuff[]. Must not be called with a hidden option!
7440 */
7441static void
7442option_value2string (
7443 struct vimoption *opp,
7444 int opt_flags /* OPT_GLOBAL and/or OPT_LOCAL */
7445)
7446{
7447 char_u *varp;
7448
7449 varp = get_varp_scope(opp, opt_flags);
7450
7451 if (opp->flags & P_NUM0x02) {
7452 long wc = 0;
7453
7454 if (wc_use_keyname(varp, &wc))
7455 STRCPY(NameBuff, get_special_key_name((int)wc, 0))strcpy((char *)(NameBuff), (char *)(get_special_key_name((int
)wc, 0)));
7456 else if (wc != 0)
7457 STRCPY(NameBuff, transchar((int)wc))strcpy((char *)(NameBuff), (char *)(transchar((int)wc)));
7458 else
7459 sprintf((char *)NameBuff, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)*(long *)varp);
7460 } else { /* P_STRING */
7461 varp = *(char_u **)(varp);
7462 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) /* just in case */
7463 NameBuff[0] = NUL'\000';
7464 else if (opp->flags & P_EXPAND0x10)
7465 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), varp, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, FALSE0);
7466 /* Translate 'pastetoggle' into special key names */
7467 else if ((char_u **)opp->var == &p_pt)
7468 str2specialbuf(p_pt, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096);
7469 else
7470 STRLCPY(NameBuff, varp, MAXPATHL)xstrlcpy((char *)(NameBuff), (char *)(varp), (size_t)(4096));
7471 }
7472}
7473
7474/*
7475 * Return TRUE if "varp" points to 'wildchar' or 'wildcharm' and it can be
7476 * printed as a keyname.
7477 * "*wcp" is set to the value of the option if it's 'wildchar' or 'wildcharm'.
7478 */
7479static int wc_use_keyname(char_u *varp, long *wcp)
7480{
7481 if (((long *)varp == &p_wc) || ((long *)varp == &p_wcm)) {
7482 *wcp = *(long *)varp;
7483 if (IS_SPECIAL(*wcp)((*wcp) < 0) || find_special_key_in_table((int)*wcp) >= 0)
7484 return TRUE1;
7485 }
7486 return FALSE0;
7487}
7488
7489/*
7490 * Any character has an equivalent 'langmap' character. This is used for
7491 * keyboards that have a special language mode that sends characters above
7492 * 128 (although other characters can be translated too). The "to" field is a
7493 * Vim command character. This avoids having to switch the keyboard back to
7494 * ASCII mode when leaving Insert mode.
7495 *
7496 * langmap_mapchar[] maps any of 256 chars to an ASCII char used for Vim
7497 * commands.
7498 * langmap_mapga.ga_data is a sorted table of langmap_entry_T.
7499 * This does the same as langmap_mapchar[] for characters >= 256.
7500 */
7501/*
7502 * With multi-byte support use growarray for 'langmap' chars >= 256
7503 */
7504typedef struct {
7505 int from;
7506 int to;
7507} langmap_entry_T;
7508
7509static garray_T langmap_mapga = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE{ 0, 0, 0, 1, ((void*)0) };
7510
7511/*
7512 * Search for an entry in "langmap_mapga" for "from". If found set the "to"
7513 * field. If not found insert a new entry at the appropriate location.
7514 */
7515static void langmap_set_entry(int from, int to)
7516{
7517 langmap_entry_T *entries = (langmap_entry_T *)(langmap_mapga.ga_data);
7518 int a = 0;
7519 int b = langmap_mapga.ga_len;
7520
7521 /* Do a binary search for an existing entry. */
7522 while (a != b) {
7523 int i = (a + b) / 2;
7524 int d = entries[i].from - from;
7525
7526 if (d == 0) {
7527 entries[i].to = to;
7528 return;
7529 }
7530 if (d < 0)
7531 a = i + 1;
7532 else
7533 b = i;
7534 }
7535
7536 ga_grow(&langmap_mapga, 1);
7537
7538 /* insert new entry at position "a" */
7539 entries = (langmap_entry_T *)(langmap_mapga.ga_data) + a;
7540 memmove(entries + 1, entries,
7541 (langmap_mapga.ga_len - a) * sizeof(langmap_entry_T));
7542 ++langmap_mapga.ga_len;
7543 entries[0].from = from;
7544 entries[0].to = to;
7545}
7546
7547/*
7548 * Apply 'langmap' to multi-byte character "c" and return the result.
7549 */
7550int langmap_adjust_mb(int c)
7551{
7552 langmap_entry_T *entries = (langmap_entry_T *)(langmap_mapga.ga_data);
7553 int a = 0;
7554 int b = langmap_mapga.ga_len;
7555
7556 while (a != b) {
7557 int i = (a + b) / 2;
7558 int d = entries[i].from - c;
7559
7560 if (d == 0)
7561 return entries[i].to; /* found matching entry */
7562 if (d < 0)
7563 a = i + 1;
7564 else
7565 b = i;
7566 }
7567 return c; /* no entry found, return "c" unmodified */
7568}
7569
7570static void langmap_init(void)
7571{
7572 int i;
7573
7574 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
7575 langmap_mapchar[i] = i; /* we init with a one-to-one map */
7576 ga_init(&langmap_mapga, sizeof(langmap_entry_T), 8);
7577}
7578
7579/*
7580 * Called when langmap option is set; the language map can be
7581 * changed at any time!
7582 */
7583static void langmap_set(void)
7584{
7585 char_u *p;
7586 char_u *p2;
7587 int from, to;
7588
7589 ga_clear(&langmap_mapga); /* clear the previous map first */
7590 langmap_init(); /* back to one-to-one map */
7591
7592 for (p = p_langmap; p[0] != NUL'\000'; ) {
7593 for (p2 = p; p2[0] != NUL'\000' && p2[0] != ',' && p2[0] != ';';
7594 mb_ptr_adv(p2)p2 += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p2) : 1) {
7595 if (p2[0] == '\\' && p2[1] != NUL'\000')
7596 ++p2;
7597 }
7598 if (p2[0] == ';')
7599 ++p2; /* abcd;ABCD form, p2 points to A */
7600 else
7601 p2 = NULL((void*)0); /* aAbBcCdD form, p2 is NULL */
7602 while (p[0]) {
7603 if (p[0] == ',') {
7604 ++p;
7605 break;
7606 }
7607 if (p[0] == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000')
7608 ++p;
7609 from = (*mb_ptr2char)(p);
7610 to = NUL'\000';
7611 if (p2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
7612 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
7613 if (p[0] != ',') {
7614 if (p[0] == '\\')
7615 ++p;
7616 to = (*mb_ptr2char)(p);
7617 }
7618 } else {
7619 if (p2[0] != ',') {
7620 if (p2[0] == '\\')
7621 ++p2;
7622 to = (*mb_ptr2char)(p2);
7623 }
7624 }
7625 if (to == NUL'\000') {
7626 EMSG2(_("E357: 'langmap': Matching character missing for %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E357: 'langmap': Matching character missing for %s"
))), (char_u *)(transchar(from)))
7627 transchar(from))emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E357: 'langmap': Matching character missing for %s"
))), (char_u *)(transchar(from)));
7628 return;
7629 }
7630
7631 if (from >= 256)
7632 langmap_set_entry(from, to);
7633 else
7634 langmap_mapchar[from & 255] = to;
7635
7636 /* Advance to next pair */
7637 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
7638 if (p2 != NULL((void*)0)) {
7639 mb_ptr_adv(p2)p2 += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p2) : 1;
7640 if (*p == ';') {
7641 p = p2;
7642 if (p[0] != NUL'\000') {
7643 if (p[0] != ',') {
7644 EMSG2(_(emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E358: 'langmap': Extra characters after semicolon: %s"
))), (char_u *)(p))
7645 "E358: 'langmap': Extra characters after semicolon: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E358: 'langmap': Extra characters after semicolon: %s"
))), (char_u *)(p))
7646 p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E358: 'langmap': Extra characters after semicolon: %s"
))), (char_u *)(p));
7647 return;
7648 }
7649 ++p;
7650 }
7651 break;
7652 }
7653 }
7654 }
7655 }
7656}
7657
7658/*
7659 * Return TRUE if format option 'x' is in effect.
7660 * Take care of no formatting when 'paste' is set.
7661 */
7662int has_format_option(int x)
7663{
7664 if (p_paste)
7665 return FALSE0;
7666 return vim_strchr(curbuf->b_p_fo, x) != NULL((void*)0);
7667}
7668
7669/*
7670 * Return TRUE if "x" is present in 'shortmess' option, or
7671 * 'shortmess' contains 'a' and "x" is present in SHM_A.
7672 */
7673int shortmess(int x)
7674{
7675 return p_shm != NULL((void*)0) &&
7676 ( vim_strchr(p_shm, x) != NULL((void*)0)
7677 || (vim_strchr(p_shm, 'a') != NULL((void*)0)
7678 && vim_strchr((char_u *)SHM_A"rmfixlnw", x) != NULL((void*)0)));
7679}
7680
7681/*
7682 * paste_option_changed() - Called after p_paste was set or reset.
7683 */
7684static void paste_option_changed(void)
7685{
7686 static int old_p_paste = FALSE0;
7687 static int save_sm = 0;
7688 static int save_ru = 0;
7689 static int save_ri = 0;
7690 static int save_hkmap = 0;
7691
7692 if (p_paste) {
7693 /*
7694 * Paste switched from off to on.
7695 * Save the current values, so they can be restored later.
7696 */
7697 if (!old_p_paste) {
7698 /* save options for each buffer */
7699 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
7700 buf->b_p_tw_nopaste = buf->b_p_tw;
7701 buf->b_p_wm_nopaste = buf->b_p_wm;
7702 buf->b_p_sts_nopaste = buf->b_p_sts;
7703 buf->b_p_ai_nopaste = buf->b_p_ai;
7704 }
7705
7706 /* save global options */
7707 save_sm = p_sm;
7708 save_ru = p_ru;
7709 save_ri = p_ri;
7710 save_hkmap = p_hkmap;
7711 /* save global values for local buffer options */
7712 p_tw_nopaste = p_tw;
7713 p_wm_nopaste = p_wm;
7714 p_sts_nopaste = p_sts;
7715 p_ai_nopaste = p_ai;
7716 }
7717
7718 /*
7719 * Always set the option values, also when 'paste' is set when it is
7720 * already on.
7721 */
7722 /* set options for each buffer */
7723 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
7724 buf->b_p_tw = 0; /* textwidth is 0 */
7725 buf->b_p_wm = 0; /* wrapmargin is 0 */
7726 buf->b_p_sts = 0; /* softtabstop is 0 */
7727 buf->b_p_ai = 0; /* no auto-indent */
7728 }
7729
7730 /* set global options */
7731 p_sm = 0; /* no showmatch */
7732 if (p_ru)
7733 status_redraw_all(); /* redraw to remove the ruler */
7734 p_ru = 0; /* no ruler */
7735 p_ri = 0; /* no reverse insert */
7736 p_hkmap = 0; /* no Hebrew keyboard */
7737 /* set global values for local buffer options */
7738 p_tw = 0;
7739 p_wm = 0;
7740 p_sts = 0;
7741 p_ai = 0;
7742 }
7743 /*
7744 * Paste switched from on to off: Restore saved values.
7745 */
7746 else if (old_p_paste) {
7747 /* restore options for each buffer */
7748 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
7749 buf->b_p_tw = buf->b_p_tw_nopaste;
7750 buf->b_p_wm = buf->b_p_wm_nopaste;
7751 buf->b_p_sts = buf->b_p_sts_nopaste;
7752 buf->b_p_ai = buf->b_p_ai_nopaste;
7753 }
7754
7755 /* restore global options */
7756 p_sm = save_sm;
7757 if (p_ru != save_ru)
7758 status_redraw_all(); /* redraw to draw the ruler */
7759 p_ru = save_ru;
7760 p_ri = save_ri;
7761 p_hkmap = save_hkmap;
7762 /* set global values for local buffer options */
7763 p_tw = p_tw_nopaste;
7764 p_wm = p_wm_nopaste;
7765 p_sts = p_sts_nopaste;
7766 p_ai = p_ai_nopaste;
7767 }
7768
7769 old_p_paste = p_paste;
7770}
7771
7772/*
7773 * vimrc_found() - Called when a ".vimrc" or "VIMINIT" has been found.
7774 *
7775 * Reset 'compatible' and set the values for options that didn't get set yet
7776 * to the Vim defaults.
7777 * Don't do this if the 'compatible' option has been set or reset before.
7778 * When "fname" is not NULL, use it to set $"envname" when it wasn't set yet.
7779 */
7780void vimrc_found(char_u *fname, char_u *envname)
7781{
7782 int opt_idx;
7783 int dofree = FALSE0;
7784 char_u *p;
7785
7786 if (!option_was_set((char_u *)"cp")) {
7787 p_cp = FALSE0;
7788 for (opt_idx = 0; !istermoption(&options[opt_idx]); opt_idx++)
7789 if (!(options[opt_idx].flags & (P_WAS_SET0x100|P_VI_DEF0x400)))
7790 set_option_default(opt_idx, OPT_FREE1, FALSE0);
7791 didset_options();
7792 }
7793
7794 if (fname != NULL((void*)0)) {
7795 p = vim_getenv(envname, &dofree);
7796 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
7797 /* Set $MYVIMRC to the first vimrc file found. */
7798 p = FullName_save(fname, FALSE0);
7799 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
7800 vim_setenv(envname, p);
7801 free(p);
7802 }
7803 } else if (dofree)
7804 free(p);
7805 }
7806}
7807
7808/*
7809 * Set 'compatible' on or off. Called for "-C" and "-N" command line arg.
7810 */
7811void change_compatible(int on)
7812{
7813 int opt_idx;
7814
7815 if (p_cp != on) {
7816 p_cp = on;
7817 compatible_set();
7818 }
7819 opt_idx = findoption((char_u *)"cp");
7820 if (opt_idx >= 0)
7821 options[opt_idx].flags |= P_WAS_SET0x100;
7822}
7823
7824/*
7825 * Return TRUE when option "name" has been set.
7826 * Only works correctly for global options.
7827 */
7828int option_was_set(char_u *name)
7829{
7830 int idx;
7831
7832 idx = findoption(name);
7833 if (idx < 0) /* unknown option */
7834 return FALSE0;
7835 if (options[idx].flags & P_WAS_SET0x100)
7836 return TRUE1;
7837 return FALSE0;
7838}
7839
7840/*
7841 * Reset the flag indicating option "name" was set.
7842 */
7843void reset_option_was_set(char_u *name)
7844{
7845 int idx = findoption(name);
7846
7847 if (idx >= 0)
7848 options[idx].flags &= ~P_WAS_SET0x100;
7849}
7850
7851/*
7852 * compatible_set() - Called when 'compatible' has been set or unset.
7853 *
7854 * When 'compatible' set: Set all relevant options (those that have the P_VIM)
7855 * flag) to a Vi compatible value.
7856 * When 'compatible' is unset: Set all options that have a different default
7857 * for Vim (without the P_VI_DEF flag) to that default.
7858 */
7859static void compatible_set(void)
7860{
7861 int opt_idx;
7862
7863 for (opt_idx = 0; !istermoption(&options[opt_idx]); opt_idx++)
7864 if ( ((options[opt_idx].flags & P_VIM0x800) && p_cp)
7865 || (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_VI_DEF0x400) && !p_cp))
7866 set_option_default(opt_idx, OPT_FREE1, p_cp);
7867 didset_options();
7868}
7869
7870/*
7871 * fill_breakat_flags() -- called when 'breakat' changes value.
7872 */
7873static void fill_breakat_flags(void)
7874{
7875 char_u *p;
7876 int i;
7877
7878 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
7879 breakat_flags[i] = FALSE0;
7880
7881 if (p_breakat != NULL((void*)0))
7882 for (p = p_breakat; *p; p++)
7883 breakat_flags[*p] = TRUE1;
7884}
7885
7886/*
7887 * Check an option that can be a range of string values.
7888 *
7889 * Return OK for correct value, FAIL otherwise.
7890 * Empty is always OK.
7891 */
7892static int
7893check_opt_strings (
7894 char_u *val,
7895 char **values,
7896 int list /* when TRUE: accept a list of values */
7897)
7898{
7899 return opt_strings_flags(val, values, NULL((void*)0), list);
7900}
7901
7902/*
7903 * Handle an option that can be a range of string values.
7904 * Set a flag in "*flagp" for each string present.
7905 *
7906 * Return OK for correct value, FAIL otherwise.
7907 * Empty is always OK.
7908 */
7909static int
7910opt_strings_flags (
7911 char_u *val, /* new value */
7912 char **values, /* array of valid string values */
7913 unsigned *flagp,
7914 int list /* when TRUE: accept a list of values */
7915)
7916{
7917 int i;
7918 int len;
7919 unsigned new_flags = 0;
7920
7921 while (*val) {
7922 for (i = 0;; ++i) {
7923 if (values[i] == NULL((void*)0)) /* val not found in values[] */
7924 return FAIL0;
7925
7926 len = (int)STRLEN(values[i])strlen((char *)(values[i]));
7927 if (STRNCMP(values[i], val, len)strncmp((char *)(values[i]), (char *)(val), (size_t)(len)) == 0
7928 && ((list && val[len] == ',') || val[len] == NUL'\000')) {
7929 val += len + (val[len] == ',');
7930 new_flags |= (1 << i);
7931 break; /* check next item in val list */
7932 }
7933 }
7934 }
7935 if (flagp != NULL((void*)0))
7936 *flagp = new_flags;
7937
7938 return OK1;
7939}
7940
7941/*
7942 * Read the 'wildmode' option, fill wim_flags[].
7943 */
7944static int check_opt_wim(void)
7945{
7946 char_u new_wim_flags[4];
7947 char_u *p;
7948 int i;
7949 int idx = 0;
7950
7951 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
7952 new_wim_flags[i] = 0;
7953
7954 for (p = p_wim; *p; ++p) {
7955 for (i = 0; ASCII_ISALPHA(p[i])(((unsigned)(p[i]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[i]) - 'a' <
26)); ++i)
7956 ;
7957 if (p[i] != NUL'\000' && p[i] != ',' && p[i] != ':')
7958 return FAIL0;
7959 if (i == 7 && STRNCMP(p, "longest", 7)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("longest"), (size_t)(7)) == 0)
7960 new_wim_flags[idx] |= WIM_LONGEST2;
7961 else if (i == 4 && STRNCMP(p, "full", 4)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("full"), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
7962 new_wim_flags[idx] |= WIM_FULL1;
7963 else if (i == 4 && STRNCMP(p, "list", 4)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("list"), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
7964 new_wim_flags[idx] |= WIM_LIST4;
7965 else
7966 return FAIL0;
7967 p += i;
7968 if (*p == NUL'\000')
7969 break;
7970 if (*p == ',') {
7971 if (idx == 3)
7972 return FAIL0;
7973 ++idx;
7974 }
7975 }
7976
7977 /* fill remaining entries with last flag */
7978 while (idx < 3) {
7979 new_wim_flags[idx + 1] = new_wim_flags[idx];
7980 ++idx;
7981 }
7982
7983 /* only when there are no errors, wim_flags[] is changed */
7984 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
7985 wim_flags[i] = new_wim_flags[i];
7986 return OK1;
7987}
7988
7989/*
7990 * Check if backspacing over something is allowed.
7991 */
7992int
7993can_bs (
7994 int what /* BS_INDENT, BS_EOL or BS_START */
7995)
7996{
7997 switch (*p_bs) {
7998 case '2': return TRUE1;
7999 case '1': return what != BS_START's';
8000 case '0': return FALSE0;
8001 }
8002 return vim_strchr(p_bs, what) != NULL((void*)0);
8003}
8004
8005/*
8006 * Save the current values of 'fileformat' and 'fileencoding', so that we know
8007 * the file must be considered changed when the value is different.
8008 */
8009void save_file_ff(buf_T *buf)
8010{
8011 buf->b_start_ffc = *buf->b_p_ff;
8012 buf->b_start_eol = buf->b_p_eol;
8013 buf->b_start_bomb = buf->b_p_bomb;
8014
8015 /* Only use free/alloc when necessary, they take time. */
8016 if (buf->b_start_fenc == NULL((void*)0)
8017 || STRCMP(buf->b_start_fenc, buf->b_p_fenc)strcmp((char *)(buf->b_start_fenc), (char *)(buf->b_p_fenc
)) != 0) {
8018 free(buf->b_start_fenc);
8019 buf->b_start_fenc = vim_strsave(buf->b_p_fenc);
8020 }
8021}
8022
8023/*
8024 * Return TRUE if 'fileformat' and/or 'fileencoding' has a different value
8025 * from when editing started (save_file_ff() called).
8026 * Also when 'endofline' was changed and 'binary' is set, or when 'bomb' was
8027 * changed and 'binary' is not set.
8028 * When "ignore_empty" is true don't consider a new, empty buffer to be
8029 * changed.
8030 */
8031int file_ff_differs(buf_T *buf, int ignore_empty)
8032{
8033 /* In a buffer that was never loaded the options are not valid. */
8034 if (buf->b_flags & BF_NEVERLOADED0x04)
8035 return FALSE0;
8036 if (ignore_empty
8037 && (buf->b_flags & BF_NEW0x10)
8038 && buf->b_ml.ml_line_count == 1
8039 && *ml_get_buf(buf, (linenr_T)1, FALSE0) == NUL'\000')
8040 return FALSE0;
8041 if (buf->b_start_ffc != *buf->b_p_ff)
8042 return TRUE1;
8043 if (buf->b_p_bin && buf->b_start_eol != buf->b_p_eol)
8044 return TRUE1;
8045 if (!buf->b_p_bin && buf->b_start_bomb != buf->b_p_bomb)
8046 return TRUE1;
8047 if (buf->b_start_fenc == NULL((void*)0))
8048 return *buf->b_p_fenc != NUL'\000';
8049 return STRCMP(buf->b_start_fenc, buf->b_p_fenc)strcmp((char *)(buf->b_start_fenc), (char *)(buf->b_p_fenc
)) != 0;
8050}
8051
8052/*
8053 * return OK if "p" is a valid fileformat name, FAIL otherwise.
8054 */
8055int check_ff_value(char_u *p)
8056{
8057 return check_opt_strings(p, p_ff_values, FALSE0);
8058}
8059
8060/*
8061 * Return the effective shiftwidth value for current buffer, using the
8062 * 'tabstop' value when 'shiftwidth' is zero.
8063 */
8064long get_sw_value(buf_T *buf)
8065{
8066 return buf->b_p_sw ? buf->b_p_sw : buf->b_p_ts;
8067}
8068
8069/*
8070 * Return the effective softtabstop value for the current buffer, using the
8071 * 'tabstop' value when 'softtabstop' is negative.
8072 */
8073long get_sts_value(void)
8074{
8075 return curbuf->b_p_sts < 0 ? get_sw_value(curbuf) : curbuf->b_p_sts;
8076}
8077
8078/*
8079 * Check matchpairs option for "*initc".
8080 * If there is a match set "*initc" to the matching character and "*findc" to
8081 * the opposite character. Set "*backwards" to the direction.
8082 * When "switchit" is TRUE swap the direction.
8083 */
8084void find_mps_values(int *initc, int *findc, int *backwards, int switchit)
8085{
8086 char_u *ptr;
8087
8088 ptr = curbuf->b_p_mps;
8089 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
8090 if (has_mbyte) {
8091 char_u *prev;
8092
8093 if (mb_ptr2char(ptr) == *initc) {
8094 if (switchit) {
8095 *findc = *initc;
8096 *initc = mb_ptr2char(ptr + mb_ptr2len(ptr) + 1);
8097 *backwards = TRUE1;
8098 } else {
8099 *findc = mb_ptr2char(ptr + mb_ptr2len(ptr) + 1);
8100 *backwards = FALSE0;
8101 }
8102 return;
8103 }
8104 prev = ptr;
8105 ptr += mb_ptr2len(ptr) + 1;
8106 if (mb_ptr2char(ptr) == *initc) {
8107 if (switchit) {
8108 *findc = *initc;
8109 *initc = mb_ptr2char(prev);
8110 *backwards = FALSE0;
8111 } else {
8112 *findc = mb_ptr2char(prev);
8113 *backwards = TRUE1;
8114 }
8115 return;
8116 }
8117 ptr += mb_ptr2len(ptr);
8118 } else {
8119 if (*ptr == *initc) {
8120 if (switchit) {
8121 *backwards = TRUE1;
8122 *findc = *initc;
8123 *initc = ptr[2];
8124 } else {
8125 *backwards = FALSE0;
8126 *findc = ptr[2];
8127 }
8128 return;
8129 }
8130 ptr += 2;
8131 if (*ptr == *initc) {
8132 if (switchit) {
8133 *backwards = FALSE0;
8134 *findc = *initc;
8135 *initc = ptr[-2];
8136 } else {
8137 *backwards = TRUE1;
8138 *findc = ptr[-2];
8139 }
8140 return;
8141 }
8142 ++ptr;
8143 }
8144 if (*ptr == ',')
8145 ++ptr;
8146 }
8147}
8148
8149/* This is called when 'breakindentopt' is changed and when a window is
8150 initialized */
8151int briopt_check(void)
8152{
8153 char_u *p;
8154 int bri_shift = 0;
8155 long bri_min = 20;
8156 bool_Bool bri_sbr = false0;
8157
8158 p = curwin->w_p_brioptw_onebuf_opt.wo_briopt;
8159 while (*p != NUL'\000')
8160 {
8161 if (STRNCMP(p, "shift:", 6)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("shift:"), (size_t)(6)) == 0
8162 && ((p[6] == '-' && VIM_ISDIGIT(p[7])((unsigned)(p[7]) - '0' < 10)) || VIM_ISDIGIT(p[6])((unsigned)(p[6]) - '0' < 10)))
8163 {
8164 p += 6;
8165 bri_shift = getdigits(&p);
8166 }
8167 else if (STRNCMP(p, "min:", 4)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("min:"), (size_t)(4)) == 0 && VIM_ISDIGIT(p[4])((unsigned)(p[4]) - '0' < 10))
8168 {
8169 p += 4;
8170 bri_min = getdigits(&p);
8171 }
8172 else if (STRNCMP(p, "sbr", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("sbr"), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
8173 {
8174 p += 3;
8175 bri_sbr = true1;
8176 }
8177 if (*p != ',' && *p != NUL'\000')
8178 return FAIL0;
8179 if (*p == ',')
8180 ++p;
8181 }
8182
8183 curwin->w_p_brishift = bri_shift;
8184 curwin->w_p_brimin = bri_min;
8185 curwin->w_p_brisbr = bri_sbr;
8186
8187 return OK1;
8188}
8189
